loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 27 years old, married and has 2 children. She lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga.

Janice has been selling barbequed food for 3 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase housing materials (cement, plywood, etc.) needed to repair her house. Janice has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase housing materials to repair her house

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Aiyda

texts.en: Aiyda is a 24-year-old young woman. She is married and has two sons and one daughter. She lives in Jabalia refugee camp located in Gaza Strip in Palestine. Her husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary. Aiyda wants to improve her family life conditions by purchasing new home furniture, but the amount of money Aiyda has isn't enough to pay, so she needs to take a loan from FATEN of $1,500. When Aiyda gets the loan, which is repaid on a monthly basis, she will be able to purchase new home furniture and live with her family in healthy, comfortable home conditions. Aiyda is a conservative woman, so her husband is photographed instead in FATEN's branch.

loans.use: To purchase new home furniture

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en:
Fatima is a 27-year-old single woman living with her parents. She has seven years of experience working as a hairdresser. She started running her own business seven years ago. 

With her requested loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua, she will buy hairdressing and beauty products necessary to run her business. Her house is her working place, and this is suitable for most of her customers because they feel relaxed as if they are at home.

This is Fatima's first experience with Al Majmoua. She hopes to improve her standard of living. She expects to open a larger beauty salon in the future to meet all of her customers' needs and requests.

loans.use: to buy hairdressing and beauty products necessary for her business.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
La Señora Marta tiene 52 años D. edad, está casada y tiene con 4 hijos, es D. la ciudad D. Paraguarí, desD. hace más D. 15 años vive en casa propia con su marido el Señor Angel.
Marta se dedica a la venta D. chipa desD. hace más D. 2 años con su marido y dos hijas que también empezaron a  trabajar en el mismo ramo ya que con el obtienen muy buen ingreso mensual aparte D. que tienen una clientela  y zona D. venta formada.
Ella comenta que su negocio le genera muy buenos ingresos ya que la chipa, en Paraguay, es muy consumida por todos. Dice que es un negocio con el cual le gustaría poder seguir e ir creciendo más y más cada día.
Ella solicita el crédito para la compra D. materia prima, como ser almidón, manteca, harina, huevo, queso y otros para la elaboración D. la chipa.
texts.en:
Marta, 52, is married with four children.  She's from the city of Paraguarí and has lived in her own house with her husband Angel for more than 15 years.

Marta has been selling "chipa" [cheese rolls] for more than two years with her husband and two daughters, who also began to work in the same field since they receive a very good monthly income as well as having customers and an established sales area.

Marta says that her business generates very good earnings for her since everyone in Paraguay eats "chipa."  She would like to be able to continue with the business and grow with it more and more every day.

She is requesting the loan to buy manioc starch, lard, flour, eggs, cheese, and other ingredients to make "chipa."

loans.use: to buy manioc starch, lard, flour, eggs, cheese, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en:
Patricia is 56 years old and married with seven children.

Patricia works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries in her sari-sari store.

Patricia has borrowed and paid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for three years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Patricia aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Mariano

texts.en:
Mariano said, "Being a farmer is a challenging profession, it requires more patience and sacrifices to have a plentiful harvest".  

Mariano has been a farmer for more than 30 years, planting and harvesting rice for sale. At his age of 51, he manages and supports his family and educates his only child. Sometimes they experience financial difficulty, especially when they have low production of rice, but through hard work they are able look for other sources of income in order to meet their needs.

Due to the high cost of commodities, Mariano wants to ask for a loan of PHP 15,000 to buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay for labor cost required in planting rice. He mentioned that he will use this loan in the improvement of his rice farming business to increase his yield and income for this coming harvest season.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides and pay labor cost

loans.name: Francisco Luis

texts.es:
Desde muy niño Francisco supo lo que es carecer de los recursos económicos para tener una niñez tranquila, situación que lo llevó a muy corta edad a trabajar en la venta de verduras.  Actualmente, tiene 30 años y con la experiencia adquirida durante dos décadas de trabajo imparable, ha logrado posicionarse entre los clientes que ya lo reconocen por ser proveedor de tomates, pepinos, pimentones y aguacates frescos, en la plaza de mercado del Municipio de Rionegro – Antioquia.

En este momento, Francisco tiene la necesidad de comprar surtido para su negocio, así como canastas en las cuales pueda exhibir sus productos; sin embargo, carece de los recursos económicos para acceder a ellos.  Está convencido, de que al contar con el capital que requiere, podrá satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus clientes y, por supuesto, tener más ingresos para vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Since childhood, Francisco knew what it was like to lack economic resources to have a tranquil childhood, a situation that pushed him from a very young age into working selling vegetables.  Currently, he’s been working for 30 years and with the experience he’s gained over two decades of non-stop work he’s managed to position himself among customers who recognize him as a supplier of fresh tomatoes, cucumbers, peppers and avocadoes in the town market in Rionegro, Antiquia.

At present, Francisco needs to buy a supply for his business as well as baskets to display his products.  However, he lacks the economic resources to do so.  He’s convinced that if he had the capital he needs he’d be able to better meet his customers’ needs and, of course, have more income to live better.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise and baskets for the vegetables.

loans.name: Gulomzhon

texts.ru: Гуломчон молодой перспективный целеустремленный человек. У него прекрасная жена и двое маленьких детей. Он очень заботливый семьянин. старается создать все условия для своих детей. Для достижения этих планов он наметил построить новый дом от доходов , полученных от предпринимательства. Он занимается выращиванием и откормом скота. Это очень доходоприносящий бизнес. В свободное время также предоставляет услуги такси на своей машине. Он хочет получить займ для заложения фундамента нового дома, для покупки стройматериалов. Он заранее благодарит КИВА за поддержку.
texts.en: Gulomzhon is an up-and-coming, driven young man. He has a wonderful wife and two young children. He is a very caring family man and is trying to create good living conditions for his children. To achieve these plans he setting out to build a new house from the profits of his business. His work is raising and feeding cattle. It is a very profitable business. In his free time, he also provides a taxi service using his car. He is requesting a loan to lay the foundation of the new house and to buy building materials. He thanks Kiva in advance for the support.

loans.use: Purchase building materials

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is married with two children. Delia is 46-years-old and lives in Carmen Annex, Ozamiz City.

Delia sells cosmetic products such as Avon products like perfume, lotion, beauty products and other cosmetics to earn a living and has had this business for 10 years. Each month she earns PHP 10,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan for PHP 10,000 to purchase cosmetic products such as Avon products to sell.

Delia has been a member of PMPC for 4 years. In the future, Ester hopes to save money for her children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetic products such as Avon products to sell.

loans.name: La

texts.en:
La is a married mother of 6 and she is 51 years old.

La owns & operates a business venture, selling lavalavas ("bottom-half" skirt-like wrap-around prints worn by both men and women).  She has many years of experience in this business. La needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, La joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is La's 1st loan with SPBD. 

*SPBD evaluates the living conditions of each of its borrowers.  Generally, a loan manager evaluates a variety of social metrics on a scale out of 3 (the higher the number, the better off the person is) and these are averaged for the "overall social metric score."  For example, a 3 out of 3 on "level of education" would mean that the borrower has graduated from university.  

About SPBD 
In 2000, Greg Casagrande founded SPBD to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem. Please join SPBD's lending team on KIVA to receive on-the-spot updates on SPBD.  "

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Blessed Group

texts.en: This is 40-year-old Jane from Machipisa, Harare. She is married with three children. Two of them are attending school. Jane runs a tailoring business. The business has been in operation for five years. She says the main challenge faced is the electricity shortage as she sometimes work during the night to cover up for time lost. Jane has requested a loan of $400 to buy material for tailoring. She says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow her to feed her family and send them to a better school. In the future, Jane plans to own a bigger factory and employ at least a significant number of employees.

loans.use: to buy tailoring material

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 30 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with two children. 
Analyn has a pigpen that she uses to grow and sell pigs. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy animal feeds for her pigs.
Analyn has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Analyn hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed for the pigs.

loans.name: Organizer

texts.en:
Organizer is twenty eight years of age and is married with four children. Organizer owns & operates a business venture, selling fried foods in the local community. She has 3 years of experience in this business. Organizer needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 500 talas or US $208 per week) to improve/expand the business.

Organizer joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Organizer's 4th loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Alfonso's Group

texts.en:
Gilberto, Alfonso and Santiago live in Santa Lucia Teotepec, a small and secluded commercial center in the Chatina Region in Oaxaca. Even though they have grid electricity access, the geographical conditions of the region and the constant rains limit their energy access due to constant blackouts. In the words of Gilberto “when it rains, it takes up to 8 days for the electricity to come back”. 

Gilberto owns a small store in the center of Santa Lucia, where he gives the town access to the only phone service, groceries, transportation to other towns, radio communication and basic products for subsistence needs. “When there is a blackout, people do not come to my store during the night, making me lose around 300 pesos (25 USD) per day of income to maintain my family and business running”. Additionally, the population cannot communicate to other towns in case of emergencies. With your loan, Gilberto will be able to have reliable lighting to offer these services to his customers, and be able to use a solar home system in case of emergencies to use the radio system when needed.

loans.use: Gilberto, Alfonso and Santiago each purchase a solar home system to have reliable energy access in their homes and business.

location.town: Santa Lucia Teotepec, Santos Reyes Nopala, Oaxaca

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie is 33 years old, married and has five children, four whom are still in school.

Rosalie is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Rosalie requested a PHP 14000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosalie has been in this business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 9 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Rosalie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy material for tailoring and to add another machine to the business.

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en: Vahid set up his business for 10 years ago. He is a father of 2 children and lives in Salyan region, Yenikand village. He breeds cows and sheep. In the beginning of his business he borrowed a loan of $500 and bought a pregnant cow. Now he needs a loan of $1000 to buy 10 sheep.

loans.use: To buy 10 sheep

loans.name: Grace Angong

texts.en: Born in 1973, Grace is married with four children. Her husband is a day-laborer making very little a day. The constant increasing needs of their children are her motivation. Being a farmer's daughter she learned how to cultivate beans and corn when she was very young. This skill coupled with her training in marketing techniques, credit management, and experience in the utilization and repayment of previous loans, and available support from group and center members makes her an excellent candidate to receive a loan. Given a loan of $400, she plans to buy farm chemicals; insecticides, fertilizer and improved-seeds, This investment will provide her community with food. She will  repay her loan during the term.

loans.use: Cultivation of Corn and Beans.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Mrs. Loan is 44 years old. She now lives with her 2 daughters and her son. Everyday she must work by repairing bicycles because she is divorced. Her daughters are students at high school. The main income from the small bicycle repair shop is $9 per person/month. She hopes to receive a loan of $75 to run her small shop so that she can continue to support her daughters at school. She will repay the loan on a monthly basis.

loans.use: To run a bicycle repair shop

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.en:
My husband runs a kiosk where he sells eggs, bread, and other similar items. I make paper envelopes for a nearby shopkeeper, who provides me his own paper, for minimal wages. I have four children in total and three of them go to school whereas the youngest one is not of school going-age yet.

We both work very hard to support our family, pay for our rented house and educate our children. With each passing day, our needs are increasing and so are our expenses. Therefore, I require to purchase the paper myself and produce envelopes that I will sell to various big shops in the city. This will in turn increase our monthly income. In addition, my husband also needs to increase the range of items for his shop. In total, we are requesting a loan of $200 USD.

loans.use: To buy paper for envelope making

loans.name: Patricio

texts.es:
Patricio is 40 year old and married. He sells CDs at the mini-bus stop. His wife sells clothes and shoes in the Okinawa Market. Patricio and his wife have had these businesses for several years. They have always sold all sorts of things. There aren’t many businesses like this in this part of the city, so there isn’t much competition. These products are accessibly priced and the prices vary with the different type of products offered. They don't have any negative credit history according to the Risk Center and the INFOCRED Bureau.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer.

PATRICIO ES UN SEÑOR CASADO DE 40 AÑOS DE EDAD, SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO DE CD´s EN LA PARADA DE MICROS. POR OTRA PARTE SU ESPOSA ATIENDE EL PUESTO DE VENTA DE ROPA Y ZAPATOS QUE SE ENCUENTRA UBICADA EN EL MERCADO DE OKINAWA. PATRICIO Y SU ESPOSA DESDE VARIOS AÑOS ATRAS CUENTAN CON ESTOS NEGOCIOS, SIEMPRE SE DEDICARON A LA COMERCIALIZACIÓN DE TODO TIPO DE COSAS. NO HAY MUCHAS VENTA VENTAS CON ESTOS TIPOS DE PRODUCTOS POR LA ZONA, POR LO QUE NO HAY MUCHA COMPETENCIA. LOS PRECIOS DE LOS PRODUCTOS TIENE UN PRECIO ACCESIBLE Y VARIADO DEBIDO A LA DIVERSIDAD DE PRODUCTOS QUE OFRECEN. EN LA CENTRAL DE RIESGO Y INFOCRED NO PRESENTAN ANTECEDENTES NEGATIVOS.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to expand clothing shop

loans.name: Nani

texts.en: Nani is 45-year-old woman. She is a tailor and usually earns a small income, just enough for the daily family needs. During the festive season, her profits could increase. Her husband, U., sells food and can earn US$5 per day.  Nanih requests a loan to expand her business and hopes that this will cover her children's tuition. She is willing to repay this loan within a period of 12 months.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Esther

texts.es:
Esther is a woman of 35, who works at selling clothing and also offers hairdressing services. She sells clothing at the Los Pozos market in the city of Santa Cruz de la Sierra, and the hairdressing services she offers at her own home, where she lives with her children since she is a single mother.

Esther has quite a bit of experience in the two lines of work she does. On the other hand, the competition in both businesses is quite high, but her senority and excellent treatment of her clients allows her to depend on steady customers who appreciate her good treatment and work.

The prices she offers are stable and vary according to the service, for example the clothing varies according to its quality and the season, and at the beauty salon, in general, the prices of the different services are standardized.

With this loan request she will buy larger quantities of clothing to supply her business and also buy some things she needs to equip the hairdressing salon. Esther will only have this credit and does not owe anyone, her credit history is good.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer.

Esther es una señora de 35 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de ropa y también ofrece servicios de peluquería. Esther vende ropa en el Mercado de Los Pozos en la ciudad de Santa Cruz de la Sierra y los servicios de peluquería los ofrece en su mismo domicilio, lugar donde vive sólo con sus hijos ya que s una madre soltera.

Esther tiene bastante experiencia en el los dos rubros que se desempeña, por otra parte en ambos negocios la competencia es bastante elevada, pero su antiguedad y su excelente trato a sus clientes le permite contar con demandantes fijos que aprecian su buen trato y desempeño.

Los precios que ella ofrece al mercado son estables y varian de acuerdo al servicio, por ejemplo en las prendas de vestir varia de acuerdo a la calidad y a la temporada y en la peluquería generalmente los precios de los diversos servicios de belleza son standar.

Con la presente solicitud ella adquirirá más cantidad de ropa para surtir su negocio y también comprara algunas cosas para equipar la peluquería. Actualmente Esther solo cuenta con este crédito y no garantiza a nadie, sus antecedentes crediticios son buenos.

loans.use: Working capital and build onto home.

loans.name: Ni Putu Arniati

texts.id:
Ni Putu Arniati’s husband, I Wayan Narka, is a farmer who works on his father’s land. Struggling to make ends meet, Ni Putu Arniati started to breed pigs. Unfortunately, the few number of pigs and the obsolete breeding methods that she used didn’t yield maximum results. To solve this, Ni Putu Arniati seek help from DINARI, which provides her with training and loans. With the loan, she will buy piglets and pig food. Ni Putu Arniati is optimistic that this time her pig breeding effort will yield profits that can help her family financially.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Joan, Kiva volunteer.

Ni Putu Arniati adalah istri dari I Wayan Narka yang berprofesi sebagai seorang Petani. Bertani mengolah kebun milik orang tuanya telah ia lakukan, akan tetapi hasilnya masih jauh dari harapan. Selanjutnya Ni Putu Arniati berusaha beternak babi. Akan tetapi jumlah yang sedikit serta masih menerapkan pola tradisional berakibat pada hasil yang masih kurang maksimal. Untuk mengatasi hasil yang kurang maksimal, Ni Putu memilih DINARI menjadi pendamping usahanya. Dari DINARI, Ni Putu Artini memperoleh pelatihan dan tunjangan modal usaha. Dengan pinjaman modal yang diperoleh dari DINARI sebesar Rp. 4.500.000.- ia manfaatkan untuk pembelian bibit serta biaya pakan ternaknya. Ni Putu Arniati optimis dari usaha ternak babi yang ia lakukan akan memperoleh keuntungan yang nantinya kan dipergunakan untuk menunjang perekonomian keluarganya.

loans.use: To buy piglets and pig food

loans.name: Teolina

texts.en:
Teolina and Carlos are the proud parents of two grown children. Together they own a bar that was passed on to Teolina by her mother and that is strategically located near a large school. Teolina’s tavern is known throughout the town for its excellent and attentive service, as well as its great food.

Teolina is looking to invest in her business and buy a refrigerator to keep her food and drinks fresh and cool. She is asking for a loan to keep her business running and successful.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator.

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
Maria is 28 years old and is married woman with 1 child age 9 months. Maria is a tailoring and she is a cloth seller, she started in 2007. Everyday, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more tailoring items and cloth items for her business.

loans.use: To buy more tailoring items and cloth items for her business.

loans.name: Suyono

texts.id:
Suyono currently lives in Mertasari street Denpasar, by renting a room for Rp.150.000 (about US$19) a month. His sales location is not too far from his living quarters. His business is Tofu and packed rice sales. Usually he sells from 5:00 PM to 10:00PM. Suyono is already in this business for 3 years, and income is sufficient to support the family with child and wife. This time Suyono's request for loan would be used for capital increase, so that his business could expand.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Suyono saat ini tinggal di Jl.Mertasari Denpasar dengan menyewa kamar Rp.150.000 per bulan. Tempat berjualannya tidak begitu jauh dari tempat tinggalnya. Adapun jenis usahanya adalah sebagai penjual tahu lontong. Biasanya dia berjualan dari jam 5 sore sampai dengan jam 10 malam. Suyono sudah menjalankan usaha ini selama 3 tahun dan penghasilan yang didapat cukup untuk kebutuhan keluarga bersama anak dan istrinya. Saat ini Suyono bermaksud mengajukan pinjaman yang dipakai sebagai tambahan modal usaha, sehingga usahanya bisa lebih berkembang.

loans.use: To increase  business capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin B. sells household goods. He is married, but income from the business is not sufficient  for his wife and two children. Demand for his goods is high, so he is requesting a loan of $475  to expand his business to increase  profits.

loans.use: To expand his business.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es:
Marina, like many Bolivian women, works as a carpenter in a furniture business part-time and also works as a vendor in the various popular fairs held in El Alto. Both activities constitute her primary source of income with which she provides for her 12 year old son. She lives in the Villa Tunara zone of El Alto.

The loan requested will be used as a supplement to the money she has saved to purchase land in the lower zone to build her own home, since she actually lives with her parents. This is her first loan with Impro, who determined through an evaluation, that Marina qualified for loan approval. Her yearning to overcome is deserving of the help she needs so that her dream of having her own home can become a reality.

Translated from Spanish to English by Laura Jung, Kiva Volunteer

Marina, como mucha mujeres bolivianas, trabaja en una empresa de muebles como carpintero medio día y también trabaja como comerciante en las diferentes ferias populares de la ciudad de El Alto. Ambas actividades constituyen su principal fuente de ingreso con los que cubre la manutención de su pequeño hijo de 12 años; vive en la Zona Villa Tunara de la Ciudad de El Alto. El crédito lo destinará a completar el dinero que le falta para la compra de un terreno y en lo posterior contar con casa propia, ya que actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada califica para la aprobación del préstamo solicitado. Sus ansias de superación merecen la ayuda necesaria para que su sueño de tener casa propia se haga realidad.

loans.use: Purchase of land to realize her dream of having her own home.

loans.name: Sabougnouman (Porte Bonheur) Group

texts.fr:
These four members of the Sbougnouman group are on average 38 years old and have four children. They live in the village of Zogofina (Ségou Prefecture, Republic of Mali), in polygynous households with their husbands, co-wives and children. The women share professional ties, kinship, friendship and live in the same neighborhood. They primarily trade in condiments, grains, fresh cow’s milk, pagnes (lengths of brightly-colored African cloth), and firewood. Some aspects of their business are of a daily variety, as in milk, while others are seasonal (grains, wood and condiments, et cetera). To meet the ever-increasing customer demand, they decided to join the loan program at the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution, which has granted them three group loans, all repaid in full.

The women in the group often replenish their stock of coarse grains and fresh cow’s milk locally in Zogofina, but at times go to the neighboring villages of Zenguela and Soignebougou for firewood, and to the regional capital of Ségou for condiments, pagnes and rice. With this loan they expect to buy 50 liters of fresh cow’s milk (20 liters per day), 150 kilograms of coarse grains and pulses (millet, peanuts, beans, et cetera), 4 cartloads of firewood, 10 lengths of quality pagne and 300 kilograms of spices and rice.

Products are then generally sold retail for cash or credit on market day at the village square, or both during the day and in the evening from home. Their customers generally consist of women and men coming from other villages to make their purchases in Zogofina. They expect to realize a monthly profit of $67 (30,000 Central African francs), sufficient to make their monthly loan payment, support their families and reinvest in their business.

Translated from French by Joyce, Kiva Volunteer.

Les quatre membres du groupe Sabougnouman ont en moyenne 38 ans, 4 enfants et vivent dans des foyers polygames avec leurs maris coépouses et enfants dans le village de Zogofina préfecture de Ségou (république du Mali.). Ces femmes sont liées par des relations professionnelles, de parenté, d’amitié et de voisinage. Elles font essentiellement le commerce de condiments alimentaires, de céréales, de lait frais de vache, de pagnes et du bois de chauffe. Les activités menées sont souvent quotidiennes (le lait) ou étalées dans le temps (les céréales, le bois et les condiments etc.). Afin de satisfaire une demande de plus en plus croissante de la clientèle, elles décidèrent d’intégrer le programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso qui accepta de leur accorder trois prêts de groupe, tous correctement remboursés.

Les femmes de groupe se ravitaillent souvent sur place à Zogofina (en céréales sèches et en lait frais de vache), parfois dans les villages environnants (tel Zenguela et Soignebougou en bois de chauffe) et dans la capitale régionale Ségou (en condiments alimentaires, pagnes et en riz). Elles comptent acheter avec ce prêt : 50 litres de lait frais de vache (vente quotidienne), 150 kg de céréales sèches (mil haricot arachide etc.) 4 chargements de charrette en bois de chauffe 10 pièces de pagnes fancy et 300 kg de condiments et de riz.

Les ventes sont effectuées généralement en détail, au comptant et à crédit les jours de foires, sur la place publique du village et à domicile (nuit et jour). La clientèle généralement constituée de femmes et d’hommes se déplace des autres villages pour venir faire des achats à Zogofina. Elles envisagent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30.000FCFA.qui servira à payer les intérêts du prêt subvenir aux dépenses de la famille et investir le reste dans les activités.

loans.use: Purchase of condiments, cloth, grains and firewood

loans.name: Mrs. Meas Sophea Village Bank Group

texts.en: Twenty-two people in Kandal Kraom Village in Kandal Province have formed a village bank loan and plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Meas S. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She is a housewife and her husband, Mr. Leng Yi, is an ice-cream seller in the local village. In his business, he now faces a small problem because his ice-cream box is too old which can affect his products so he wants to buy a new one. Therefore, his wife, Mrs. Meas S. decided to ask for a loan to buy it for her husband. Mrs. Meas S. is 42 years old and the mother of five children two of whom are employed in a garment factoR. while other two are attending. The youngest one is too young to work or study at three years old.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy ice-cream box to replace the old one.

loans.name: Cleidi De Jesus

texts.es:
Cleidi es una mujer joven y emprendedora, que trabaja por las tardes cuidando niños en su casa, y disponía de tiempo en las mañanas para hacer alguna actividad para tener un dinero extra, una amiga le recomendó vender plata y decidio que esa era una buena opción para lograr obtener ingresos extras.

Ella necesita un préstamo por US $150 que pagara en 3 meses para tener mayor variedad de productos que ofrecer y así incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Cleidi is a young entrepreneuring woman who works in the afternoons taking care of children in her home, leaving her mornings to perform some activity to make extra money. A friend recommended that she sold silver and she decided that was a good option to obtain an extra income.

She needs a loan for US $150 that she will pay in 3 months to have a larger variety of products to offer, and in that way increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Eliana Colunga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: comprar mercancia

loans.name: Aur

texts.en:
Mr. Aur A., and his wife, Mrs. Sreymom Pol, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 1990 and have three children, one son and two daughters. Two of them study in local schools and the youngest one stays at home.

Mr. Aur and his wife are in the business of battery-charging for other villagers. Many villagers come to their shop every day to charge their battery because in this commune, they still don’t have electricity yet. Some families use small generators but most other families use batteries. Therefore, the couple needs to expand their business by purchasing one more motor and materials for charging batteries.

So, Aur is requesting a loan of US$ 1000 to purchase a motor and other materials for his battery-charging business.

loans.use: To purchase a motor and other materials for charging batteries

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia pertenece al Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado de Chimbo, Distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo- Puno. Tiene 34 años y es madre de 6 hijos  que aun estudian, es casada, su esposo trabaja en el Valle de Ite donde siembra ají para luego venderlo, negocio al que ambos se dedican. Con el primer préstamo obtenido de Manuela R. de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles compro un chanchito para engorde y luego venderlo para pagar su préstamo. Tiene 01 año trabajando con el Banco.

En la actualidad, ella se dedica a la compra y  venta de ají que compra en Desaguadero y que vende en Moquegua.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1500.00 nuevos soles y que pagara en 5 cuotas comprara un quintal de ají.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julia belongs to "Banco Comunal "Espíritu Santo" of the Centro Poblado de Chimbo, District and Pronvice of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 34 years old and the mother of 6 school-going children, she is married and her husband works in the Valle de Ite where he grows chili. Both later sell the chili for a living. With the first loan from Manuela R. of S/.500.00 nuevos soles, she bought a small pig to be fattened and then sold in order to repay the loan. She has been working with the "Banco" for 1 year.

Presently she buys chili in Desaguadero and sells it in Moquegua. With the loan of S/.1500.00 nuevos soles, to be repaid in 5 payments she will buy a "quintal" of chili.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase chili in bulk.

loans.name: Libia

texts.en:
Libia is a member of the Universo (Universe) Village Bank. She is 48 years old, married, and has five children. Libia has a stand at the Abastos Market in the city of Ayacucho, where she sells different kinds of vegetables, both in bulk and per kilo. She and her son buy the vegetables from local farmers. Libia needs a loan of 2400 soles to buy onions and carrots. Her dreams are for her children to grow up to be working professionals and to improve her business. 

 
Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva fellow
Libia es socia del Banco Comunal Universo. 
Libia es casada, tiene 48 años y 5 hijos, Libia tiene un puesto en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho en donde vende verduras variadas al por mayor y menor, sus productos los adquiere de los productores, actividad que realiza con la ayuda de su hijo. 
Libia necesita un préstamo de 2400 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cebolla y zanahoria. 
Los sueños de Libia son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.

loans.use: Buy onions and carrots

loans.name: Olawoyin

texts.en: Olawoyin A. sells drinks wholesale and retail, and she has been in this business since 2005. She needs the loan amount of N140000 to purchase more crates of drinks to sell. She has a deep freezer where she cools her drinks for her customers. A. is 37 years old and married with 3 children. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Dao Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đinh Thị Hợi năm nay 50tuổi,  gia đình chị có 3 con trong đó có 2 con đang đi học. Chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2005. Hiện tại ngoài chăn nuôi hai vợ chồng chị đều đang  kinh doanh hàng ăn sáng. Đây cũng là công việc đem  lại nguồn thu nhập chủ yếu cho gia đình chị với thu nhập 3.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 8.000.000d để đầu tư mua thêm thực phẩm phục vụ cho công việc kinh doanh.
texts.en:
Mrs. Đinh Thị Hợi, 50 years old, has three children, of whom two are still in school. She has participated in the TYM Fund since 2005. Currently, in addition to raising animals, both she and her husband work at their breakfast-selling business, which is their main source of income, earning them about 3,000,000 VND (178 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, she hopes to borrow 8,000,000 VND (475 USD) to buy supplies for her restaurant.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Breakfast restaurant

loans.name: João Heitor Elias

texts.pt:
João Heitor Elias M. é natural de Maputo no distrito de Boane, casado maritalmente e pai de um filho com um ano de idade, para alem da sua família sustenta os seus pais enviando géneros alimentícios. 

João estudou até 7ªclasse e parou por falta de condições financeiras, desta viu obrigado a procurar emprego muito cedo, onde encontra se a trabalhar numa empresa agrária de produção de Banana de nome Bananalandia, tem um salário mensal de 1749,00mt.

João vive na casa da sagraria dai que com este empréstimo pretende comprar material de construção para começar a construção da sua própria casa.
texts.en:
João Heitor Elias M. was born in Maputo, in the district of Boane. He is married and the father of a one-year-old child. Besides his family he supports his parents by sending them food. João went to school until the 7th grade and then stopped due to lack of finances. He was forced to look for work early on, and found a job at an agricultural company that produces bananas, called Bananalandia. His monthly salary is 1749.00 MT. João lives in a house that belongs to the company, but with this loan he intends to purchase construction material and begin building his own house.

Translated from Portuguese by Jill Haring, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase construction material

loans.name: Reset

texts.en:
Reset A. is a low-income, vulnerable person. He is 44, married with three children. Reset has a small grocery and sells foodstuffs. The business is very successful but needs some investment of capital to increase its daily turnover. That's why he has applied for a loan of 1225 USD.

This loan will allow him to buy bigger amounts of goods for re-sale and to better provide for his family and save more money to be able to provide his children with better education. With your collaboration he’ll be able to crystallize his dreams in a short time.

loans.use: purchase more goods for re-sale

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.en:
S. Olimjon is 37 years old, married and has two children. His goals are to grow in his personal life and in his business by offering better service to his customers. He hopes that God will continue to keep him healthy so that he can get ahead in life and fulfill his goals. He makes a living driving a taxi, traveling the streets of Kanibadam in search of customers. He has owned his business for the last four  years. In addition to this job, when the weather is warn he sells soft drinks with the help of his mother. Today, Olimjon’s car needs many repairs, and he has applied for a loan of $1,500 to make this possible. He will also use a portion of the loan to buy an additional freezer which will allow him to expand his business selling cold drinks. He thanks Kiva and all its lenders for their help.  


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To repair his car and buy a freezer

loans.name: Muhammad Aliam Group

texts.en:
Muhammad Aliam is the group leader of the Muhammad Aliam group.  They have two members and request a loan of 28000 Afghani for the term of eight months. 

Muhammad wants a loan for his metal working shop.  Aziz Muhammad needs a loan for his taxi business. They like this loan process.

loans.use: Expanding business.

loans.name: Manzura

texts.ru:
Домуллочонова Манзура – кредитор в Микроинвест с 2008 года, уже два кредита хорошо закончила и хочет получить следующий. Кредиты получает для увеличения своего бизнеса- продажи овощей, на овощном  рынке Худжанда.
Муж Манзуры помогает ей по завозу товара, т.к. после операции Манзуре нельзя поднимать груз свыше трёх килограмм. Но торговля у неё всегда кипит , т.к. у неё много своих постоянных оптовых клиентов.
texts.en:
Manzura D., who has been borrowing from MicroInvest since 2008, already has successfully paid off two loans and wants to take out another. She takes out loans to expand her business: selling vegetables in the Khujand vegetable market Manzura’s husband helps her deliver the goods, since after an operation she has been unable to lift more than three kilograms. Her sales are always brisk since she has many loyal wholesale customers.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Selling vegetables

loans.name: Víctor

texts.es: Víctor tiene  38 años, su mayor anhelo es ver progresar a su familia, a quienes trata de brindar los mejores cuidados y atenciones dentro de su casa. El negocio que viene desarrollando desde hace 9 años  es la venta de abarrotes en la tienda que  instaló en un local alquilado en una zona muy comercial. Sin duda, dedicarse a este rubro le ayudó a mejorar su vivienda y a ofrecer a sus hijos estudios de calidad. Empieza su trabajo realizando la limpieza del local desde muy temprano, debido a que debe atender a los clientes  que hacen sus comprar muy temprano, por ello, don Víctor trata de estar con las puertas abiertas desde las 6 de la mañana. Es así, que junto a su esposa, atiende su negocio hasta la media noche, tomando precauciones, ya que en las noches hay más ventas pero también mayor peligro por la delincuencia. Para un futuro cercano, Víctor quiere instalar otra tienda en su vivienda, como una sucursal de la principal. Los cinco años que tiene trabajando con MFP en su banco comunal ha sabido desenvolverse  con responsabilidad, al igual que todas sus compañeras, por lo que han hecho de su grupo uno de los más confiables y organizados de la institución. Con los 2000 soles que solicita incrementará su mercadería, además de comprar algunos exhibidores para sus productos.
texts.en:
Victor is 38 years old. His greatest desire is to see his family get ahead. He tries to provide them with the best care and attention within his home. He has been selling groceries for 9 years in the store he set up. It is in a rented place in a very commercial area. With out a doubt, working in this trade helped him improve his house and offer his children quality schooling. He begins work early by cleaning the store. He must wait on customers that shop early so Mr. Victor tries to have the doors open by 6 in the morning. He tends to his business, together with his wife, until midnight. He is careful since there are more sales at night but also greater danger due to delinquency. Victor wants to open another store in his home, like a branch of the main store, in the near future. He, as well as all his co-workers, have known how to manage themselves responsibly at their community bank in the five years he has been working with MFP. This has made his group one of the most trustworthy and organized in the institution. He will increase his merchandise with the 2000 PEN he has applied for, as well as purchasing some display cases for his products.

Translated from Spanish by Susan Haynes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise and purchase display cases

loans.name: Prisca

texts.en: Prisca sells cooked foods in her shop. She is very happy with the nature of her business. Prisca is 28 years old and married with 5 children. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more cooked food to sell. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Gladis Argentina

texts.es:
la sra. GLADIS ARGENTINA M. M. se dedica a la venta de variedades como ser Ropa y una gran variedad de calzado para adulto y niño(a), tambien vende camisas, aritos, carteras, pantalones, colas y otra variedad de prodructos, su negocio opera bajo el nombre de variedades "M.".  se encuentra ubicado en el Barrio Abajo de Danlí, Gladis cuenta con varios años de experiencia en 
este tipo de negocio, tiene muy buena clientela por la humildad y la buena persona que es, el negocio de ella se encuentra en un buen punto estrategico donde tiene varios clientes que gracias a los mismos le han podido generar mas ingresos para su vida y asi poder contar con el apoyo de sus familiares que la rodean. 
Es Casada tiene  36 años de edad y sus hijos estan cursando Educacion Primaria y secundaria, gracias a los ingresos persibe de su negocios a mejorado su nivel de vida, actualmente ella esta solicitando un credito para surtir un poco mas su negocio y asi poder ofrecer a sus clientes variedad de productos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gladis Argentina M. M. sells a variety of clothing and shoes for adults and children. The merchandise she offers includes shirts, earrings, wallets, pants, formalwear and other products. Her variety store is called M. and is located in the downtown neighborhood of Danlí. Gladis has several years of experience in this line of business. Due to her humble and good-natured personality, she has been able to attract and maintain a variety of regular customers. She is grateful for their patronage which has allowed her to generate an income and for the support of family members who surround her.

She is 36 years old and married. Her children attend primary and secondary schools. Thanks to the income from her business, she has been able to improve her standard of living. She is requesting a loan to restock her business so that she can continue offering customers a wide variety of products.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise

loans.name: Meyevi

texts.fr:
revendeuse de bijoux de qualité, cette femme achète ses bijoux de cotonou et les revend ensuite à Lomé et au burkina-faso, les bijoux qu’elle vend au burkina faso sont plus coûteux que ceux vendus à Lomé ainsi elle arrive à couvrir son déplacement, elle a associé à ce commerce la vente de pagnes et de tissus. Elle a reçu une commande de ses clients du burkina faso, pour les satisfaire elle sollicite un crédit de WAGES pour acheter un ensemble de bijoux de grande qualité.
Elle est mariée et a 01 enfant.
texts.en:
This woman sells quality jewelry. She purchases her jewelry from Cotonou and sells it in Lome and Burkina Fasso. Because the jewelry she sells in Burkina Fasso is more expensive than the jewelry sold in Lome, she is able to cover her travel costs. She has also begun selling "pagnes" (lengths of brightly colored African cloth) and fabric. She has received an order from her clients in Burkina Fasso and to fill the order, she is requesting a loan from WAGES to purchanse a set of quality jewelry. She is married and has one child.

Translated from French by Allana Carlyle, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of jewelry, pagnes and fabric

loans.name: Patricio López Group

texts.es:
El grupo Patricio L. está integrado por tres mujeres, de presencia muy alegre, dinámica y humilde, que son Jazmina del Carmen G. Guitan, Marisol del Socorro L. y Irma del Carmen M. G.; Originario de el barrio Camilo Ortega de la Ciudad de Masaya. 

La coordinadora del grupo es Jazmina, una joven ARTESANA de 25 años de edad, que aún que de presencia muy sencilla, es de carácter muy osado y ambiciosa en su trabajo.
Jazmina trabaja desde hace 15 años en la elaboración de sombreros bordados, alfombras, canastas a base de palma y Cabuya (Fibra textil extraída de la penca o mamey con la que se fabrica cuerdas y tejidos) y en la manufactura de ropa con bordados típicos Nicaragüenses. 

Éste oficio lo aprendió de su madre, quien desde que tenía 10 años le enseño como elaborar éste tipo de artesanías. Jazmina alega que al ver que los ingresos eran buenos, decidió independizarse para poder ganar su propio dinero. Actualmente es madre de 3 niños a quienes quiere enseñar el oficio y al mismo tiempo desea que ellos se preparen para formar una empresa de éxito.

Su crédito pretende invertirlo en la compra de mayor cantidad de materiales, para no tener que viajar tan seguido, ya que éstos se compran en zonas como Somoto y Santa Lucía (Lugares totalmente alejados de la Ciudad de Masaya). Está preparando mercadería para la época más alegre del año, que es la celebración de la Purísima (Nicaragua entera celebra a la inmaculada Concepción de María).

Irma Muños vende ambulante productos como lo son (Zapatos, cosméticos, bisuterías entre otros) y Marisol L. trabaja en la elaboración de artesanías a base de palmas (Trenzas, chis chiles, canastas).
texts.en:
The Patricio Lopez Group is composed of three women, very happy, dynamic and humble in appearance. Jazmina, Marisol and Irma are from the Camilo Ortega neighborhood in Masaya, Nicaragua.

The coordinator of the group is Jazmina, a 25 year old artisan, who despite her very simple presence, is audacious in character and ambitious in her work. Since the age of 15 Jazmina has made embroidered hats, carpets, and baskets from palm and mamey fibers, from which she weaves cords and fabrics. She also makes typical Nicaraguan embroidered clothing.

She learned her trade from her mother, who beginning 10 years ago, taught her how to do this type of craft. Jazmina says that upon seeing that the earnings were good, she decided to become independent in order to earn her own money. At present, she is the mother of 3 children to whom she wishes to teach the craft and at the same time, she wants them to form a successful enterprise.

She intends to use her loan to buy a larger quantity of materials, so that she won't have to travel so often, since they are only available in zones like Somoto and Santa Lucia (places far outside Masaya). She's preparing merchandise for the happiest time of year, the celebration of the Immaculate Conception of Mary.

Irma sells products such as shoes, cosmetics, and jewelery, among others in the street markets. Marisol, too, makes artisan goods using palm fibers (braids and baskets).

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING PRIMARY MATERIALS IN LARGER QUANTITIES

loans.name: Cecile

texts.fr: Cecile E. est une femme de 31 ans marié et mère de 2 enfants. Il habite à Agadji une ville située à environ 250 kilomètre de Lomé, la capitale du TOGO.  Elle profite de la baisse du prix du mais pour acheter beaucoup et en faire un  stock. Puisqu’elle vend la pate fabriqué à base du mais, alors elle utilisera le stockage quand les prix du mais vont augmenter. En ce moment elle procurera beaucoup de bénéfices. Avec ces bénéfices elle souhaiterait construire un restaurant-bar plus tard.

loans.use: le stock du mais

texts.en:
Lea Mukantagaara is 43 years old ,wisdow with four children aged between 18 and 8.
She lives in Gasabo district,Kigali province capital of Rwanda.
Lea owns a small shop for  two years where she sells different kind of products as you find on her picture included .  
She opens everyday her shop from 6h00 to 8h00 PM.
Before the business Lea  was a full time house wife ; and could not get enough income for need of her family.
With this new loan requested in Vision Finance company she hopes to feed her children and find all needs for them such as  school fees and to health care , she believes also to expand her business  .

loans.name: Sophal

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophal U., 38, and her husband, Mr. Chanthoeun Noy, have been married since 1990 and have five children: three sons and two daughters. One of her daughters works in Phnom Penh, one child is a fisherman and another is a construction worker. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Sophal has been a silk weaver since she was 14 years old. In the past, she used to weave for her neighbors for a fee but now she runs her own business. Her husband is a silk weaver and fisherman as well.

Sophal is requesting a loan of $400 to purchase silk materials for her weaving business.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials for her weaving business

loans.name: Togetherness Group

texts.en:
Togetherness is a group of three borrowers led by Kormasa T.. She is 32 years old and married with three children aged 3-14 years old, and their educational levels kindergarten-6th grade. She also cares for an orphan. She and her family live in the Tebomai community, downtown Voinjama, the capital of Lofa county, Northern Liberia. Kormasa is a 5th grade dropout due to poverty.

Kormasa's business is general goods. She buys general goods wholesale and sells retail on a table in the Voinjama main market. She has been running this business for six years and is hoping to improve the shop. She gives her customers good prices and talks well to them in order encourage them to continue buying from her. Her ability for hard work has made her a pillar for her family – business is her life.

Kormasa and her family depend on her business for their daily needs, because her husband is out of a job and their children need to be supported financially. Therefore, she needs this loan in order to purchase more general goods wholesale to improve her business. She dreams of giving her children a better education and building a house of their own.

loans.use: To purchase more general goods wholesale

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Yun P., 40, is married and lives with four of her children in the Takeo province. She is a farmer and makes cow bells to sell at the local market; she typically makes about US $1.60 each day. Her husband is a construction worker who specializes in building houses. He typically makes US $3.30 per day. 

The weather conditions have been difficult for farming in Cambodia this past year and inflation has also been out of control. These factors have made this a tough economic year for many Cambodians, Yun P. included. In light of these economic difficulties, she is asking for a loan of US $1000, which her husband will use to run a motor-taxi. She is confident that this loan will allow her to increase her daily income and to better support her family.

loans.use: running a motor-taxi

loans.name: Sonagnon Félicienne

texts.fr: Z. Sonagnon Félicienne est née en 1973 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Sonagnon Félicienne est mariée à KOUNNOU Valentin, un commerçant. Le couple a quatre enfants en charge, dont trois sont leurs enfants. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. C'est depuis 13 ans que Sonagnon Félicienne vit avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Kpondéhou à Cotonou. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Il y a neuf ans de cela que Sonagnon Félicienne vend des produits divers (savons, insecticides, biscuits, sucre, lait, pâtes alimentaires, sardines, riz, huile végétale, etc.) à son domicile. Sonagnon Félicienne exerce comme activité secondaire, la vente du charbon de bois à son domicile. C'est à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin, que Sonagnon Félicienne s'approvisionne. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé qui rembourse sans retard ses crédits. Sonagnon Félicienne sollicite auprès de ALIDé, un cinquième crédit afin d'augmenter son fonds de roulement et d'augmenter sa marchandise pour faire face à la demande importante de sa clientèle.
texts.en:
Z. Sonagnon Félicienne was born in 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin.  She is married to KOUNNOU Valentin, a merchant.  The couple has four children to support.  Three of them are theirs;  some of them are in school.  For thirteen years, she has been living with her children and husband in the Kpondéhou district in Cotonou.  The couple provides for the family jointly.  For nine years, Sonagnon Félicienne has been selling a variety of goods (soaps, insecticides, cookies, sugar, milk, pasta, sardines, rice, vegetable oil, etc.) out of her home.  She has a secondary business selling charcoal out of her home.  She gets her supplies from Dantokpa, the international market of Benin. She is a previous ALIDé client who repays her loans without delay.  She's requesting from ALIDé a fifth loan for increasing her working capital and for augmenting her merchandise to cope with the substantial customer demand. 

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy various goods (boxes of pasta, sugar, canned foods, milk, rice)

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah M. is 25 years old and has a business selling clothes and cosmetics. She has been in business for two years and mostly sells to urban customers. She is requesting Kes. 20,000 to increase her inventory. 

Fridah says that as a member of Faulu Kenya she has learned how to manage her business more professionally. She describes herself as  hardworking and would like to expand her business into a combined beauty shop and boutique.

Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable micro-finance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To increase inventory

loans.name: Miguel Luis

texts.pt:
Miguel Luís G. nasceu na cidade de Maputo, Província de mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, tem 49 anos de idade, casado e pai de 3 filhos de 24, 22 e 18 anos de idade, destes o do meio é que vai a escola. Fez 6ª classe do antigo sistema de educação, não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras por parte dos progenitores. Vive na casa própria com a sua família e sustenta seu pai que vive na cidade de Maputo enviando dinheiro e produtos alimentares.

Saiu de Maputo para Beira em missão de serviço em 1983, no mesmo ano é transferido da Beira para Nampula norte de Moçambique para continuar com as suas actividades. Terminadas as actividades regressa a cidade capital, local onde reside actualmente. Trabalha na TCM (Transportes e Comunicações de Moçambique) como chefe dos recursos humanos desde 1982, onde faz 8 horas diárias. No tempo pós laboral desenvolve seu negocio por um período de 4h por dia, onde consegue um salário de 7.800.00 na empresa e no negocio cerca de 4.000.00mt por mes, que aplica nas despesas de casa e ainda poupa cerca de 1.500.00mt de vez em quanto na sua conta bancária. 

Já teve empréstimo no banco Millinium Bim, depois de terminar com o pagamento decidiu não continuar, conheceu a Hluvuku através de futebol quando arbitrava o campeonato nacional onde Hluvuku participou, e decidiu visitar a instituição. Este é o seu 2º empréstimo no valor de 20.000.00mt com o qual pretende comprar produtos (óleo, ovos, leite, bebidas e outros) para aumentar a quantidade da sua mercadoria no seu estabelecimento. O empréstimo anterior foi de 12.000.00mt para a mesma actividade.
 
 Futuramente gostaria de solicitar mais empréstimos para melhorar a sua residência e para aplicar no seu negócio. Por isso compromete se a pagar devidamente este empréstimo para poderá aceder a outros no futuro.
texts.en:
Miguel Luís G. was born in the City and Province of Maputo, south of Mozambique. He’s 49 years old. He’s married and has 3 children, ages 24, 22 and 18. The middle child is currently going to school. He finished up to 6th grade of the old school system, but he couldn't continue because his parents had serious financial problems. He lives in his own house with his family and he also supports his father, who lives in the city of Maputo, sending him money and food. He left Maputo to go to Beira for a service mission in 1983. That same year he was transferred from Beira to Nampula, north of Mozambique to continue with his activity. Once his service was completed, he returned to the capital city, where he lives now. He’s worked for TCM (Mozambique Transportation and Communications) as HR Manager since 1982, 8 hours a day. After his day time job, he devotes around 4 hours a day to his business. He gets a 7.800.00 salary from his company and 4.000.00mt a month from his business, which he uses for household expenses. He saves around 1.500.00mt from time to time to put on his bank account. He received a loan from Millinium Bim bank, but after he finished his payments he decided to leave. He met Hluvuku through a soccer tournament where he was a referee and Hluvuku was participating, so he decided to visit our organization. This is his 2nd loan for an amount of 20.000.00mt, which he will use to buy products, such as oil, eggs, milk, drinks and others, to increase his stock. His previous loan was for 12.000.00mt which he used for this same activity. (1 dollar = 28.51MT) In the future he would like to request for more loans to make home improvements and to restock him business. For this reason, he’s committed to pay this loan in time and access to more money later.

Translated from Portuguese by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products, such as oil, eggs, milk, drinks and others

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II.
Maria es soltera, tiene 28 años y esta esperando a su primer hijo, de profesión Profesora de Lengua y Literatura, Maria vende ropa variada a pedido, que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa.
El sueño de Maria es trabajar en el campo de Docencia.
texts.en:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Morenita II. Maria es soltera, tiene 28 años y esta esperando a su primer hijo, de profesión Profesora de Lengua y Literatura, Maria vende ropa variada a pedido, que ofrece a amigos, familiares, sus ventas son al crédito. Maria necesita un préstamo de 900 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de ropa. El sueño de Maria es trabajar en el campo de Docencia. Maria, 28, is a member of the Morenita II communal bank. She is single and expecting her first child. Maria is trained as a Spanish and Literature teacher. She sells a variety of clothing articles on order among her friends and family. Her sales are on credit. Maria needs a 900 sol loan to invest in clothing. Maria's dream is to work as a teacher.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy more secondhand shoes to sell

loans.name: Charito's Group

texts.en:
Charito C. is from the village of Villa Corazon. She is 52 years old. Charito is the group leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

Charito is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Charito owns and operates a furniture-making business. She makes and sells general household furniture to local businesses and community members. Charito has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $220 a month from these activities.

In 2006, Charito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Charito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. Charito is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional raw materials to expand her product line. This will be her 8th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to further expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to expand her product line

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.en: K. Shavkat is a very responsible and optimistic person. He has a little kid and a wife whom he supports. Shavkat wishes to develop his cattle-raising business in response to the very high demand for milk from villagers and, in particular, from customers who come from the more built-up towns. Shavkat wants to expand his business to improve his living conditions. We hope that the combination of his capabilities and the services provided by IMON International will help him to improve his business. ------More about Tajikistan and IMON International--------- Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road and marking the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please click here

loans.use: to purchasing cattle to raise

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia A. is an entrepreneurial businesswoman. She runs a cosmetics shop at Lumo ward in Dar es Salaam. She sells a variety of cosmetics goods in her shop.

Theresia purchases her business goods from the wholesale and retail cosmetics shops at Kariakoo center shopping market. She manages to meet her daily family needs and business capitalization from her business income.

Theresia needs a loan of Tsh 1,000,000 to boost her business.

loans.use: To boost her business

loans.name: Rodalyn

texts.en:
With her belief in getting out of poverty, Rodalyn P. decided in 2009 to join ASHI (Ahon sa Hirap, Inc.), a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, with the opening of having start-up capital for generating income. During her previous loans from ASHI, she carefully invested in her buy and sell business, selling different goods, and embarked on a sewing business. The profit is what she uses for daily expenses.

During her almost one year in ASHI, Rodalyn has shown herself to be hardworking and she has strong belief to make her dreams come true. Rodalyn still dreams of the best for her family: to provide the best education for her children and to have a happy family. 

Now on her second loan, Rodalyn requests 9,000 Philippine pesos to create a broader business. Specifically, the money will be used to purchase cotton and planel for her sewing business and an inventory of rice for her buy and sell business. She is very determined and disciplined to utilize the money which is lent to her.

Rodalyn is grateful to ASHI-Kiva partners for the support, even with all the dreams and challenges in her life.

loans.use: To purchase cotton and planel for her sewing business and inventory of rice

loans.name: Maty

texts.fr: Maty M. est une femme de 26 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KEUR NGALGOU depuis 3 ans et a reçu 6 fois de suite de crédit. Elle a une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité qui est l'embouche bovine pour l'avoir pratiquée pendant au moins 03 ans. Elle va acheter de l'aliment de bétail et une paire de bœufs, les engraisser pendant 4 à 5 mois pour aller revendre dans les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité. Cette activité lui procure des bénéfices qui lui permettent de soutenir son mari dans les charge familiales.
texts.en:
Maty M. is a 26-year-old woman, married and the mother of two children. She has been a member of the “Banc Villageois” Keur Ngalgou for the last three years and has benefited from six consecutive loans. She has a great experience in her sector of activity - fattening cattle - having practiced this for at least three years. She will buy cattle feed and a pair of oxen. She will fatten them up for four to five months and then resell them at the weekly markets in her town. This activity provides her with a profit that allows her to help her husband with the family’s expenses.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To develop and promote her cattle sales activity

loans.name: Akhludin

texts.en:
E. Akhludin is 55 years old and married with three children. He is a farmer who owns a plot of land in his village where he grows different kinds of crops like wheat, potatoes, onions and other vegetables. He has been in this business since 1995. These crops are the main source of income for their family. To alleviate the hard physical labor and to expand the business, Akhludin would like to apply for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants.   


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchasing spare parts for motorcycles

loans.name: El Señor Es Mi Pastor 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Modesta, 53, is the coordinator of her group El Señor es mi Pastor (God is my Pastor), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Modesta’s group is located in the rural areas surrounding San Pedro de Macoris, an area known for its baseball stars and economic depression, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure as a single mother with her son.

Modesta is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling a variety of products including shampoo, perfumes, towels, juice, bread and also a toaster to toast the bread.

Modesta will use the profits to send her child to high school. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy shampoo, perfumes, towels, juice, bread and a toaster

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna J. is from the village of Opol, Misamis Oriental. She is 54 years old. Myrna is widowed and has 2 children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling seafood products  including fish and shrimp in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Myrna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 11,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Myrna from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds

loans.name: Xecaxjoj Group

texts.es: Doña Juliana, es una persona Casada, curso el Sexto   grado de primaria, tiene tres   hijos los cuales Uno de ellos es de  seis  años de edad y el otro de cuatro cinco años y la otra niña es de 8 mese, cuenta con la ayuda de su esposo en la manutención de sus hijos, ella se dedica a Agropecuario, (Crianza de animales domésticos), tiene 8 años ya con este negocio. Contando con entusiasmo y la ayuda de algunas vecinas organizan un grupo, para poder solicitar un préstamo. El Grupo Solidario se  denomina Xecaxjoj, el nombré indica el paraje  donde  residen estas personas. El grupo es de 4 integrantes mujeres, quienes se dedican a la actividad de crianza de animales vacunos, bovinos y porcinos, y la venta de los mismos en el mercado de la aldea de pasajoc, específicamente en el paraje Pologuá.  El préstamo ella lo utilizará para compra de animales  (Ganado, Porcino) y así incrementar el volumen de crianza de animales. Una de las dificultades de ser la dueña del negocio ha sido la falta del capital, pero ha salido adelante con la ayuda de su esposo y espera que su producción sea más grande y competitiva.
texts.en:
Juliana is married, educated to the sixth grade of primary school, and has three children – the eldest two are six and five years old, and the youngest eight months old. Her husband helps her to support her children, and she has been breeding domestic animals for eight years. Thanks to the enthusiasm and help of some of her neighbours, they have formed a group to be able to request a loan. The communal bank is called Xecaxjoj, which is the name of the place where these people live. The group has four female members who rear cattle, sheep and pigs, and sell them at market in the village of Pasajoc, in Pologuá. Juliana will use the loan to buy animals (cattle and pigs), which will increase her animal-breeding capacity. One of the difficulties of being the owner of the business has been the lack of capital, but she has made progress with the help of her husband and hopes her production will become greater and more competitive.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Stansfield, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Leonida

texts.en:
Leonida B. is from the village of Manaring, Ilagan. She is 57 years old. Leonida is married and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, Leonida owns & operates a business selling fish in the local community. Leonida has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Leonida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Leonida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Leonida is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Leonida from ASKI.
