She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 21 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional fish to sell

loans.name: Ny

texts.en: Mrs. Ny K. and her husband, Mr. Sophal Un, live along national road number one about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1994 and have two daughters who are in school. In the past, Ny stayed at home but she is now a garment factory worker. Her husband has been a mason since 1995 who works in the village and a near-by province. She does not have transportation for commuting to work, so she is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia H. is from the village of Extension, Wao, Lanao del Sur. She is 52 years old. Arsenia is married and has 10 adult children. To make a living, Arsenia owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling vegetables in the local community. Arsenia has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Arsenia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Arsenia is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional vegetables to sell. This will be the 1st loan taken out by Arsenia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and reaches out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Petronila

texts.en:
Petronila R. is from the village of Little Tadian. She is 58 years old. Petronila is married and has six adult children. To make a living, Petronila owns & operates a business raising pigs for breeding. Petronila has been engaged in her business for over 28 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Petronila joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Petronila has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase feed & other supplies. Petronila is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed & other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Petronila from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase feed & other supplies

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel H. is from the village of Capayangan, Banisilan, South Cotabato. She is 26 years old, married and has 4 school-aged children. Maribel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Maribel has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2010, Maribel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Maribel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Maribel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Maribel from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and to increase working capital

loans.name: Brima Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Brima” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and, consequently, improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Brima S.. Brima is 40. He was born in Bonthe, southern Sierra Leone but currently resides in Magburaka, together with his wife and four children. His wife is a businesswoman and his children are attending school. Two of the children are in primary school and two are in secondary school. Brima is a tailor and has been in this profession for five years. With his share of this loan, he will buy working materials like threads, needles, cloth, etc.

loans.use: To buy working materials like threads, needles, cloth, etc.

loans.name: Guzman

texts.es: Guzmán, de 37 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Trabajando todos los días arduamente en sus cultivos, Guzmán trata de cambiar la vida que actualmente lleva, con mucho esfuerzo siembra semestralmente papa y arveja, los cuales venden en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que es ahí donde mejores precios obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus siembras de las plaga de insectos, lleva 17 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que transportar sus cultivos hasta el lugar donde los vende, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. En adelante espera mejorar la calidad de sus productos y así obtener mejores precios. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, siente que este crédito le será muy beneficioso en su crecimiento como agricultor. En su banco comunal es un socio muy participativo y solidario. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono y fertilizantes para mejorar la productividad de sus chacras.
texts.en:
Guzmán, 37, is an unassuming, hard working man who lives in his own house and what he most desires is to improve his quality of life.  Working very hard every day on his crops he tries to change the daily life he currently lives.  With much effort he plants potatoes and peas every six months which are then sold at Tarma’s wholesale market because that’s where he gets the best prices for them.

What he likes best about his work is protecting his crops from insect infestations.  He has been a farmer for 17 years and considers the most difficult part of the work to be transporting his crops to the sales site because the sacks he has to carry are quite heavy.  In the future he’d like to improve the quality of his products thus obtaining better prices.

This is his 8th loan with MFP.  He feels that the loan will be very beneficial for his growth as a farmer.  He is a very active and supportive member of his communal bank.

He will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy more manure and fertilizers to improve the productivity of his fields.

loans.use: To buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy corrugated metal roofing, wood and bolts, together with other materials that he needs to repair his kitchen roof

loans.name: Syprose

texts.en:
Syprose O. is 46 years old and runs a hotel business at Donholm Estate, a well populated area. She is married to John Mungai and together they have five children. Syprose and her husband have also adopted three orphaned children whom they are supporting.She has been running this business for a period of 12 years and her monthly profit is 60,000 Kenyan Shillings.

She was introduced to KADET by other KADET clients. This loan of 20,000 Kenyan Shillings is her second loan from KADET, and she intends to buy iron sheets to renovate her hotel and buy uniforms for the employees. If the loan boosts the business, she will build a big hotel and educate her children to high levels.

Syprose dreams of having hotels in the city centre and other parts of the country. She describes herself as honest, and hardworking.

loans.use: To buy iron sheets to renovate her hotel and buy uniforms for her employees.

loans.name: Eulalia Patricia

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Los Tamarindos de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Las Orquídeas.
 
La señora Eulalia es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta porque en las reuniones aprende mucho, le gustan las charlas de salud. Tiene 52 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene tres hijos dos de ellos ya son mayores de edad e independientes, el menor esta en colegio y vive con ella. Su esposo no trabaja esta delicado de salud.

Tiene un soda bar en el cual además de vender bebidas como colas y batidos también vende comidas rápidas como hamburguesa, hot dog entre otras. Trabaja todos los días desde las 18h00 hasta las 22h00, esta labor la realiza sola. Las bebidas que ella vende y que son fabricadas las recibe en su local, nos cuenta que lleva ya buen tiempo con su negocio y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar, sodas, aguas y otros productos para preparar los alimentos. Sus metas son seguir trabajando y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en: The members of the Las Orquídeas ["The Orchids"] communal bank meet every 15 days in the housing community of Los Tamarindos, which in the city of Portoviejo. Portoviejo is the capital of Manabí and has been known for many years as the city of los reales tamarindos ["the royal tamarinds"]. Ms. Eulalia is a founding member of the communal bank and she likes it because she learns a lot at the meetings. She particularly likes the talks about health. She is 52 years old, married, and has three children from her marriage. Two of her children are already grown and independent, while the youngest is in secondary school and lives with her. Her husband does not work because his health is delicate. Eulalia has a soda bar where she sells drinks like colas and smoothies as well as fast food like hamburgers, hot dogs, and other items. She works every day from 6:00 PM until 10:00 PM. She does this work alone. The drinks she sells and makes are consumed at her establishment. She tells us that she has been running this business for a good amount of time and that it has gone very well. This loan will be used to buy sodas, fresh juices, and other ingredients for preparing the food. Her goals are to continue working and to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks, fresh juices, and ingredients for preparing food dishes

loans.name: José Hilario

texts.es:
José Hilario Q. Q. recorre desde hace 20 años algunas calles de Medellín en su triciclo ofreciendo jugos, avena, snacks y salpicón, labor que le ha permitido subsistir. José quien ya es reconocido en el sector, desea adquirir una plancha para calentar pasteles y otros productos que desea empezar a ofrecer en su tienda ambulante, además espera adquirir más surtido para ofrecer mayor variedad e incrementar sus ventas, realizarle algunos ajustes a su triciclo es otra de las necesidades. 

A sus 60 años de edad, José Hilario se siente orgulloso de su labor y espera continuar con su negocio hasta que Dios se lo permita como el mismo lo afirma.
texts.en:
José Hilario Q. Q. has traveled several streets in Medellín for the past 20 years, selling juices, oats, snacks and fruit cups. This work has allowed him to get by. Today José is known in the area. He wants to acquire a hotplate to heat up pies and other products he wishes to begin selling in his mobile store. He also hopes to acquire a greater assortment of products. This will offer more variety and raise his sales. He also needs to make some adjustments to his tricycle. 

With his 60 years, José Hilario feels proud of his work. He wishes to continue in his business as long as God permits, as he himself affirms.

loans.use: Purchase hotplate to heat up products, pay for tricycle supplies and adjustments

loans.name: Fidelia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” PACHAPACCARI”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fidelia; ella tiene 36 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades con el negocio de venta de correas,pulseras,carteras hechos a base de cuero la misma socia lo realiza ella trabaja dese su casa para luego distribuirlo a sus clientes que le solicitan ,la socia trabaja de forma ambulatoria y a pedido ,la socia se siente feliz ya que este trabajo le trae muchas satisfacciones especialmente económicas, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas de salir adelante.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de materiales para su negocio de cueros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Fidelia is a member of the "PACHAPACCARI" community bank which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.  

Fidelia is 36 years old, lives with her partner, and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities with her business selling leather belts, bracelets and purses.  She makes her products at home and then distributes them to her customers who request them.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor and also fills orders.  She feels happy as this work brings her a lot of satisfaction, especially financially.  Fidelia is a very cheerful person who has a great desire to get ahead in life.

Fidelia is requesting this loan to buy materials for her leather business.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy materials for her leather business

loans.name: Nguyễn's Group

texts.en:
Tư Nguyễn Thị (20211030064) is a 52-year-old woman living in the town of Huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Tư is the group leader of a 4-member group loan offered by SEDA.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is Phù Lưu 1 (Nhóm 04).


Tư is married and has 3 adult children.  To making a living, Tư operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for sale.  Tư has been engaged in this business for over 30 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2007, Tư joined SEDA to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tư has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,152,000 VND from SEDA.  This previous loan was used to purchase baby livestock to raise & sell in future.  She is now requesting a new loan of 5,152,000 VND which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies.  This will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from SEDA.  Tư plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  Huỳnh Thị T. (0) is a 54-year-old woman who is requesting a 5,152,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


2.  Nguyễn Thị D. (0) is a 30-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her furniture-making business.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) is a 36-year-old woman who is requesting a 7,392,000 VND loan to support her business raising livestock.


About SEDA:

The mission of SEDA (Center of Small Enterprise Development Assistance) is to provide microfinance services to the low income and disadvantaged people in rural areas of Hanoi and the Northern provinces of Vietnam.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tư Nguyễn Thị (20211030064) là 52 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố huyện Yên Phong - Bắc Ninh.  Tư là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 4 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là Phù Lưu 1 (Nhóm 04).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ chăn nuôi heo để bán.  Tư thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 30 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tư kiếm được khoảng 3.000.000 VND.  Vào 2007, Tư đã tham gia SEDA để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải thiện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tư đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 5.152.000 VND từ SEDA.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua gia súc còn nhỏ để nuôi & bán sau này.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 5.152.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ SEDA.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  Huỳnh Thị T. (0) là 54 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 5.152.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  Nguyễn Thị D. (0) là 30 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực sản xuất.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh chế tạo hàng nội thất.


3.  Nguyễn Thị H. (0) là 36 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 7.392.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


Về SEDA:

Nhiệm vụ của SEDA (Trung Tâm hỗ Trợ Phát Triển các Doanh Nghiệp Nhỏ) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính vi mô cho những người có thu nhập thấp và kém may mắn trong các vùng nông thôn tại Hà Nội và các tỉnh phía Bắc Việt Nam


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  .

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Sarapio

texts.en:
Sarapio is a sixty-year-old married man with thirteen children, living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. 

For six years he has been operating a clinic and with the income generated he was able to start up a lodge. His future plan is to build a hotel.

Sarapio needs this loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Bella Alegria

texts.es:
Bella Alegria Z. P. tiene 37 años, Es soltera vive con los hijos en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA se encuentra ubicada en el Cantón Ventanas, se reúnen en la ciudadela 24 de Mayto está ventanilla se dedica a actividades comerciales como la vetan de perfumes, ropa, bisutería, etc.

Bella se dedica a la comercialización de venta de cometidos como Yambal por pedidos en revistas, las compras las realiza por medio de una llamada telefónica y las vente por medio de revista puerta a puerta.

Solicita el crédito para adquirir los productos por medio de catalogo y tener los productos en una tienda,  Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos es la competencia y los precios altos. Su sueño es comprar un vehiculo y comprar una casa

Le gusta ver la televisión.
texts.en:
Bella Alegria Z. P., 37, is single and lives with her two children in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province. The members of V.R.C. ÉXITO DEL MAÑANA (Success of Tomorrow) are located in the Ventanas canton. They meet at the May 24 citadel. The group's businesses include selling perfumes, clothing, costume jewelry, etc.

Bella markets and sells Yanbal beauty products through mail-order catalogs. Purchases are made over the phone and she sells them through the catalog door-to-door. She is requesting a loan to buy products from the catalog so she can sell them in her store. The loan would help her to meet her financial needs. She is facing challenges in competition and high prices. She dreams of buying a car and owning her own home. She likes to watch television.

loans.use: to purchase products from mail-order catalogs

loans.name: Sonia Cristina

texts.es:
Sonia de 29 años, es una mujer trabajadora que aspira mucho por ganar dinero y sacar adelante a su familia que por medio de un crédito que hizo abrió su negocio  de internet.

Ella trabaja diariamente de 7h30 a 10h00 pm. Una de si dificultad en su negocio es el polvo ya que eso perjudica las maquinas. Tiene tres hijos que estudian todavía. Con la ayuda del préstamo desea comprar modulares y artículos de computación para incrementar sus ganancias. En un futuro quiere ampliar su negocio y aspira que sus hijos tena un mejor futuro y sean unos profesionales.
texts.en:
Sonia is 29 years old. She is a hard-working woman who has high hopes to earn money and help her family get ahead. Through a previous loan, she was able to open an Internet business. 

She works every day from 7:30 a.m. to 10:00 p.m. One of the difficulties for her business is the dust, because it damages the machines. She has three children who are still in school. With the help of this loan, she wants to buy cubicle desks, as well as computer equipment, so she can increase her earnings. In the future, she wants to expand her business, and she hopes that her children will have a better future and become professionals.

loans.use: to buy computer desk cubicles and computer equipment

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita M. is 46 years old and married with three school-aged children. She is from the village of San Pedro, Alicia, Isabela. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a general store. Her main source of income comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. 

Teresita joined ASKI in 2008 to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional inventory and provide working capital. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 35,000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Teresita from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her loan to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Las Maravillas De Ixtlahuaca Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama Maravillas D. Ixtlahuaca este nombre fue elegido por que las señoras quieren hacer maravillas D. su grupo y ser las mejores. Está ubicado en el estado D. México L. comunidad se caracteriza por L. venta D. verdura  y porque L. mayoría D. los habitantes  se dedican a L. crianza  D. borregos.  El grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes y es L. quinta vez que solicita un Préstamo. L. señora DOLORES S. F. es integrante del grupo. Tiene 34 años, estudio el tercer año D. L. secundaria, elL. tiene 3 hijos, uno  D. ellos cursa el primer año D. L. secundaria otro D. sus hijos estudia el quinto año D. L. primaria y el mas pequeño tiene 8 y el cursa el cuarto año D. primaria, elL. es ama D. casa y a su vez comerciante, comenta que su negocio es parte fundamental para salir adelante con los gastos que se presentan cada día, L. señora tiene un pequeño taller D. costura en el cual trabaja D. lunes a viernes , ya tiene 15 años D. experiencia en su negocio, y hace 5 años que se decidió a crear su propio taller D.  costuras, su dedicación en su negocio ha permitido que sus clientes sean fieles con el buen servicio y trato, el préstamo lo quiere para invertir en materias primas (telas, hilos y maquinas D. cocer) para poder seguir trabajando, elL. sueña que algún día tenga un establecimiento mas granD. obteniendo son una oportunidad D. crecimiento y con esto brindarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad D. vida así como estudios para su superación. Observaciones las señoras que no se ven bien se llaman: Alejandra M. y Maria M.
texts.en:
This group is called “Maravillas D. Ixtlahuaca” (The Wonders of Ixtlahuaca).  The name was chosen by the ladies who want to accomplish wonders in their group and be the best.  It is located in the state of México and the community is characterized by vegetable sales and by the fact that most residents raise sheep.  The group has 10 members and this is their fifth loan request.

Mrs. DOLORES S. F., 34, is a group member.  She completed 9th graD. and has three children.  One of them is in 7th graD., the other is in 5th graD. and the youngest, who is 8 years old, is in 4th graD..  She is both a housewife and a merchant.  She states that her business is vital to be able to handle daily expenses that present themselves.

She has a small sewing workshop where she works Monday through Friday.  She has 15 years experience in this line of work.  Five years ago she decided to set up her own workshop.  Her dedication to the business has created regular customers thanks to the good service and kind treatment they receive.  She wants the loan to buy raw materials (fabric, thread and sewing machines) to continue working.  She dreams with having a larger establishment some day to obtain higher profits which are a growth opportunity with which to proviD. her children with the best possible quality of life as well as schooling so they can improve themselves.

Observation: the women that aren’t clearly visible are Alejandra M. and Maria M..

loans.use: to buy raw materials (fabric and thread) for her sewing workshop.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es: Pablo  tiene un restaurante en el barrio La pradera, donde vende sancochos, mute de queso, yuca con suero y otras delicias de la comida propia de la costa caribe proveniente de la Sabana de Córdoba , inició su idea emprendedora en la ciudad de Barranquilla, cuando el barrio apenas tenia sus primeros habitantes,  vendiendo en un principio frituras  y jugos naturales de naranja, limón, mango, zapote, níspero, sandía, melón y guanábana; cuando poco a poco fue creciendo, adicionó la comida corriente, con el fin de aprovechar la clientela que había ganado. Hoy vende en un espacio de su casa que para el crecimiento del negocio le ha quedado pequeño y este es justamente su desafío, adecuarlo y más adelante ubicar un nuevo punto de venta. Su credikiva es el primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará materias primas, como arroz, carnes, verduras en volumen para ganar descuentos por la compra de contado y enseres de cocina y trabajar más holgado con la clientela. Pablo en su condición de casado y con 4 hijos en las edades de 12 a 23 años sueña con verlos exitosos y todos los días se esfuerza por sacar adelante a su familia mediante su trabajo.
texts.en: Pablo has a restaurant located in the community of La Pradera where he sells stews, cream of cheese soup, yucca meals, and other of his own delicious recipes traditional to the Caribbean Coast. It is located in Cordoba's savannah region. He thought of his enterprising idea in the city of Barranquilla when the community had its first inhabitants. At first he sold fried foods and natural fruit drinks, including orange, lemon, mango, zapote (a fleshy tropical fruit), medlar, watermelon, melon, and guanabana (a fragrant tropical fruit). His business gradually expanded and he added common foods with the goal of catering to the clientele he had already won. Today he has a space in his house that has become too small to support the growth of his business and this is just the challenge he faces. He needs to recondition it and in the future to move it to a new location. His Kiva loan is the first he has with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) and with it he will purchase ingredients, such as rice, meats, and vegetables in large volumes to earn discounts on cash sales. He will also purchase tools for the kitchen to be able to serve his clients more freely. Pablo is married and he has 4 children between the ages of 12 and 23. He dreams of seeing them achieve success and every day he works to support his family through his business.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients, such as rice, meats, and vegetables.

loans.name: Vanesa

texts.es: Vanesa, de 32 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Henry de 34 años y sus 2 queridos hijos Rosa de 14 y Jorge de 2 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. El negocio de Vanesa esta ubicado en su propia casa, su puesto de comida es muy concurrido por las personas que desean servirse un delicioso platillo nocturno, siendo su especialidad los Juanes y el Tacacho (Platillos típicos de la selva peruana), platillos con los cuales se ha hecho muy conocida entre sus comensales. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar, ya que desde muy pequeña tuvo esta afición. Lleva 2 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todos sus clientes al mismo tiempo. Con el tiempo, espera juntar el dinero necesario para poner un restaurante, donde pueda brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Por ello solicita la ayuda de todos ustedes para que pueda desarrollar su negocio de venta de comida. Este será el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que invertir bien el dinero si quiere que su negocio progrese, en su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y activa. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más ingredientes para preparar sus deliciosos platillos.
texts.en: Vanesa, 32 years old, is a friendly and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house along with her husband, Henry, 34, and their two dear children, Rosa who is 14 and Jorge who is 2, to whom she wishes to provide a better quality of life. Vanesa's business is located in her own house. Her food stall is well trafficked by people who wish to serve themselves a delicious dish at night, her specialties being Juanes and Tacacho (typical dishes of the Peruvian jungle), dishes with which she has made herself well known among her diners. What she likes most about her job is to cook since since she was young she had this hobby. She has been doing this activity for two years and considers the most difficult part is attending to all her customers at the same time. With time, she hopes to put together the necessary money to start a restaurant where she can provide better service to her customers. For this, she is requesting the help of all of you so she may develop her business selling food. This will be her fifth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to invest the money well if she wants her business to progress. In her community bank, she is a happy and active member. With the 2,500 new "soles" requested, she will buy more ingredients to prepare her delicious dishes.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for the preparation of food.

loans.name: Uk

texts.en: From Kompong Chhnang Province, Mrs. Uk is a 28-year-old married woman and the mother of three school-aged kids. She is a local farmer who has been planting a variety of crops for nine years. She also relies on income from her husband’s work as a domestic construction worker. She planted rice crops two months ago, but her crops are not growing well because they need more fertilizer. To remedy the situation, she would like a loan to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her plowing machine.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and gasoline for her plowing machine.

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en: Bernardita is 42 years old and lives in Prenza, Tangub City, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and a mother of one adult-aged child. Bernardita has a mini-grocery store at home. She sells canned goods, food in pouches, coffee, milk in sachet, candies and chocolates. She also makes freshly prepared snacks to sell like banana cue and pancake. She established her business 10 years ago to generate a monthly income of PHP 3,000. She requested a loan of PHP 15,000 from GDMPC to purchase stock to sell. Bernardita has been a member of GDMPC for one year. In the future, Bernardita hopes to purchase more stock and allow customers a greater choice.

loans.use: to purchase stock to sell

loans.name: Brunilda

texts.es:
Brunilda forma parte del banco comunal “Rompiendo Barreras”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Temuco.
Ella se dedica a vender ropa de segunda mano, ropa nueva y plantas, desde su casa o visita las casas de sus clientes. Trabaja en éste rubro desde hace 23 años, durante éste tiempo le ha ido muy bien en su negocio y mantiene la clientela de sus comienzos. 
Con el crédito comprará ropa nueva, ropa de segunda mano, lencería, manteles y cortinas.
Sus metas en su negocio son abastecer su negocio con una mayor cantidad de mercadería, para vender y obtener mayores ganancias. Además tiene contemplado para éste año, arrendar un local establecido para vender su mercadería de manera más tranquila y menos sacrificada. 
Brunilda vive junto a sus dos hijos de 26 y 25 años de edad, además de dos nietos de 13 y 8 años de edad. Comenta que durante su vida ha podido cumplir sus sueños, por lo que por ahora se encuentra tranquila. 
Ella está muy contenta y agradecida del crédito brindado por Fondo Esperanza, ya que le ha permitido invertir en su negocio. Respecto al grupo del banco comunal al cual pertenece, comparte con ellos desde hace 5 años, por lo que la relación es muy grata, debido a la unidad y solidaridad. 
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile). En sus alrededores se ubican una serie de balnearios lacustres (Pucón, Villarrica) y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas, concentrada en parques naturales cercanos. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
Brunilda is a member of the “Rompiendo Barreras” [Breaking Barriers], community bank in the city of Temuco. She sells second hand clothes, new clothes and plants from her house or by visiting customers' houses. She has done this for 23 years and during that time it has gone very well for her in the business. She maintains the same customers she has had from the beginning. 
 
With the loan, she will buy new clothes, second hand clothes, lingerie, tablecloths and curtains. Her goals for her business are to supply her business with a larger quantity of merchandise to sell and obtain more earnings. She also has planned for this year renting a locale to sell her merchandise more calmly and in an easier way. 
 
Brunilda lives with her two children, aged 26 and 25 years old. She also has two grandchildren, aged 13 and 8. She remarks that she has been able to make her dreams come true in her life, and that is why she feels calm now. She is very happy and grateful for the loan offered by Fondo Esperanza since it has allowed her to invest in her business. In regards to the community bank group to which she belongs, she has been with them for 5 years and they get along very well, due to the unity and supportiveness.
 
Temuco is the capital of the Araucanía region. The city is located 670 kilometers to the south of Santiago (the capital of Chile). Nearby are a series of lake beaches (Pucón, Villarrica) and very striking flora and fauna in the nearby nature parks. It is worth mentioning that this region is where 50% of Mapuches, and indigenous people, live in our country.

loans.use: to buy new clothes, second hand clothes, lingerie, tablecloths and curtains.

loans.name: Wakeur Mousbah Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe de solidarité Wakeur Mousbah est créé le jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois le 7 juillet 2011, il est constitué de vingt trois femmes qui sont sœurs, amies , cousines, voisines et qui partagent les mêmes convictions religieuses; elles sont toutes des commerçantes.


Madame Aïchétou la responsable est âgée de 55 ans, mariée, mère de quatre enfants dont un garçon, elle a sa nièce en charge; elle mène une activité de commerce et fait parallèlement de l'embouche bovine, ovine et de la tannerie, elle a une bonne expérience de 7 ans. Sur la photo elle est debout à droite habillée en sari blanc orange.




Elle achéte ses produits, moutons et vaches dans un pays limitrophe et dans sa localité et revend dans son village.

Elle envisage avec son prêt acheter des parfums, draps, habits, chaussures....pour répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et ainsi gagner plus de revenus.



Elle souhaite avec ses bénéfices économiser pour ouvrir une cantine.
texts.en:
Le groupe de solidarité Wakeur Mousbah est créé le jour de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois le 7 juillet 2011, il est constitué de vingt trois femmes qui sont sœurs, amies , cousines, voisines et qui partagent les mêmes convictions religieuses; elles sont toutes des commerçantes.


Madame Aïchétou la responsable est âgée de 55 ans, mariée, mère de quatre enfants dont un garçon, elle a sa nièce en charge; elle mène une activité de commerce et fait parallèlement de l'embouche bovine, ovine et de la tannerie, elle a une bonne expérience de 7 ans. Sur la photo elle est de bout à droite habillée en sari blanc orange.




Elle achéte ses produits, moutons et vaches dans un pays limitrophe et dans sa localité et revend dans son village.

Elle envisage avec son prêt acheter des parfums, draps, habits, chaussures....pour répondre aux besoins de la clientèle et ainsi gagner plus de revenus.



Elle souhaite avec se bénéfices économiser pour ouvrir une cantine.

loans.use: Acheter des marchandises diverses destinées à la vente.

loans.name: Walter Miguel

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Primero De Abril se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive don Walther, el tiene 32 años de edad, está casado y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos 17, 16, 14 años,  todos  estudian en colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa. Lleva tres ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son de gran ayuda para financiar su negocio.

Nuestro amigo se dedica a la venta de  frutas y verduras. Trabaja todos los días desde las  05h00 hasta las 14h00, el se desplaza en su carro desde la madrugada hasta el mercado mayorista en Portoviejo para comprar los productos para poder ofrecerles a sus clientes, luego recorre la ciudad y ciertos sitios cercanos vendiendo sus productos, tiene 16 años que se dedica a esta actividad y gracias a Dios le da lo necesario para poder vivir.

Este crédito es para comprar frutas y legumbres.
 
Sus sueños son comprar otro carro ya que el que tiene está un poco deteriorado.
texts.en:
The “Primero de Abril” (April First) Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton.  It is known for its rich pre-colonial cultures and its arts and crafts, which are recognized on a national and international level.  The famous Panama hats are from this area.

This is where Walter, age 32, lives.  He is married and has three children.  The children are 17, 16, and 14; and they are all in school.  His wife is a housewife.

He has been in his communal bank for three cycles.  He likes it because the loans are a big help in financing his business.  Our friend sells fruits and vegetables.  He works every day from 5:00 a.m. until 2:00 p.m. 

He leaves with his cart very early in the morning to go to the wholesale market in Portoviejo.  He goes to buy products to be able to sell them to his customers.  He then goes through the city and specific nearby sites selling his products.  He has been doing this for 16 years.  Thank God he gets what he needs to be able to make a living.

This loan is to buy fruits and vegetables.

His dream is to buy another cart because the one he has is a bit run-down.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: 6 Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Đậu operates a food stall selling pork pies and fermented pork rolls. She is requesting a loan to purchase materials to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell.

Đậu is 51 years old and married with four children. She is the leader of a five-member group, the 6 Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group. Đậu lives with no dependents in Thanh Hoa city, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Đậu's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund of Poor Women. Đậu has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that Đậu faces in her business is the lack of capital.

In the future, Đậu hopes for her children to find a good job and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make pork pies and fermented pork rolls to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa de 41 años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, no cuenta con servicios básicos, ubicada en la zona rural del distrito de Tambogrande que pertenece al departamento de Piura.  Esta zona se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera y artesana.

Desde hace 6 años aproximadamente Rosa se ha dedicado a la venta de abarrotes (productos que se utilizan diariamente como: leche, arroz, aceite, azúcar, papel higiénico, atún, huevos,etc), útiles de limpieza y bebidas, su negocio lo ha colocado en su misma casa para su comodidad y seguridad, con las ganancias por la venta de sus productos  trata de cubrir  todos sus gastos y necesidades de su hogar.

Para poder  ampliar su negocio a solicitado un crédito a Edpyme Alternativa  de 1500 nuevos soles para comprar más mercaderías para abastecer su bodega, con el único objetivo de que su negocio crezca y tenga más productos que ofrecerles a sus clientes;  para cubrir su préstamo y sus obligaciones familiares.  Rosa es una persona dedicada y trabajadora que se preocupa por tener más comodidades para su familia al igual que brindarle otras oportunidades a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Rosa is 41 years old and lives in her home with her husband and children. They do not receive basic services. Rosa resides in the rural section of the District of Tambogrande, which is part of the Department of Piura. This area is known for having businesses that involve agriculture, livestock breeding, and handicrafts.

For approximately six years, Rosa has sold groceries including everyday products such as milk, rice, oil, sugar, toilet paper, tuna, eggs, cleaning supplies, and beverages. Her business is located in her home, which allows her to be comfortable and secure. With the earnings she generates from the sale of her products, Rosa is able to cover all of her expenses and her household needs.

To expand her business, Rosa is requesting a loan from Edpyme Alternativa in the amount of 1500 PEN. She will buy more merchandise to restock her store. Her only goal is to grow her business by having more products to offer to her customers. This will allow her to repay her loan and meet her family obligations. Rosa is a dedicated and hardworking person who is concerned about providing more comforts for her family and providing other opportunities for her children.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise to restock her store.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
For the last two years Margaret has been operating a boutique in Oloitoktok town. She is 36 years old and the single mother of four schooling children.

She was introduced to KADET by a KADET client. This will be her first loan. She intends to use the loan to add stock of trousers, shirts and dresses.

In the future Margaret hopes to expand her business and generate more income in order to buy land.

loans.use: To add stock of trousers, shirts and dresses.

loans.name: Mery Iralda

texts.es:
Mery Iralda tiene 41 años de edad es soltera tiene dos hijos, vive con los hijos de dieciocho, diez años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de Bolívar.

 La VRC Unión y Progreso la Colombia baja, esta conformada por quince integrantes y está ubicada a 90 minutos de la cooperativa esta ventanilla se dedica a Actividades Agrícolas, siembra de cacao, arroz, maíz, Soya plátano, naranja, etc. 


Mery  se dedica a la agricultura, tiene dos hectáreas de terreno ahí siembra cacao, arroz, maíz, soya, plátano  las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana, tambien se dedica a la crianza de pollos.

 Solicita el crédito para poder comprar más terreno, semillas, abonos e insumos para mantener en buenas condiciones los cultivos para lo posterior venderlos. 

Con el préstamo le ayudará a suplir necesidades económicas, Enfrentar desafíos que son muy frecuentes como la competencia y las plagas. 
El sueño es poderse comprar una casa y más terreno para sembrar más de lo normal para producir y aumentar los ingresos.
. . 
En los tiempos libres le gusta salir de paseo con los hijos al río para poderse refrescar.
texts.en:
Mery Iralda is 41 years old, single, and has two children.  She lives with her children, aged 18 and 10, in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province.

The 'Unión y Progreso la Colombia Baja' community bank has fifteen members and is located 90 minutes from our cooperative.  The members of this community bank work in farming, growing cacao, rice, corn, soy, bananas, oranges, etc.

Mery is a farmer.  She has two hectares of land where she sows cacao, rice, corn, soy and bananas.  She makes her purchases and sales in San José del Tambo every weekend.  she also raises chickens.

Mery is requesting this loan to buy more land, seeds, manure and supplies to keep her crops in good condition so that she can sell them later.

This loan will help Mery to financially cover her needs.  She faces very frequent challenges in the form of competition and pests.  Her dream is to buy a house and more land so that she can sow and produce more than she does now and increase her income.

In her free time, Mery enjoys going out for walks by the river with her children so that they can cool themselves down.

loans.use: to buy more land, seeds, manure and supplies

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn is married with 3 children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Merlyn is 41 years old and has 2 children who are in school.

Merlyn has a fishing business in the Philippines. Merlyn requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

Merlyn has been in this business for 11 years. She would like to grow and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fishing gear and equipment.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh is 35 years old and is married. She has 2 daughters and lives with them and her husband in Ho Chi Minh City.

Anh and her husband earn an income to support their family by running a general store at their house. Anh intends to use her loan to buy many kinds of foods to sell from her general store, such as eggs, milk and confectionery.

She hope her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her family's living conditions and save money for her children's education.

loans.use: To buy many kinds of foods to sell, such as eggs, milk and confectionery.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en: Jessica lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is single with four children and one of her children goes to school. She has two additional family members. She sells second-hand clothes on a retail basis at the market.  She has been in this business for the last eight years. She works six days a week .She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO to buy more bales of second hand clothes. She generates additional income through knitting tablecloths. Jessica’s goals and aspirations are to start importing used clothes and to be a wholesaler. Her major business challenges are seasonality and the ever-increasing prices of second hand clothes. She lives in her own house and the family has access to electricity but does not have access to piped water. Her monthly expenses include food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bales of used clothes

loans.name: Wekhoyela Shg Group

texts.en:
Bonface is the facilitator of the Wekhoyela SHG group. Bonface and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Bonface takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund for affordable loans repayments and to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Bonface had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Bonface was only able to harvest four bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Bonface and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Bonface will educate his children and invest in raising livestock.

In 2012, the members of Wekhoyela SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

In the photograph above, Bonface is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Edesia

texts.en: Edesia is married with 6 children. She is 57 years old and lives in Palomoc, Titay, Zamboanga Sibugay. Edesia owns a sari-sari (variety) store to earn a living and has had this business for 7 years. Each month, she earns about Php 4,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of Php 5,000 to purchase stock for her general store. She became a member of PMPC this year, 2011. In the future, Edesia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her general store.

loans.name: Loan

texts.en: Loan is 31 years old. She is a member of AN Tap cluster. She has two children who go to school. She is a farmer who not only grows rice but also sells dry goods in the market such as beans and peanuts. She has been doing this job for one year. She has a monthly income of about 3.500.000 Vietnam dong (VND). She has participated in SEDA since 2008. The last time she borrowed 8.288.000 VND and repaid that loan punctually. This is the 5th time she is borrowing money from SEDA. In this loan cycle she would like to borrow 9.184.000 VND to buy more peanuts and beans to sell.

loans.use: to buy more peanuts and beans to sell.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en: Furaha is taking another Kiva loan to boost her poultry business. Her previous loan helped improved her profits and helped her meet customer demand. With the Kshs 10,000 loan she is now requesting, Furaha wants to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed for her business.  She dreams of expanding her enterprise in the future and employing more people.

loans.use: to purchase poultry chicks and chicken feed for her poultry business.

loans.name: Caroline Kaithiori

texts.en: Caroline is a single woman. She has a daughter who is four years old. She describes herself as honest, trustworthy, and innovative. She operates a general store where she provides M-pesa (mobile phone-based money transfer) services, and sells phones and airtime. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located near a tarmac road. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more airtime vouchers and Safaricom cards. Her business goal is to run several similar general stores within five years.

loans.use: To buy more airtime vouchers and Safaricom cards.

loans.name: Agalelei

texts.en:
Agalelei is thirty years of age and married with four children. She has owned a business selling general farm supplies and equipment to local farmers  for two years. Agalelei needs a loan of WST $1,500 to invest in expanding the business. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 250 talas or US $104 per week) to improve and expand the business.

In 2010, Agalelei joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.  Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Agalelei's second loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Lenah

texts.en:
Lenah is 34 years old, married and the mother of three children, age 10, 6 and 3 years old.  Her spouse is a businessman who contributes a monthly income to the family. 

She owns a chemist or drugstore in Kapsabet town and has been in operation for the past five years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

Lenah is requesting a loan from KADET Ltd. of KES 30,000 and wishes to use this amount to purchase assorted drugs for sale in her chemist. The profits will be used to expand her chemist and repay the loan.

She hopes for her business to be self-sustainable and to improve her family's living standards
.

loans.use: To purchase stock for her retail shop.

loans.name: Murataly

texts.en: Murataly was born in 1971 year. He is industrious man. Murotaly is married and has 3 children. His children are non adults. Murotaly has been busy with animal husbandry more than 6 years. His wife helps him with feeding cattle. Murotaly little by little develops his business. Now, he feeds 5 sheep and 6 cows. His business is only source of income. The family living condition is poor. Murotaly is asking for a loan of 2000 Somoni to buy 2 cows. He awaits your support. This loan will help hit to develop business.

loans.use: To buy 2 cows to sell

loans.name: Maria

texts.en:
On the first years of managing the sari-sari store business, Maria thought that it’ll be difficult. Considering the market competition/customer’s demands. However, she’s grateful that with the help of the Lord and by using Center for community Transformation (CCT), the prior loan of Php 40, 000 was approved and became a great help for her business to step up. Maria once again wants to express her gratitude. 

Despite of the business competition, still God supplies customers and increase sales. Approximately Php 10, 000 is her monthly earnings that became one of their source of income. Every time her husband is available, they’re helping each other in running the business. 

She decided to apply for a loan of Php 50, 000 as a supplementary capital for buying grocery products for her variety store like Bottled drinks, instant noodles, canned goods and other supplies. Complete products will indeed increase sales and profit.

On a weekly basis, Maria regularly meets with her co-fellowship members to share her life’s testimony, experience on the business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and listen to the Word of God. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 members. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social relationship with other partners, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of grocery items to sell and materials to be used in the beautification of her store

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes has owned her store for about 3 years. She opened the business when she returned from abroad where she worked as a housekeeper in order to accumulate capital. Her first business, a phone center, did not work out and she decided to open this store. Luckily, things have been going well, but she is in need of a loan in order to buy products for her store. She is married and has 2 children. Her husband also helps in her business when he cannot find work.

Mifex offers its clients microinsurance and access to business training and educational programs. For more information about microfinance, Ecuador, and our services, please visit www.mifex.org.

loans.use: Improve store inventory

loans.name: Thon

texts.en:
Thon P. is 32 years old and is a mother of 3. She and her husband (pictured here because she was busy working when we visited) work on their small plantation growing a variety of vegetables. One of her daughters works in a garment factory in the outskirts of Phnom Penh and earns $50-80 per month. They are also raising 2 pigs which they will eventually sell in the local market.

With this loan, Thon P. will increase the size of her plantation and continue to raise her pigs for additional income when they mature. This loan will help Thon P. to increase her standard of living, and she is confident that her income will grow with this new resource.

In the future, Thon P. dreams of saving enough money to build a new home for her children.

loans.use: Expanding plantation and buying food to raise pig

loans.name: Djamila

texts.en: Djamila plans to increase her number of dairy cows, which will enable her to sell more milk. She supplies milk in the village and nearby markets. This 27-year-old woman has been in this business for 6 years. She is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan, in the Fizuli region. She is married and has a child. She is applying for a loan of $1200 to buy a milk cow.

loans.use: to buy a milk cow

loans.name: Amude

texts.en:
Amude O. is a young entrepreneur in Trou-Du-Nord, Haiti where she sells various goods, such as hygeneic products, food items, and clothing, in her community’s local market place. She and her husband, Lalase, have one young daughter, Wadlise (age 2), and Amude’s business has been crucial to helping sustain their growing family. With this first loan, she will expand the inventory of her store to better meet the needs of her customers.

Note: Amude is one of five microentrepreneurs in her Bank of Hope solidarity group, all of whom have gone through Esperanza's business training courses. Each of the five members will receive a share of this $750 loan for their respective businesses and will be accountable to each other for repaying their share of this loan together. This group-lending methodology ensures that members cooperate to help one another repay their loans and invest wisely in their businesses and families.

loans.use: To expand inventory of miscellaneous goods, such as hygeneic products, food items, and clothing

loans.name: Obida

texts.ru:
Obida V. is 42 years old, married and has 4 children. She has a middle school education. She has been selling food products for the past 6 years. Her husband is currently in Russia earning some extra income for the family. Her children help her in her work. Before she became a client of MicroInvest, she would have to borrow the money necessary to increase turnover from local illegal moneylenders that asked for high interest. She was thrilled to hear about interest free borrowing that MicroInvest has to offer. Currently, she was able to increase turnover and secure a permanent sales location in one of the central parts of the region. In the future she is planing to secure another sales location and start selling products wholesale.

Translated from Russian by Jane Mazur, Kiva volunteer

Вохидова Обида – 42 года. Замужем, мать 4 детей. Образование среднее. Занимается торговлей продуктами питания вот уже 6 лет. Муж в Российской Федерации на заработках. Дети помогают ей в торговле. До того как стала, кредитоваться в МЗФ Микроинвест, брала необходимую сумму для расширения товарооборота у местных нелегальных кредиторов подпись большие проценты. Услышав о без залоговой программе Микроинвест для предпринимателей примчалась в организацию. Сейчас она увеличила товарооборот, приобрела постоянную точку деятельности в одном из центральных районов области. В будущем планирует открыть еще одну точку в городе и заниматься оптовой продажей.

loans.use: to open another activity place

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Sra. Julia belongs to the Mujeres Yungainas al Progreso ("Forward-Looking Women of Yungay") community bank. Her meat-selling business is located in the market at Yungay in the Peruvian "departamento" of Ancash. Julia, 42, is married and has two children who are in elementary school.

With a recently-granted loan from Manuela Ramos of S/.1,000 (1,000 Peruvian soles or about US$330), to be repaid in 6 installments, Julia will buy live animals and take them to a local abattoir for slaughtering; by cutting out middle men, she can reduce her selling costs. Julia says that meat sales have fallen because of rising prices; consequently, she not only offers different kinds of meat but also other products demanded by her customers.

Julia hopes to go on improving her business and she'd like to buy modern scales and machines for cutting meat.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Julia pertenece al Banco comunal Mujeres Yungaínas al Progreso, su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado D. Yungay, Provincia D. Yungay, Departamento D. Ancash. Tiene 42 años, está casada y tiene 2 hijos quienes están estudiando la primaria.

Con el reciente préstamo que le otorgó Manuela Ramos D. S/. 1,000.00 ($ 330) el cual será cancelado en 6 cuotas, comprará animales vivos y los llevará al camal para luego expenderlos en su lugar D. venta, lo que le resulta más beneficioso que comprar a terceros. Comenta la señora Julia que debido al alza D. precios ha disminuido un poco la venta D. carne, por ese motivo no solo ofrece una variedad D. carne sino varios productos para satisfacer a sus clientes.

Su anhelo es mejorar el servicio D. venta D. carnes para lo cual compraría balanzas modernas y maquinas D. cortar carne.

loans.use: Buy live animals.

loans.name: Setupuaseve

texts.en: Setupuaseve is 22 years old and joined SPBD last year to get funding to start two businesses, a shop and a plantation. She has done very well in both areas, and has now applied for a new loan to restock her general store and rebuild her house. She makes $72 a day from the shop and about $96 a day  from the plantation.

loans.use: To restock her grocery store and for home improvements

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria buys and sells fruit. Her work consists of purchasing large quantities of fruit to later transport to her warehouse or to other vendors for transport to other comercial locales such as Huancayo and Lima. Every morning, very early in the morning, she selects and packages the fruit with the help of her husband and children whenever they have free time, trying to help their mother whenever possible. Gloria needs more capital funds to stimulate the growth of her investment and obtain greater earnings, for savings and to build a house. She seeks a sum of money as a loan that we are sure you will be able to help with.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

Gloria, se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas; su trabajo consiste en comprar a las personas de la chacra una gran cantidad de frutas para luego transportarlos a su bodega o depósito donde los encajonan y los venden a las personas que transportan frutas a las ciudades más comerciales como Huancayo y Lima.Todas las mañanas desde muy temprano tiene que seleccionar las frutas y encajonarlas labor que realiza con la ayuda de su pareja e hijos quienes en los tiempos libres tratan de ayudar a su madre en lo posible.Gloria requiere de mayor capital para aumentar su inversión en la compra de frutas y por ende aumentar sus ganancias y ahorrar para la construcción de su casita y mejora de sus ambientes.Solicita una suma de dinero en préstamo que estamos seguros usted podrá proporcionárselos.

loans.use: An injection of Capital funds to stimulate growth of the investment and obtain greater earnings.

loans.name: Pari Group

texts.en: Chausiku is single, and she has a kiosk business. She would like a loan to expand her business.

loans.use: To expand her business.

loans.name: Victoriano

texts.es:
Victoriano M. is a hard-working man who, since he was a child, has worked as a farmer in the field and with cattle. He has a house in El Sauce, city of León.

Mr. M. is married and has five children. He says that he works very hard to provide his family with the best possible lifestyle so they can develop and be great professionals and so they don't have to go through all the adversities he has gone through.

It is important to note that since Mr. M.'s house is located far away from the urban area he doesn't have electricity, and this is why he is asking Ceprodel to help him to get a loan to responsibly pay for the solar panel he has bought.

With the solar he will be able to power two lamps and a little TV. Thanks to the solar panel the situation at his home will improve since they will no longer need to use candles. The use of the solar panel will benefit him and his children who need it so much because they are students.

Translated from Spanish by Veronica MR, Kiva volunteer

Victoriano M. se caracteriza por ser un caballero muy trabajador que desde su niñez se ha desarrollado en el trabajo del campo en la agricultura y la ganadería teniendo su propia casa de habitación en la ciudad de León en el municipio de El Sauce.

Es un caballero casado y con cinco hijos a su cargo que lucha grandemente por brindarles un mejor estilo de vida para que puedan desarrollarse y llegar a ser grandes profesionales evitando atravesar situaciones adversas como las ha atravesado él según comenta.

Es necesario destacar que la necesidad que atraviesa es que por vivir en una lugar alejado de la zona urbana no cuenta con energía eléctrica para su iluminación y es por tal razón que acude a Ceprodel para obtener un crédito ya que ha adquirido un panel solar y muy responsablemente debe de honrar esta deuda.

Con el panel solar es necesario destacar que tiene lugar para instalar dos lámparas y un pequeño televisor. Ya con esto hace posible la mejora en su hogar por el hecho de que ya no necesitará candiles para iluminarse sino que hará uso del panel solar para beneficio propio y de sus hijos que tanto lo necesitan por estar en etapa estudiantil.

loans.use: To pay for a solar panel for his house

loans.name: Yadish

texts.en: Yadish A. is a 26 year old farmer who sells milk and yoghurt to the local people. He started his business in 2004. He lives in a small village in the Saatli region with his parents. He has applied for a loan to purchase three calves for USD300 each and the rest of loan he will spend on fodder.

loans.use: To purchase three calves and fodder

loans.name: Hadiyatin

texts.id:
Hadiyatin has sold “nasi campur” (an Indonesian mixed topped rice) since 2001. Her customers are garment factory and construction workers who work around Jl. Gunung Gede, and people who pass her booth. Everyday, she should go to Pasar Sahira at 4 am to purchase the materials that will be cooked, i.e. vegetables, meat, and seasonings. Then she cooks and being ready to start selling the food at 7 am. Around this time, her booth is very crowded with customers.

The revenue she earns is used as the capital that enables her to run the booth the day after, while the excess is used for fulfilling Hadiyatin family’s needs. She expects to earn the loan that will be used to increase the capital of her business.

Translated from Indonesian by Hestyana, Kiva Volunteer.

Hadiyatin menekuni usaha jual nasi campur sejak tahun 2001. Para pembelinya adalah para buruh garmen dan buruh bangunan yang ada di Jl.Gunung Gede, dan juga orang-orang yang lewat di kawasan tempatnya berjualan. Sehari-harinya, dia harus berangkat ke Pasar Sahira pada pukul 04.00 untuk membeli bahan-bahan untuk warungnya seperti sayur, daging dan bumbu. Sesuadah itu dia pulang untuk memasak dan menyiapkannya sebelum warungnya buka jam 07.00 pagi. Pada jam ini biasanya banyak sekali pembeli yang singgah diwarungnya. Dari keuntungan usaha ini, bisa dipakai untuk memenuhi kebutuhannya sehari-hari dan juga sebagai modal lagi. Hadiyatin berharap diberi pinjaman untuk dijadikan tambahan modal usaha.

loans.use: Increase capital

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga owns a bazaar in the market near her home, and has been running it for the past six years. It was her sister who left her the business since she was traveling to Chile. Now Olga owns the locale and invests in it.

She sells a variety of products such as jewelry, clothing, stuffed animals, etc. She works for several hours since she also has to tend to her family.

The loans she has previously requested have been used to invest in the purchase of the products she offers.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva volunteer.

Olga tiene un bazar en el mercado cerca de su casa desde hace 6 años. Fue su hermana quién le dejó el negocio, pues viajó a Chile. Ahora Olga dispone del local e invierte en él.

Ella vende diversos productos, como alhajas, ropa, peluches, etc. Trabaja por horas, ya que tiene que atender a su familia.

Los préstamos que ha pedido le han servido para invertir en la compra de los productos que ofrece.

loans.use: To invest in the purchase of the products she offers in her store.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris is a member of the Ccori Soncco Village Bank (meaning Gold Heart in Quechua, the native language of Peru).

Doris is a married 34-year-old mother of two children. Doris buys dye and hangers in her home near Libertad Road. Her husband then collects and brings the products by rental car to the city of Lima and sells them to local businesses.

Doris needs a loan of 1600 Peruvian Nuevo Soles ($575 USD) to invest in more dye and hangers.

Doris´s dream is to expand her business and provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: Doris needs a loan to invest in more dye and hangers.

loans.name: Sabougnouma (Porte Bonheur) Group

texts.fr:
The four women of the Sabougnouma Group (meaning "Lucky Charm") average 46 years of age and four children, and they generally live in polygamous households with their husbands, co-wives, brothers, sisters, and children in the Koko district of Kadiolo, a prefecture in the Sikasso region (Republic of Mali).

They earn an income through work that essentially focuses on food products (dried, smoked, and fresh fish), fruits and vegetables (mangoes, bananas, papayas), and various goods (bread, powdered milk, sugar, etc.) They know each other by ties of community and clan. The members of the Sabougnouma Group are on their 12th loan with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, and all of the preceding ones have been correctly repaid. With this loan, they intend to buy: 10 loads of mangoes, 20 bunches of bananas, 150 kg of sugar, 7 kg of powdered milk, 300 kg of atieké (granulated yam), 15 kg of fish, and 300 loaves of bread.

They get their supplies in Kadiolo and its environs from peasant producers of fruit and vegetables. For the boutique goods, such as sugar and milk, they get their supplies in Bamako, and finally, the atieké is gotten from the Republic of Cote d'Ivoire.

These goods are resold at the grand marketplace of the city of Kadiolo and in homes (wholesale and retail) generally to a customer base made up of all social classes of the region. They hope to realize a profit of 35,000 francs CFA, which will be used to cover the loan interest, to help their husbands with family expenses, and to inject the rest into the businesses. They intend to specialize in the sale of fish and of fruits and vegetables in order to become exporters (of mangoes and fish) in the future.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, a Kiva volunteer

Les quatre femmes du groupe Sabougnouma ont une moyenne d’âge de 46 ans, 4 enfants et vivent en générale dans les foyers polygames avec leurs maris,coépouses,frères et soeurs et enfants dans le quartier Koko de Kadiolo une préfecture de la région de sikasso( République du Mali)

Elles ont une activité économique qui tourne essentiellement autour du commerce de produits alimentaires (poissons séchés, fumés, frais), des fruits et légumes (mangues, bananes, papayes) et divers articles (pains, lait en poudre, sucre etc.). Elles se sont connues par des liens de voisinage et de parenté. Les membres du groupe Sabougnouma sont à leur douzième prêt avec l’Institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso et tous les précédents ont été correctement remboursés. Avec ce prêt, elles comptent achèter, 10 chargements de mangues, 20 regimes de banane, 150kg de sucre, 7kg de lait en poudre, 300 kg d’atieké (Semoule d’igname),15 kg de poissons et 300 miches de pains.

Elles s’approvisionnent à Kadiolo et alentours auprès de paysans producteurs de fruits et légumes. Pour les articles de boutique tel le sucre et le lait elles s’approvisionnent à Bamako. Enfin en république de côte d’voire pour l’atièké.

Ces produits sont revendus au grand marché de la ville de Kadiolo et à la maison (en gros ou en détail) généralement à une clientèle constituée de toutes les catégories sociales de la contrée. Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice de 35.000FCFA qui sera utilisé à payer les intérêts du prêt , aider les maris dans les dépenses de la famille et injecter le reste dans les activités. Elles comptent se spécialiser dans la vente de poissons et de fruits et légumes pour devenir dans un futur proche des exportatrices ( de mangues et poissons).

loans.use: To buy food items (fish, fruit, bread, milk, sugar, atièké) and various articles

loans.name: Tanjigul

texts.ru: Хурамова Таджигул жительница района Хуросон.Возраст 60 лет, замужем, имеет  2 детей. Клиентка на  протяжении 20 лет занимается животноводством.В данное время в доме клиентки нет дойной коровы. Она решила взть кредит сроком на 12 месяцев и купить корову.Что бы в семье всегда было свежее молоко и кисло-молочная продукция.
texts.en:
Tanjigul H. lives in the Khuroson region. She is 60 years old, is married and has 2 children. Tanjigul has been raising livestock for 20 years. Right now she does not own a dairy cow. She has decided to take out a 12 month loan to purchase a cow in order to provide her family with fresh milk and dairy products.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es:
El Sr. Alejandro tiene poco tiempo que adquirió su casa pero le está haciendo falta las protecciones de las puertas principal el con sus ahorros pudo poner las protecciones de las ventanas pero no le alcanzó para las puertas.

El Sr. Alejandro y su esposa Jessica trabajan en una tienda de papelería ellos son los encargados del negocio; este es el ingreso familiar.

Alejandro nos comento que por falta de la seguridad de su casa ya le han robado algunas cosas de su casa. Y es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo de $300.00 dlls para la colocación de las protecciones en las puertas.
texts.en:
Alejandro bought a house recently and he needs security gates for the doors to the house. He used his savings to buy security grilles for the house's windows but he didn't have enough for the doors.

Alejandro and his wife, Jessica, manage an office supply store. The family income comes from their jobs there.

Alejandro told us that because of the lack of security, his house has already been robbed of various things. He's asking for a US$300 loan so that he can install security gates on the doors of his house.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install security gates.

loans.name: Nazira

texts.en: G. Nazira is a very responsible and hard working woman. She is married and has two adorable kids. Six years ago, she started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances. She has a sewing machine in her house where she produces national dresses for women. Nazira has a big family. Now her children are going to kindergarten. She hopes that her children can continue with their education. That is the reason that she needs to continue growing her business. She asks for a loan of 2700 Somoni (800 USD) that will be invested in buying supplies to increase her production and meet the customers' demands. She commits herself to return the amount in 8 months. Help this family with improving the quality of their life by contributing to the growth of Nazira’s business. They will sincerely thank you for it.

loans.use: Fabrics for sewing women national dresses.

loans.name: Mech

texts.en: Mrs. Mech M. was born in 1966 and she lives in Ang Konh Village Takeo Province.
