Es importante destacar que por medio de la realización de esta obra le proporcionará a su familia un techo digno donde vivir y con todas las condiciones necesarias para el desarrollo de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Jeison Franklin lives in the city of Managua and he is the father of a family.

He visited our offices to request a loan following his decision to make improvements to his house. The improvements that Jeison will make are to install a new wall and to install a floor in his house.

The materials that he will purchase are sand, construction blocks, cement, and bricks.

It is important to mention that this project will help him provide his family with a dignified house where to live. It will also help him provide all the necessary living conditions in which to raise his children.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old and married with three children. All of her children are in school. She has a business selling sugar in Jigomoni Branch in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Mary requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more sugar to sell. She says that she wants to buy cows and goats with the extra income from her loan in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar to sell

loans.name: Twikure Mu Bukene B Group

texts.fr:
Leonille fait partie du groupe Twikuremubukene B. Le nom du groupe signifie « chasser la pauvreté ». Leonille est née au Rwanda et a 50 ans. Elle est mariée avec 8 enfants de 5 à 25 ans, dont 5 scolarisés. Son niveau d’éducation est 6 ans de primaire. 

Leonille est agricultrice. C’est son deuxième cycle de prêt avec ACB. Elle va utiliser son crédit afin de louer des champs pour cultiver le maïs, acheter le maïs pour semer, acheter des engrais et payer la main d’œuvre. Les difficultés qu’elle prévoit pour ce crédit sont la possibilité de vol pendant que le maïs est encore dans les champs et les conditions climatiques difficiles. 

Sa stratégie pour la croissance de son business est d‘acheter des autres champs pour ne plus louer à cultiver et de renforcer ses cultures. Dans les prochaines années, Leonille voudrait devenir une agricultrice moderne et avoir des champs suffisants pour cultiver et créer de l’emploi pour les autres. Avec les profits, elle prévoit de payer les frais scolaires pour ses enfants, de se faire assurer et d’épargner.
texts.en:
Leonille is part of the group Twikuremubukene B. The group's name means "to banish poverty". Leonille was born in Rwanda and is 50 years old. She is married and has eight children, ages 5 to 25. Five of the children are in school. She has a 6th grade education. 

Leonille is a farmer. This loan cycle is her second one with ACB. She is going to use her loan to rent fields for growing corn, to buy corn to sow, to buy fertilizer, and to cover the cost of labor. The difficulties she anticipates for this loan are the possibility of theft while the corn is still in the fields and also severe climactic conditions. 

Her strategy for business growth is to buy other fields to avoid paying rent for farming and to boost her crops. In the next few years, she would like to become a modern farmer and to have fields sufficient enough for farming and for creating employment for other people. With the profits, she anticipates covering the schooling costs for her children, getting insurance, and saving money.

loans.use: To rent fields to grow corn, to buy corn to sow, to buy fertilizer, and to cover the cost of labor

loans.name: Bahtygul's Group

texts.en:
Bahtygul is the treasurer of this group. She is 33 and married to a taxi driver. Together with her husband she is bringing up three daughters and a son. The older daughter studies at university, two daughters are at school and the son is preschool age (under seven). 

In order to earn additional money to support the family, Bahtygul cultivates agricultural products. Bahtygul applied for the loan because she needs additional money to purchase fuel and to pay for a tractor driver’s services. 

In the future Bahtygul wants to provide her children with a good education.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line: people (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase fuel and to pay for tractor driver's services.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
La Sra. Maribel vive en la comunidad conocida como Esquilan Chico en la ciudad de Cochabamba, la Sra. Maribel es soltera pero vive con su pareja hace mas de 8 años.  La Sra. Maribel se dedica a la producción de leche cruda aproximadamente 100 litros diarios, la cual vende 50% a la Empresa Pil Andina y el otro 50 % lo destina a la elaboración de quesillo.
El siguiente crédito que solicita es para la compra de un tanque de leche enfriamiento (el tanque de enfriamiento es un deposito de leche cruda que se mantiene en buen estado, es de este tanque de donde recoge la Empresa Pil la leche todas las mañanas y todas las tardes) el cual en primer lugar tiene un costo aproximado de 16.000$us, es por esta razón que la compra la están haciendo conjunta con otras 15 personas de la misma comunidad poniendo 1000$us cada uno. La Sra. Maribel al tener el tanque de enfriamiento cerca de casa podrá colocar más leche en el mismo y tal vez dejar de vender quesillo el cual le toma mucho tiempo.
texts.en:
Señora Maribel lives in the community known as Esquilan Chico in the city of Cochabamba.  Señora Maribel is unmarried, but has been living with her significant other for over 30 years.  Señora Maribel works producing raw milk, approximately 100 liters daily.  She sells 50% to the Pil Andina Company, and the other 50% goes to making cheese.

The loan that she is requesting is to buy a tank for cooling milk (the cooling tank is a place to keep raw milk in good state, and is how the Pil Company receives the milk every morning and evening). This tank costs approximately $16,000, so for this reason she is making the purchase together with 15 other people in her community, who are putting in $1,000 each.

Maribel wants to able to have a cooling tank near her home, so that in the future she can collect more milk in it and perhaps stop selling cheese as it takes up so much time.

loans.use: to buy a cooling tank for raw milk, together with other people.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Berdiyor

texts.ru: Бердиер занимается выращиванием сельхозпродукции. У него большая семья – жена и четверо детей. Выращивание сельхозпродукции  работа трудоемкая, но доходная. От продажи урожая он получает хорошие доходы. Часть продукции он продает, а часть сохраняет для продажи зимой или  ранее весной по более высоким ценам. Бердиер хотел бы получить займ с помощью которого хочет построить помещение для хранения картофеля. Он надеется, что кредиторы будут поддерживать его.
texts.en: Berdiyor is involved in growing agricultural products.  He has a large family - a wife and four children.  Growing agricultural products is a hard, but profitable job.  Berdiyor earns a good income from the sales of his harvest.  He sells a portion of the overall product and saves some for sales in the winter or early spring at higher prices.  Berdiyor wants to obtain a loan, with the help of which he wants to build a space for storing potatoes.  He hopes that the creditors will support him.

loans.use: to build a space for storing potatoes

loans.name: Amanda

texts.es: A sus 63 años de edad, esta mujer con gran espíritu de empresaria sostiene su casa y quiere seguir adelante con la compra de más surtido para el negocio por lo que requiere el préstamo para invertirlo en dulces, snak y mercancía general. Su sueño más cercano es poder ampliarse o alquilar un local donde pueda atender mejor a los clientes y que le quede cerca de su casa para seguir con sus labores de abuela y ama de casa.
texts.en: At 63 years of age, this woman, who has a great entrepreneurial spirit, supports her household and would like to move forward in her business by purchasing more stock.  She needs a loan to invest in candies, snacks and general merchandise.  Her short-term dream is to expand her business or rent premises where she can better serve her customers.  She would like her sales premises to be near her home so that she can continue carrying out her duties as a grandmother and housewife.

loans.use: to buy candies, snacks and general merchandise to stock her business

loans.name: Tamutswa Group

texts.en: Angeline is 51 years old and lives in Harare with her husband and five children who range in age from 18 to 31. She also cares for one other dependent. She earns a living by making footballs, which she sells in the nearby town of Glen-View. She has been in this line of work for three years and says that her main challenge is a lack of capital. She is applying for a loan for $300 to buy more of the materials she needs to make footballs, and believes that this loan will allow her to increase her income and improve her standard of living. In the future, she hopes to open a large factory for making footballs.

loans.use: to buy materials to make footballs.

loans.name: Reem

texts.en:
Reem is a 33-year-old young woman, she is married and has two sons and one daughter.  Her husband is a municipality employee with a decent salary. 

Reem wants to change her old home furniture and purchase new furniture such as dinning room furniture and living room seats to give her family better living conditions but the amount of money she has isn't enough to pay for the furniture.  So she needs to borrow a loan of $1,500 from FATEN.  When Reem gets the loan, she will purchase new home furniture and change the old furniture.  This will positively change her family's living conditions.  Reem is photographed in the picture.

loans.use: to change the old home furniture and purchase new furniture.

loans.name: Cuc

texts.en: Ms Cuc is 45 years old, with two school-aged children. She is a kindergarten teacher. To save in her free time, she makes rice cake and uses the side product to raise pigs for meat. She has been a client of SEDA's credit program since 2008, and has received five loans and used them effectively to expand her business. Currently, she would like a loan of 8,736,000 Vietnamese dong to buy rice as material, and part of it to buy food for pigs.

loans.use: to buy rice as material, and part of it to buy food for pigs.

loans.name: Paulina

texts.es:
Paulina es socia del Banco Comunal Triunfo, tiene 39 años, es madre de 4 hijos, y es socia de FINCA Perú desde hace 4 años.
Paulina tiene un negocio de Panadería, ella lo que mas aprendió de las capacitaciones es a valorarse como mujer eso le ayuda a poder progresar porque confía en ella misma para lograr sus proyectos, le gustan las capacitaciones, recuerda que cuando su hija se enfermó la ayudaron y ella valora mucho eso. El préstamo que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de una máquinas para la panadería.
texts.en:
Paulina is a member of Communal Bank Triunfo. She is 39 years old and is the mother of 4 children. She has also been a member of FINCA Perú for the last 4 years.
Paulina runs a bakery. What she learned most during training workshops was to value herself as a woman; this has helped her progress because she now has enough confidence in herself to know that she will be able to achieve her projects. She likes training workshops. She can remember that she was given aid when her daughter got sick and she values that a lot. She will invest the loan she is requesting in buying machinery for her bakery.

loans.use: to buy machinery for her bakery

loans.name: Margaret Kathule

texts.en:
Margaret 68 years old, is married and has six children ranging from 15 to 35 years old. She describes herself as a quiet and idealistic woman. 

Margaret runs a green grocery and has been selling kale, cabbages, tomatoes, potatoes, and onions for the last six years. Her business faces a problem of financial constraints when buying the vegetables due to the increasing cost of vegetables. She will use the loan of KES 5,000 to buy potatoes and cabbages. In the future, Margaret hopes to be a supplier of vegetables.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and cabbages.

loans.name: Taufau

texts.en:
Taufau is fifty-nine years old and is married with five children.

Taufau Mua owns and operates a business venture, planting and harvesting taro for sale. She has many years of experience in this business. Taufau Mua needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 400 talas or US $167 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2008, Taufau Mua joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral. This is Taufau Mua's fifth loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase weed-killers such as Gramoxome.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is  a 31-year-old  married woman living in a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. She owns a grain milling machine which she has operated for over six years.

Christine started with a stationery shop and after realizing that the benefits were not feasible she ventured into a grain milling business. Her goals are educating her children, building a permanent house, and buying herself a car. Her business dream is to buy three more machines since the demand is very high.

Christine needs the loan to purchase a another grain-milling machine.

loans.use: to buy a new a grain milling machine.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary grace is 40 years old, married with three children. Two of whom are in school, she is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Mary grace has a food vending business in the Philippines. Mary grace requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Mary grace has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Mary grace would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

loans.name: Kodjo François

texts.en:
Mr. François Kodjo T., born in 1962 in Tchagba in Haho, is married with two children. Being unable to get an education due to lack of support, he taught himself to drive and got his driving license in 1982. Unable to buy his own car, he frequented transportation centers to take over from drivers during their rest periods. However, this did not guarantee him enough income to support his household needs. Very quiet and serious, he worries constantly about his family’s well-being. Despite his precarious situation, he succeeded in getting a $200 loan which he gave to his wife to set up a small food business so that she could contribute to the household expenses. With his help, his wife was able to manage and repay this loan, and she received a further loan, in her own name, which she is repaying with no problems.

Mr. T. is now requesting a $2000 loan to buy a car so that he can provide a taxi service. The financing of this project will be of enormous help in stabilizing Mr. T.’s income to provide for the needs of his family, and especially to ensure his children’s education.

Translated from French by Alison Dent, Kiva Volunteer.

Né en 1962 à Tchagba dans le Haho, Monsieur T. Kodjo François est marié et père de deux enfants. N’ayant pas pu faire des études par manque de support, il s’est débrouillé pour se former en conduite et eut son permis de conduire en 1982. Ne pouvant pas s’acheter une voiture, il est figé dans des stations de service de transport pour prendre la main aux chauffeurs en leur temps de repos. Ce qui ne lui garantit pas un peu revenu lui permettant de subvenir aux besoins de son foyer. Très calme et sérieux, il a constamment le souci du bien-être de sa famille, et malgré sa situation très précaire, il a réussi à obtenir un crédit de $200 qu’il a remis à sa femme pour exercer de petit commerce de table afin de contribuer aux charges du ménage. Avec son concours, la femme a su bien gérer et rembourser ce crédit et en a eu un autre en son propre compte qui se rembourse aussi bien.

Aujourd’hui, Monsieur T. Kodjo François sollicite un crédit de $2000 pour s’acheter une voiture pour faire le service de taxi bagage. Financer ce projet contribuera énormément à stabiliser les revenus Monsieur T. Kodjo François pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, surtout assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.

loans.use: To buy a taxi

loans.name: Wiwi

texts.en: Wiwi is  26 years old, and is married with one child aged 7. She sells kerosene and sometimes sells small quantities of rice (13kg per day). Her husband, Kholidin, is a fisherman who goes to the sea once a week depending on the weather. She really hopes to have a larger loan to buy more kerosene.

loans.use: Purchase capital to expand her business

loans.name: Blessing

texts.en: Blessing was born in 1984. She is married with two children. The greatest challenge she has faced in her life is when she had a break down in her smoked fish business due to unfaithful customers.  She wants to be a supplier of vegetables and fresh spices to her community.  GHAPE has given them a good training on business management. Through retailing of these items, Blessing will make life easier for her community. The profit from this business will enable her to stop expecting everything from her husband and will be free from the hard chains of poverty. She plans to repay the loan during the term.

loans.use: Trading of  vegetables and fresh spices

loans.name: Justino

texts.es:
Justino has sold morocho, a typical Ecuadorian dish made with milk and corn, for eight years. He started this business with his own capital. Since a young age, he helped his mother in this same business. His wife also helps with the business. She sells phone cards for cellular phones. Justino works every day from 3pm to 10pm.

Justino asks for a loan to purchase more phone cards, especially since every day he collects more customers, increasing the demand. His capital is insufficient to satisfy all his customer's requests. The loan will help him increase his sales.

Justino is 34 years old and married to his wife Rosa with 2 children, one is a year old and the other is 3. His 3-year-old daughter is in a school near his home. Justino lives in the house of his mother, who gave him, as an inheritance, part of the upstairs of her home. Little by little he is building with cement the upstairs. Thankfully, his business allows him and his wife the ability to further the life of their children, giving them a better future.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer.

Justino lleva 8 años dedicado en esta actividad de venta de morocho, una comida tipica de Ecuador hecha con maiz y leche. El empezó este negocio con un capital propio. Desde muy pequeño el ayudaba a su mamá que tenia la misma actividad y el luego se independizó. Su esposa también le ayuda con el negocio. El también esta vendiendo tarjetas para celulares. Justino trabaja todos los días desde las 15:00pm hasta las 10:00pm

Justino desea el crédito para comprar mas tarjetas de celulares, ya que él cada día ha captado mas clientes y esto a su vez ha hecho que la demanda aumente su capital no es suficiente para satisfacer esta solicitud de sus clientes, teniendo el crédito el podrá incrementar sus ventas.

Justino tiene 34 años de edad, es casado con Rosa tiene 2 hijos. De 1 y 3 años. Su niña de 3 años esta en una escuelita cerca de su casa. El vive en casa de su mamá que le dio como herencia la parte de arriba de su domicilio y él poco a poco la esta construyendo de cemento. Gracias al trabajo que realiza él junto a su esposa están luchando para poder sacar adelante a sus hijos y darle un mejor futuro.

loans.use: To purchase phone cards for sale as a secondary product

loans.name: Yuanita

texts.en: Yuanita H.(examining a patient) is a 45 year old  practitioner who runs her own private facility at Ahero town in Kisumu, Kenya. She is a widow and leaves with her five school/college going children.  She trained and qualified in clinical medicine in 1990. She has since worked in a government hospital but also runs her own private clinic in the middle of Ahero town serving the community around.She is also an HIV Aids coordinator in Nyando District kenya. Her facility offers a wide range of health services including family planning, curative and preventive, laboratory, pharmacy, counseling and also links paedritic ARVs to other health facilities. She attributes her success to hardwork and two previous microfinance loans from KMET.To further expand her facility and services, she requires US $1200.

loans.use: Establish a comprehensive medical unit

loans.name: Jero Ketut Taman

texts.id:
Living in a village where the majority raise pigs, so is Jero Taman who has a fattening piglet business. Loan from Dinari for Rp3000,000 (about US$330) used to buy 4 fattening piglets at a price of Rp1,000,000 (about US$110). The rest was to buy feed. Every day Jero Taman started her work at 8:00AM. First she cleans the stall, then feeding. Sometimes she gave alternative feed like leafs as additional feed. Until harvest she spent Rp1,500,000 (about $165) for feed for 6 months. Income was Rp4,600,000 (about US$500), so nett profit is Rp1,200,000 (about US$132). With this profit she used to support & pay for household expenses.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Hidup di pedesaan sebagian besar memelihara ternak babi. Begitu juga dengan Jero Taman memiliki usaha beternak babi penggemukan. Pinjam dari Dinari sebesar Rp.3.000.000,-. Dipergunakan untuk membeli 4 ekor bibit babi dengan harga Rp.1.000,000,-. Sisanya untuk modal pakan. Setiap hari Jero Taman memulai pekerjaannya mulai jam 8.00 pagi. Pertama-tama yang dilakukan membersihkan kandang setelah itu baru memberi makan.. Untuk selingannya diberi pakan alternative seperti dedaunan sebagai makanan tambahan. Sampai panen menghabiskan modal pakan Rp.1.500.000,- selama 6 bulan. Penghasilan kotor yang diterima Rp.4.600.000,-. Jadi keuntungan bersih yang diterima Rp1.200.000,-.Dengan keuntungan ini bisa dipergunakan untuk membantu semua pengeluaran rumah tangganya.

loans.use:
To buy pig feedstock and feed

Membeli bibit babi dan pakan

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Jorge is twenty years old, single and lives in a house with his mother in the Juan Pablo II development. Presently he works doing contract masonry, plumbing and other construction work.

Jorge has enough experience doing this work because he starting working in the field when he was 15 years old.

Thanks to his find handiwork and his high level of responsibility, he doesn’t lack work, which minimizes the risk of competition.

With this loan Jorge will purchase tools for his work and will also use it to do some other jobs because he will make more money faster. Right now he only has loans with Agrocapital and one other financier, which he pays back responsibly and on time.

Translated from Spanish by a Kiva volunteer.

Jorge tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive en la casa de su madre en la Urbanización Juan Pablo II, actualmente se dedica a prestar servicios como albañil contratista, plomero y otros servicios de la construcción.

Jorge tiene bastante experiencia en el rubro debido a que empezó a trabajar en el mismo desde sus 15 años.

Debido a la mano de obra fina y a la responsabilidad que tiene, no le falta trabajo, lo que minimiza el riesgo de la competencia.

Jorge con la presente solicitud se comprará algunas herramientas para su trabajo y también utilizará el dinero para hacer algunos trabajos como obra vendida ya que ganaría mejor y más rápido. Actualmente sólo tiene crédito con Agrocapital y otra financiera, mismos que paga de manera puntual y responsable.

loans.use: Work capital and repaying a previous loan

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Doña Consuelo works day in day out the land that provides her and her family with their daily sustenance. She deeply cares for her potatoes, corn and alfalfa in order to guarantee a good harvest. Therefore, she leaves her home very early to care for her vegetables. She will start harvesting in April.

Every effort results in a reward, which is why Doña Consuelo is certain she will progress. She is always supported by her family which she deeply loves.

Her youngest son is still in school and even though her husband abandoned them, her hopes and wishes have not gone away. Consuelo is a very hardworking woman. She wishes to increment production by renting other pieces of land. Her strength is admirable in spite of last winter's mercilessness, which devastated her farming fields.

At the moment everything is going well and she will continue sowing. Therefore, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase fertilizers, seeds and part of the land's rent. Let your heart, which is full of solidarity, help Doña Consuelo. she will know how to invest the money wisely.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer.

Doña Cosuelo trabaja día a día la tierra que le proporciona el sustento diario para ella y los suyos, con gran empeño cuida D. sus cultivos D. papa, maíz y alfalfa para asegurarse D. una buena cosecha, por esa razón abandona su hogar muy temprano para poder cuidar sus vegetales ya que en abril cosechará.Cada esfuerzo conlleva a una recompensa es por ello que Doña Consuelo espera progresar con ayuda D. su familia a la que tanto ama, el menor aún está en el colegio, y a pesar del abandono D. su esposo sus deseos y sueños no han desaparecido.Consuelo es muy trabajadora y desea acrecentar su producción alquilando los terrenos que le hacen falta para este fin, esa fortaleza es admirable pese a la pérdida del año pasado por la inclemencia del invierno que azotó sus campos D. cultivo. Por el momento todo está marchando bien y seguirá sembrando, para ello es que solicita un préstamo con el objetivo D. invertirlos en la compra D. abonos, semillas y parte del pago D. los terrenos, ayuda a Doña Consuelo con ese espíritu solidario que tienes, ella sabrá invertir sabiamente ese dinero.

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Lugazi Soth A Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Specioza N.. She is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to buy a freezer. Specioza is 36 years old and single. She has 3 children ranging from age 14 to 20 and her children go to school. Each week, Specioza makes approximately UGX 20000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to construct a commercial house. Specioza has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 200000 in order to invest in her business and the loan was paid back on time.

Specioza is joined in her small group by Jesca N., Mariam B., Mary N., and Damalie A.. Jesca N. has a business running a retail shop and wants to buy a fridge. Mariam B. is currently operating a business selling new clothes and wants a loan to construct a clothes shop. Mary N. operates a business of selling fish and wants to invest more into the business. Damalie A. is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to buy more clothing materials.

loans.use: To expand retail shop business

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
Nely was able to have a family with her only and big love of her life. During a long time they both struggled in his farming land to increase little by little their family’s standard of living. Unfortunately, her husband is been ill lately and the need of medicine and attention has increased alarmingly in these past months. Nely wants to help to improve her husband’s health but she lacks resources to do it. For this reason she is requesting a loan to increase the quality of her products by buying bigger quantities natural fertilizers.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer.

Nely, ha conformado una familia con el único y gran amor de su vida. Durante mucho tiempo ambos se han esforzado en sus tierras de cultivo para incrementar poco a poco su nivel de vida familiar, este propósito a sido un factor de esfuerzo constante pero por desgracia a causa de los continuos malestares de su querido esposo ha decaído ya que las necesidades de medicina y atención se han incrementado alarmantemente en estos meses. Nely, desea contribuir a mejorar y restablecer dentro de poco la salud de su esposo pero le faltan recursos para llevar a cabo este propósito y la razón de su petición de un préstamo atiende al objetivo de incrementar la calidad de sus productos con la compra de mayor cantidad de abonos y fertilizantes naturales.

loans.use: Buy natural fertilizers.

loans.name: Halima

texts.en:
Halima is 40 years old and is married with 5 children, ages 7 to 28. Halima is a fish seller; she started her business in 1984. Every day she works from 10:00 AM to 8:00 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $140 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more fish for her business.

loans.use: To buy more fish for her business

loans.name: Punito P.

texts.id:
Punito, 57 years old, is a garbage / used goods collector. He usually looks for garbage/ used goods in his surrounding neighborhood, which is in Patih Jelantik street and also around Denpasar.

He can only works until mid day because of his old age. After a quick noon break, he then continues with filtering and selecting the goods collected in the morning. He then brings the goods to the used goods depot and sells them there.

He wants to use the loan money as his capital so he can also buys used goods from others. By doing this he will no longer solely rely to his own work to collect used goods.

Translated from Indonesian by Antonius Gunadi, Kiva volunteer.

Kegiatan sehari-hari Punito adalah sebagai pemulung atau pengumpul barang-barang bekas. Setiap pagi dia sudah harus berangkat mencari barang bekas untuk dikumpulkan. Lokasi yang biasanya dia lalui adalah kawasan sekitar tempat tinggalnya, di Jl.Patih Jelantik dan juga di kawasan Denpasar. Diusianya yang saat ini yang sudah mencapai 57 tahun, dia hanya kuat bekerja sampai menjelang siang hari. Setelah beristirahat sebentar, dia melanjutkan dengan menyaring dan memisahkan barang bekas menurut jenisnya. Setelah itu, dia membawa ke tempat pengumpulan dan menimbang lalu menjualnya. Harapannya saat ini, bisa diberi bantuan modal, sehingga nantinya dia bisa membeli barang bekas kemudian menjualnya lagi, tidak hanya mencari seperti yang dia lakukan sekarang.

loans.use: To add working capital (Menambah Modal Usaha)

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
The enthusiasm and joy that Magdalena transmits daily to her clients is her best advertisement and the chief reason that her customers buy their products from her. This diligent woman is both a mother and father to her young teenage children, who thanks to their team effort are achieving to improve their living standards. Magdalena sells school supplies and haberdashery, merchandise she offers as a peddler through the main intersections and local fairs in the city of Juliaca. Magdalena has planned to expand her business and to do that, she has come to us to request a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Evelyn Garcia, Kiva volunteer.

El entusiasmo y alegría que día a día transmite a sus clientes es su mejor carta de presentación y el principal motivo que tiene Doña Magdalena para que sus clientes adquieran sus productos. Esta diligente mujer es padre y madre de sus dos adolescentes hijos, quienes gracias al trabajo en equipo que desempeñan están logrando mejorar su calidad de vida, Magdalena se dedica al negocio de venta de útiles escolares y mercería, mercadería que ofrece en forma ambulatoria por las principales arterias y las ferias locales de su localidad Juliaca.Magdalena tiene proyectado ampliar su negocio y para ello se presenta ante vosotros para solicitarte un préstamo.

loans.use: Purchase capital to expand her business.

loans.name: Bertila

texts.es:
Bertila is a 49 year old mother of 6. Four of her children are now independent, with the two youngest still attending school. She decided to work selling clothing some time ago, and her husband, Luis supports her and is in agreement with what she proposes to do. Bertila gets up early in the morning to prepare her packages, and to go out to sell her wares door to door. Bertila and her husband both work hard to ensure that their children are happy, and that they grow up to be good men. Bertila wants her business to grow, and to accomplish that she would like to rent a location where she can sell her clothing. To do this, she needs the money requested in this loan, which she agrees to repay in a responsible and timely manner.

Translated from Spanish by James Comstock, Kiva volunteer.

Bertila tiene 49 años y es madre de 6 hijos, 4 de ellos ya son independientes, los dos últimos que aún están en el colegio, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace mucho tiempo, su esposo, el señor Luis, la apoya con su negocio y está de acuerdo con sus propósitos. Bertila se levanta muy temprano a preparar sus paquetes para luego salir a la calle, pues vende de manera ambulante por diferentes lugares. La señora Bertila junto a su esposo trabajan con mucho esmero para ver felices a sus hijos para que en el mañana sean hombres de bien.El deseo de Bertila es que su negocio prospere, para ello quiere alquilar un local para la venta de sus prendas, requiere de la cantidad de dinero que solicita en préstamo, con la promesa de devolverlo de manera puntual y responsable.

loans.use: Rental of a location to sell clothing, in order to no longer sell door to door.

loans.name: Slobodanka

texts.en: Slobodanka is a widow from the town of Derventa. She receives a monthly pension, and also earns income by farming.  This is her 1st loan from Žene za Žene, which she is requesting in the amount of 600 KM.  She will use this to buy compost and seeds for her land.  Slobodanka will be using the seeds to grow corn, in order to have enough food to feed her cows over the winter.  She also plants vegetables and fruit trees, so will buy extra seeds for that.  Slobodanka wants to buy enough to use into the next year, as she is getting older and cannot take care of her cows all the time.  She thinks that this investment in her land will be a good move for her.

loans.use: To buy seeds and compost for farming

loans.name: Bobomurod

texts.ru: Худжамуродов  Бобомурод житель района Вахш. Возраст 51 год, женат , имеет 5 детей.Клиент  занимается сельским хозяйством. При своем доме он имеет  участок земли ,где сеет  овощи и зелень. На доход от сельского хозяйства от содержит свою большую семью. В данный момент хочет купить минеральные удобрения ,что бы получить качественный урожай. Для чего ему нужны деньги.Планирует погасить кредит в течении  10 месяцев.
texts.en:
Bobomurod H. lives in Vakhsh. He is 51 years old, married, and has five children. The client is engaged in agriculture. He has a field near his home where he grows vegetables and herbs. The income he receives from this supports his large family. Currently, he wants to buy mineral fertilizers in order to harvest a high-quality crop. He needs money for this. He plans to pay off the loan in ten months.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Aide

texts.es:
Aide esta casada, tiene 3 hijos : uno de 17, otro de 12 y otro 9 años. Ella inicio el negocio hace 4 años, a raíz de que invito a unos vecinos a comer y les gusto su sazón, y posteriormente la fueron recomendando, y la misma demanda le fue pidiendo servicio para fiestas infantiles, elaborando hamburguesas y demas paltillos, actualmente su hijo mayor le ayuda en la preparación de alimentos y como mesero en algunos eventos.

Ella necsita un prestamo por US $225 que pagara en 6 meses para ampliar su negocio y dar mejor servicio al cliente.
texts.en:
Aide is married, and has 3 children. One is 17, other is 12 and the youngest is 9 year old. She started her business 4 years ago, immediately after she invited a few of her neighbors to eat and they liked her seasoning. Later, they recommended her and soon after she was being asked to cater children parties, to prepare hamburgers and other dishes. At present her elder son helps her in the preparation of food and as waiter in some events.

She need a loan of $225, which will be repaid over period of 6 months, to expand her business and provide a better service to her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand business.

loans.name: Helena Bernardo

texts.pt:
Helena Bernardo M. natural do distrito da manhiça um dos distritos nortenhos da província do Maputo, tem 54 anos de idade, mãe de 3 filhos com idade entre o primeiro tem 30 anos e o ultimo tem 25 anos. Para alem dos filhos vive com mais duas pessoas na sua casa que ela sustenta.

Helena estudou até 9ºclasse e parou por situações profissionais, dado que ela fez as ultimas classes enquanto trabalha. Helena vive de negocio que consiste na venda de carne qual compra o quilo por 80,00mt e vende por 95,00mt;   Amendoim que compra o saco por 900,00mt e vende por 1600,00mt. Tem um rendimento mensal de 28000,00mt.

Para Helena este é o primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku e no Kiva, com este pretende aumentar a mercadoria para responder a demande na quadra festiva que se avizinha. Futuramente pretende melhorar as condições habitacionais.

loans.use: Compra e venda de carne, amendoim e refrescos.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
La señora Maria pertenece al Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” ubicado en el centro Poblado de Chimbo, distrito y Provincia de Yunguyo-Puno. Tiene 45 años, es madre de 6 hijos que están trabajando en Lima., es casada, su esposo trabaja junto con ella en la crianza de ganado vacuno y ovino. Con el préstamo de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles  compro 02 chanchitos. Hace 02 años que trabaja con Manuela Ramos.

En la actualidad continúa dedicándose a la crianza de ganado lo que le  permite pagar sin retraso su cuota mensual.
 
Con este crédito de S/.  1,500.00 nuevos soles el cual será pagado en 5 cuotas  aumentara su capital y comprara 01 ganado vacuno (vaca) para engorde.
texts.en:
Maria belongs to the Community Bank "Espiritu Santo" (meaning, Holy Spirit), located in Centro Poblado de Chimbo in the District and Municipality of Yunguyo-Puno. She is 45 years old and she is mother of 6 children, all working in Lima. She is married and her husband works with her raising a cattle and pigs. With the first loan of S/.300 nuevos soles she purchased 2 piglets. It has been 2 years since she has been with Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner).

Currently she continues to raise cattle and it permits her to always make her monthly payments.

With this loan of S/.1500 neuvos soles, which will be repaid in a term of 5 months, she will supplement her capital and purchase 1 head of cattle.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 1 head of cattle.

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Nguyễn Thị Hòa 53 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 1995. Trước khi tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị có một cửa hàng ăn nhỏ, sau khi tham gia Quỹ gia đình chị Hoà đã mạnh dạn vay thêm vốn để mở cửa hàng chuyên kinh doanh thịt chó. Với những  món ăn ngon, giá cả hợp lý nên cửa hàng của gia đình chị luôn thu hút được lượng khách hàng rất đông. Công việc kinh doanh phát triển tốt đem lại cho gia đình chị thu nhập 5.000.000đ/ tháng
Vòng vốn tới chị mong muốn được vay 15.000.000đ để đầu tư cho công việc kinh doanh của gia đình.
texts.en:
Mrs. Nguyen Thi H. is 53 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 1995. Before joining the Fund, her family had a small restaurant, and after joining the Fund, Mrs. H. borrowed money to open a restaurant selling dog meat. With delicious dishes and reasonable prices, her restaurant attracts a very high number of customers. The business is going well and brings a monthly income of VND5,000,000 to her family.

In this loan cycle, she would like to borrow VND15,000,000 to expand her family's restaurant business.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand restaurant business

loans.name: Olena

texts.en:
Olena is married and has two grown children. She rents a space in a hardware store and sells various tools and materials used in construction and remodeling.

Olena has been in this business for 5 years. This business is one of the most relevant and profitable in the area. The store has a good downtown location. Her good assortment brings in many clients.

Olena would like a loan of 9,000 UAH to increase her inventory. At the moment, she can buy tools at a low price to sell later and make additional profit. Olena's business goal is to have her own store instead of renting from someone else.

loans.use: To increase her inventory

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses O. is 30 years old and married with a child. He makes furniture and he plans to purchase more furniture materials to make more furniture. To that end, he is requesting for the loan of 50,000 naira.

Moses is a hard working man and he hopes to lift his family above poverty. He says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture materials.

loans.name: Ayawa

texts.fr: Cette dame habite le quartier de tokoin ramco, elle pratique comme activité la vente de produits pharmaceutiques, elle fait ce commerce depuis 2002, actuellement son stock de produits est épuisé et elle a une demande à satisfaire, n’ayant jamais obtenu de crédit de wages, elle sollicite ce premier crédit afin de pouvoir s’acheter des produits pharmaceutiques, elle est mariée et mère de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
This is a lady who lives in the Tokoin Ramco district. Her work involves selling pharmaceutical products. She has been in this business since 2002. Her inventory is exhaust right now, and she has to meet the demand. Never having been a recipient of a WAGES loan, she’s requesting this initial loan to buy pharmaceuticals. She is married and the mother of two.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Atogo

texts.en:
Atogo D. is currently in the business of selling bread and is requesting a loan to build a shop for her bread sales. Atogo is 29 years old and is married. Her husband is a soldier. She has three children who go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house.

Kiva partner BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan in 2007. The microfinance program, which is targeted to returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights, and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs (non government organizations) as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.

loans.use: to build a shop where she can sell her bread.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence A. is a 23-year-old mother of one child, aged 2 years. She sells chips (french fries) in Nyamasaria slum but would also like to start selling soda. Her husband also works, but she says times are tough and coping with life can be difficult. She is asking for 10,000 KSH to purchase soda.

loans.use: Soda

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en: Deborah sells medicines and she has been in this business for a long time. She hopes for a loan of N50,000 to purchase more medicines to sell. Deborah is 54 years old and married with four children. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more medicines to sell

loans.name: Kadiatou

texts.fr: Kadiatou D. 41 ans est mariée avec 04 enfants en charge. Elle est membre du banc villageois de Sinthiang Aidara depuis 03 ans et demi. Son activité est le commerce. Kadiatou veut s’approvisionner en riz, savon, cotol, lait et autres pour renforcer sa boutique.
texts.en:
Kadiatou D., age 41, is married and has four children in her care. She has been a member of the village lending group in Sinthiang Aidara for three and a half years. Her work involves commerce. She wants to stock up on rice, soap, “cotol”, milk, and other items to enhance her shop.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To supply her shop with rice, soap, cotol, milk, and more

loans.name: Bertha Aurora

texts.es: La profesora Bertha Aurora es pensionada y también esta laborando para el gobierno de nuestra ciudad, ella vive solita ya que sus todos hijos ya son mayores de edad y radican en otra ciudad, ella es propietaria de esta vivienda a la que desea realizarle estas mejoras tales como impermeabilización y colocación de piso de concreto; motivo por el cual ella esta tramitando este crédito.
texts.en:
The professor, Bertha Aurora, is a pensioner and also is working for the government of her city. She lives alone since all of her children are already older and settled in another city. She is the owner of a home to which she wishes to make improvements such as waterproofing it and installing a concrete patio; the motivation for which she is applying for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To waterproof her home and build a concrete patio in the back of her house

loans.name: Mr. Houy Um Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of nineteen people, is located in Khsom Village in Kandal Province. They plan to use their loan for different purposes.

Mr. Houy U. is the village bank president who has been selected by the village bank members. He is a fisherman who can catch a little fish for his living. His wife, Mrs. Oak Lo, assists him with the fishing business. Mr. Houy U. is 55 years old and the father of seven children, four of whom are employed in a garment factoR. while the other three are attending the local school.

Although Mr. Houy U.’s family members have different business activities, they still provide a better living for the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mr. Houy U. decided to ask for a loan to conduct a motorcycle repair business in the local village.

loans.use: To conduct a motorcycle repair business in the local village

loans.name: Julia Teresa

texts.es:
La señora Julia Teresa es socia del Banco Comunal El Arenal, que se  reúne en la oficina de Fundación Espoir cada dos semanas. Ella vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, una hermosa ciudad colonial en el sur de Ecuador. Cumplió 33 años el mismo día de esta entrevista, es casada, y tiene dos hijas. Su esposo es un buen hombre que se llama Lauro, él trabaja como tapizador de muebles. Ellos viven en una casa alquilada. Sus hijas ahora están estudiando en la escuela “Juan de Saber”; eso para ella es lo más importante. 

Cuando la señora conoció a su esposo, él ya tenía su negocio, pero ella dice que no se casó por eso sino por amor. Ahora ella le ayuda en su taller cortando telas, esponjando y cosiendo las telas. Además, de paso ha aprendido a retapizar. Su cuñado, Segundo, les ayuda con el trabajo. Su horario de trabajo es 8am a 6pm lunes a viernes y también medio día el sábado. La ventaja de este negocio es que trabajan juntos como familia, dice la señora, además salen todos juntos los fines de semana. 

La señora está pidiendo este crédito para poder comprar materia prima (como esponja, telas, clavos y cemento de contacto) y madera para su taller. Ella ha sido muy cumplida con sus créditos anteriores, y siempre paga de manera puntual, incluso cuando le hace faltar algo en la casa. Lleva un año y medio como socia de su banco comunal. Al inicio le trajo otra socia, le gustó la reunión a la que asistió y decidió integrarse al grupo. Le gustan las enseñazas que recibe respeto a como aplicar los créditos y cómo ser una socia responsable. 

Su meta para el futuro es tener una casa propia, que sus hijas estudien, y que su esposo esté siempre a su lado.
texts.en:
Julia Teresa is a member of the community bank El Arenal, which meets at the office of Fundación Espoir every two weeks. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a beautiful colonial city in southern Ecuador. She turned 33 years old on the date of this interview. She is married and has two daughters. Her husband is a good man, his name is Lauro, he works as an upholsterer. They live in a rented house. Her daughters are currently attending school "Juan de Saber", for her, this is the most important thing. When Julia met her husband, he already had his own business, but she says she is not married for money but for love. Now she helps him in his workshop by cutting and sewing fabric and foam. Moreover, she has also learned how to reupholster. Her brother-in-law, Segundo, helps them with the work. She works Monday through Friday from 8am to 6pm and until noon on Saturdays. The advantage of this business is being able to work together as a family, says Julia, as well as spending time together on the weekends. She is asking for this loan in order to buy raw material (such as sponge, cloth, nails and contact cement) and wood for her workshop. We have been very satisfied with her previous loans, and she has always paid on time, even when she was in need. She has been a member of the community bank for one and a half years. She was introduced to the bank by another member and she liked the meeting and decided to join the group. She likes the lessons on how to apply the loans and how to be a responsible member. Her goal for the future is to own a home, educate her daughters and that her husband remains by her side.

Translated from Spanish by Mariana Hungria, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw material (such as sponge, cloth, nails and contact cement) and wood for her workshop.

loans.name: George

texts.en: George A. sells fish on the beach in Elmina. He owns a track which he uses for the distribution of his fish. George has a senior high school education. He is married and has three children. His wife is a trader. George has been selling fish since 2000. He is responsible for paying school fees and other bills. His loan will be used to buy more fish for resale. He hopes to use the new profits from his business to reinvest.

loans.use: To buy more fish for resale.

loans.name: Azucena Geoconda

texts.es:
La señora Azucena M. posee su negocio de salón de belleza en su propio establecimiento en el departamento de León donde atiende a sus clientes y de igual manera vende calzados para sus clientes.

Ella ha acudido a Ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de trabajo para el salón y es por esta razón que confiadamente espera en que Ceprodel le brindará el crédito y de esta manera logrará la satisfacción de sus clientes en el negocio.
texts.en:
Azucena M. lives in the department of León. She operates a beauty salon in her own house where she serves her customers. Furthermore, she sells shoes to them.

Azucena approached Kiva partner Ceprodel and applied for a loan to buy working materials for her salon and shoes for sale. She confidently waits to see her loan provided and achieve a good customer satisfaction in her business.

Translated from Spanish by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy working materials for her salon and shoes for sale

loans.name: Faatau

texts.en: Faatau T. (0) is a 42-year-old woman living in the town of Tulaele. She is married and has six adult children. Faatau owns and operates a taro plantation business, providing taro to local community members and also to the market where it is sold. Faatau has been engaged in this business for over six years and earns approximately 700 WST a month. In 2005, Faatau joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Faatau has successfully repaid a previous loan of 1,700 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase sacks of fertilizer. Faatau is now requesting a new loan of 2,400 tala WST which will be used to purchase equipment to improve her business. The loan will be her 4th from SPBD. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self-esteem. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase harvesting equipment

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert K. is 52 years old and is a married father of two. He lives with his family in Bamburi, Mombasa. Robert runs a store in King'orani where he manufactures and sells food spices. He has been in this business for 15 years.

Previously, Robert was a client of another Kenyan MFI - Faulu Kenya for three years.  This is his first loan from KADET and with the money, he plans to purchase stock for food spice production. The demand for Robert's products is high because he offers a variety of spices.

He hopes to become a leading supplier of food spices in Mombasa city.  

About KADET: 
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke.

loans.use: To purchase stock for food spice production.

loans.name: Thim

texts.en:
Mrs. Thim H., age 34, has been married to Mr. Nat Chea, age 35, since 1985. They have three sons and all of them are in school. The family lives in a small village along National Road Number 5 about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Thim has been selling porridge in her village since 2006. Her husband has been hired in producing Khmer noodles since 2008. She is requesting her first loan of $500 in order to build a store for selling porridge.

loans.use: To build a store for selling porridge

loans.name: Aros

texts.en:
Aros is a 34-year-old married father of three who runs a tailoring business in Nyayo Market in Nairobi. He has many walk-in customers but also sells wholesale and is hired for weddings and other special functions. He has been in this business since 2005 but feels that since becoming a member of Faulu he has learned new discipline and time management skills. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy more fabric and accessories. In the future, he hopes to open another shop and to have an exhibition to showcase his designs. He describes himself as a hard worker.

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more fabric and accessories

loans.name: Abdulfatoh

texts.ru: Исломов Абдулфатох проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 40 лет. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Абдулфатох по специальности "учитель", но по специальности не работал. Он более 10 лет занимается торговлей, бизнесом. Абдулфатох имеет магазин, в котором торгует автозапчастями. Кредит просит для увеличения товараборота, т.е. закупа автозапчастей.
texts.en:
Abdulfatoh I. lives in Qurgan-Tube. He is 40 years old and married with three children. Abdulfatoh was trained as a teacher, but has not worked in the profession. For more than 10 years, he has been in business. Abdulfatoh has a store where he sells auto parts. He has applied for a loan to increase his sales turnover by purchasing more parts.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to purchase auto parts

loans.name: Mirvat

texts.en:
Mirvat is a 26-year-old woman who lives with her husband. Five years ago, she started working with her friend in a beauty salon, and in 2007 she started working on her own from home.

Today, Mirvat is requesting a loan in the amount of $1,200. She wants to use the loan to purchase new utensils.

loans.use: To purchase new utensils for use in her beauty salon business

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
Adam is 31 years old and makes a living selling boxes, pots and buckets in the local market. He usually sells these items to parents of school children and other passersby. He's been in this business for 12 years and also earns additional income from small-scale farming. He describes himself as hardworking and innovative.

He has applied for this loan Faulu to expand his business by buying more materials to sell to his customers. This will allow him to earn a sustainable income for his family. In the future, he hopes to become an employer so that he can create job opportunities for others.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to his cusomers.

loans.name: Kaï

texts.fr: N. Kaï est née en 1977 et vit depuis 15 ans à Fiégnon à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. Kaï est mariée à AMOUSSOU Koffi, un pêcheur. Le couple a trois enfants en charge, dont deux sont leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés et vivent ensemble avec leurs parents. Le couple supporte ensemble les charges de la famille. Kaï n’a pas été à l’école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Kaï vend divers produits de toilette (savons, lait corporel, crème, eau de toilette, parfums, défrisants, etc.) et aussi des mèches à Dantokpa, marché international du Bénin et au marché de Fiégnon à Cotonou. C’est à Dantokpa que Kaï s’approvisionne. Kaï a trois ans d’expérience dans cette activité, et est à son troisième crédit à ALIDé. Kaï a bien remboursé les deux crédits qu’elle avait obtenus de ALIDé. En vue de renforcer son capital, et mieux satisfaire ses clients, Kaï sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Kaï ambitionne vendre plus tard ses produits en gros.
texts.en:
N. Kaï was born in 1977 and for the past 15 years she has lived in Fiégnon in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. Kaï is married to Amoussou Koffi, a fisherman. The couple cares for 3 children, two of whom are their own children. All of the children attend school and live together with their parents. Together the couple takes care of the needs of the family. Kaï did not attend school. In order to take care of the family's needs, Kaï sells a variety of cosmetic products (soaps, moisturizer, lotions, eau de toilette, perfumes, hair straighteners, etc.) and also hair weaves in Dantokpa, the international market of Benin and the market of Fiégnon in Cotonou. Kaï supplies herself in Dantokpa. Kaï has had three years of experience in this business and this is her third loan with ALIDé. Kaï has fully repaid her previous two loans from ALIDé. In order to grow her funds and better satisfy the needs of her clientele, Kaï is requesting a third loan from ALIDé. Kaï's ambition is to sell products at wholesale.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cartons of cosmetics products

loans.name: Dit

texts.en: Dit T. has some beauty tools to provide a service for wedding parties. She is also hired by people to do their makeup before they join a party. She is a divorced woman who currently has two young school-aged kids who are dependent on her income. She lives with her old father who is a rice farmer. Dit T. makes $12 a day which she uses to solve her family’s financial problems. Dit T. has been running her trade for a long time but she requires more accessories to perform her service. That is why she decided to look for a loan from Kiva's partner, HKL.

loans.use: To purchase accessories

loans.name: Edith Yesenia

texts.es: Edith Yesenia H. de 21 años de edad, reside en Jayaque, departamento de La Libertad. Vive junto a su madre, su abuela y dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, los cuales dependen absolutamente de ella. Desde hace 8 años que Edith posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos perecederos y de primera necesidad, los cuales son muy necesarios en los hogares. Pero a pesar de todo esto, en muchas ocasiones ella se ha enfrentado con la situación de no contar con el producto que las personas llegan a comprar. Es por esta razón que Edith solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para surtir la tienda con diferentes productos tales como: frijoles, sal, azúcar, verduras, pan y otros más. Esto sería de mucha ayuda para ella, debido a que la tienda es la única fuente de ingresos que tanto Edith como su familia  poseen para seguir adelante, para ella el trabajo es difícil sobre todo porque debe sacar adelante a sus dos hijos quienes la necesitan mucho. A pesar de la situación tan dura a la que se enfrentan, Edith no pierde la esperanza de poder mejorar su negocio este año y así incrementar las ventas y mejorar la forma de vida de su familia
texts.en:
Edith Yesenia H. is 21 years old and lives in Jayaque, a district of La Libertad. She lives with her mother, her grandmother, and her 2 children who are 7 and 3 years old and who depend entirely upon her for their support. For the past 8 years, Edith has had a store selling perishable and highly sought after products, which are needed in the home. But in spite of all this, many times she has not been able to provide the products people come to buy. It is for this reason Edith is asking for a loan, in order to have enough money to stock the store with different products like beans, salt, sugar, vegetables, bread, etc. This would be a big help to her, due to the fact that the store is the only source of income that Edith and her family have for getting ahead. Her job is mainly difficult because she has the responsibility of helping out her two children, who both need her so much. In spite of the difficult situation she faces, Edith does not lose her hope of improving her business this year and increasing sales and improving her family's lifestyle.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic grains, bread, and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase charcoal in bulk.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock wheat flour and other ingredients to prepare fritters

loans.name: Isidro

texts.es: Isidro L. G. es un joven soltero y trabajador que adquirió su vivienda, con este crédito será el segundo que tomaría ya que en anterior realizo su proyecto de reparar las paredes de las habitaciones. Ahora Isidro se ve en la necesidad de impermeabilizar su casa ya en temporada de lluvia se trasmina y es por ello que el quiere estar preparado ahora que lo días están agradables para arreglar su hogar.
texts.en:
Isidro L. G. is a single young man. He is a hard-worker, and he has acquired a house. This will be his second loan. With the previous loan he completed his project of repairing the walls to the rooms. Now Isidro sees the need to waterproof the house because the house leaks during the rainy season. That is why he wants to be prepared now that the weather is good for making house repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Waterproof his house

loans.name: Nabeela's Group

texts.en: Nabeela is a wife of M. A., and they both live in the city of Borewala, Pakistan. The city of Borewala is famous for its shrines. Her husband has a shop in the main market where he sells spare parts for motorbikes. He purchases the spare parts from the city of Lahore. He has been in this business for the past 25 years. Nabeela stays at home and manages the domestic chores and takes care of her kids. She is applying for a loan to buy spare parts to expand her husband’s business.

loans.use: To buy motorbike spare parts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase prawns and fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To increase the financial capital of her fish-selling business

loans.name: Beatriz

texts.es:
Beatriz es socia del Banco Comunal Agua Viva.
Beatriz es casada, tiene 38 años y 4 hijos, Beatriz tiene un puesto en el mercado Grau en donde vende medicina natural, que ella misma prepara, sus productos los compra de la ciudad de Lima.
Beatriz necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de medicina natural.
Los sueños de Beatriz son tener casa propia y educar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Beatriz, 38, is a member of the "Agua Viva" (Living Water) communal bank. She's married and has 4 children. Beatriz has a stall in the Grau market where she sells natural remedies that she prepares herself; she buys her products in Lima. She needs a 1000 sol loan to buy natural medicines. Beatriz's dreams are to own her own home and to educate her children.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy natural remedies.

loans.name: Nasiba

texts.en:
Nasiba, a 39-year-old internally displaced person from the region of Nagorno-Karabaka, currently lives in the Absheron region. A single mother of a 14-year-old boy, for the past eight years she has worked as a women's hair stylist, a job she likes very much because of the creativity involved and the way she makes her clients feel. Nasiba says it’s a good job for a woman with little education. Additionally, she works in the library of the local school during the early hours of the day and sells custom-made hair clips to the women in her neighborhood.

Currently, Nasiba’s workspace is small (4 sq. meters). Although her current income sustains her and her son, it does not generate enough income to buy more than very basic necessities. She’d like to use her loan of 2000 AZN to expand her business to attract more clients, hire an employee so that she can spend more time with her son, and be able to send him to university when the time comes.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Dem

texts.en:
Dem N., 46, is married and resides with her husband and five children in Takeo Province, Cambodia, an area known for pre-Angkorean temples. N. and her husband are farmers, growing rice for an income of USD 2 per day. N.’s husband is also a well digger when his work in the rice field allows. 

N. is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a machine to dig wells. In the future, she would like to use any additional profit to repair her house.  This is her first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: buy a machine to dig wells

loans.name: Griselda Carolina

texts.es: Griselda Carolina T. D. O. D. 39 años D. edad, es una señora muy trabajadora y emprendedora, la cual desea poder mejora las condiciones D. su negocio, esto con el enorme deseo D. poder obtener mayores ganancias las cuales sean D. mucho beneficio para su hogar. Griselda resiD. en Zacatecoluca, ubicado en el departamento D. La Paz en donD. vive junto a su esposo junto al cual trabajan en su propio negocio el cual es una panadería en la que elaboran diferentes tipos D. pan dulce como magdalenas, galletas y otros más. Este tipo D. pan es muy típico D. este país, en el cual existe la costumbre D. comerlo cada tarD. acompañado D. café, por lo cual es un negocio bastante rentable y estable, sobre todo en el caso D. Griselda, en el cual es la única panadería que este en los alrededores D. su lugar D. habitación que es donD. se encuentra ubicada la panadería. Ella solicita un préstamo con el deseo D. poder comprar todos los materiales necesarios para elaborar el pan, tales como batidoras, repuestos para hornos, harina, azúcar, levadura y otros productos más. Griselda ha trabajado junto a su esposo durante 5 años, en los cuales han trabajado muy duro para poder salir adelante y poder atender a todos sus clientes, ya que ha pesar del tiempo que poseen D. vender pan, cuentan con muchos clientes, razón por la que ella desea contar con más materia prima para mejorar su producción.
texts.en:
Griselda Carolina T. D. O. is 39 years old. She is a hard-working entrepreneurial woman. She wants to improve her business, because she has an enormous desire to increase her income in order to benefit her household. Griselda lives in Zacatecoluca, which is located in La Paz. She lives there together with her husband, with whom she runs a bakery. In their bakery, they make all different types of sweet breads like cupcakes, cookies, and others. Sweet bread is a very typical Bolivian food. Traditionally, it is eaten every afternoon with coffee, which makes local bakeries very profitable and stable. It is a particularly strong business in Griselda's case, as hers is be the only bakery in her area. Griselda has asked for a loan with the hopes of being able to buy all the necessary materials to make bread, like mixers, spare oven parts, flour, sugar, yeast, and other products. Griselda has worked very hard with her husband for the past five years to get ahead in life and be able to attend all their customers well. After so many years in the business, Griselda has a lot of customers, which is why she wants more materials needed to improve her bakery's production.

Translated from Spanish by Lydia Brantley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying ingredients for breadmaking

loans.name: Naiputa Ene

texts.en:
Naiputa Ene Y. is 45 years old and her spouse is Kiotat Y.. She supports two members of her family. Her spouse is also a farmer and they have been practicing cash crop farming for the last ten years.

This will be her first loan, which she is planning to spend on seeds, fertilizer and chemicals to spray wheat, and planting wheat. With the anticipated profits from the expanded business, she is planning to increase her farm produce by ploughing more acres and also educating her children. She also hopes to repay her loan successfully without default.

Her hopes and dreams are to expand her farming activity from small scale to large scale and also see her children get to a better school with good learning facilities.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and chemicals to spray wheat, and to plant wheat.

loans.name: Milagros

texts.en:
Milagros B., from the village of Cabisera 25, Ilagan, is 41 years old, married, and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Milagros owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products such as candy and cold drinks in the local community. Engaged in her business for over 15 years, she earns approximately 9000 PHP.

In 2008, Milagros joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 10000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional products to sell, she is now requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP for the same purpose. This will be Milagros' sixth loan from ASKI, and she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis, aged 46 years, is a married man with eight children living in a semi-permanent house in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He is a farmer, cultivating maize, groundnuts (peanuts) and tea. He wants his children to study, and also wants to build a good family house and do large scale farming for better income generation.

Francis wants the loan to buy more maize to sell.

loans.use: To buy more maize to sell

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine C. is from the village of Pagahan, Initao, Misamis Oriental. She is 24 years old and single. To make a living, Christine owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising pigs for sale. Christine has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Christine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be her first from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed and other supplies

loans.name: Sum's Group

texts.en:
This village group loan consists of five people who live in Daeum Rues village in Kandal province. Sum M. was selected as leader of the group loan by the members, who will use their portions of the loan to support their different businesses.

Sum M., a 42-year-old single woman, is a farmer who owns a plot of land that she uses to cultivate rice for a living. She faces a problem because she does not have enough money to support her farm. Thus she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to cultivate rice. Sum M. also earns her living by teaching at the local school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to cultivate rice

loans.name: Faith Kalagi Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year-old Sauda N. is affiliated with the Faith Kalagi Development Group. The group is based in Mukono. It has now been three years since she took root in her clothes-selling business. This married mother of six radiates a lively sense of humor and, above all, purposefulness. This has unquestionably been her mileage in the strides she has made over the years. Selling snacks was her first business preoccupation. 

In a week, her profits total up to 70,000 shillings. With this loan, Sauda wants to purchase more bales of clothes for resale.

loans.use: Purchase of more bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Albertina

texts.es:
Albertina es socia del Banco Comunal “Estrellitas de Oro II”, ubicado en el distrito de Puno, provincia Puno, departamento de Puno, tiene 56 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene grado de instrucción primaria incompleta.  Albertina vive con sus cuatro hijos.
La señora viene trabajando con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos  desde hace un año, el primer préstamo solicitado fue de S/ 500.00 nuevo soles, con el cual pudo incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de casacas.
Ahora solicitará un nuevo préstamo de S/. 1000.00 Nuevo soles,  préstamo que le servirá para incrementar la mercadería de su negocio, es decir, comprará más casacas al por mayor.
Su sueño es crecer en su negocio. Lo que le gusta del Banco Comunal es la ganancia de los ahorros.
texts.en:
Albertina is a member of the “Estrellitas de Oro II” community bank which is located in the district of Puno, in the province and administrative district of the same name.  She is 56 years old, married and did not complete her primary education.  Albertina lives with her four children.

This lady has been working with the Movimiento Manuela Ramos for one year.  The first loan which she requested was for 500.00 nuevos soles with which she managed to increase her business capital. Her business is selling jackets.

She is now requesting a new loan for 1000.00 nuevos soles which will allow her to increase her merchandise, that is to say she will buy more jackets wholesale.

Her dream is to expand her business.  What she likes about the community bank is the interest made on savings.

loans.use: Purchase of jackets wholesale

loans.name: Janet

texts.es: Janet, de 36 años, es una madre de familia jovial y amante del negocio, vive en casa de sus suegros, junto con su esposo y sus 3 hijos. Todos los días, recorre las calles de su distrito con catálogo en mano, ofreciendo los diversos productos de belleza. Por otro lado, cuando es temporada de algún evento o fiesta que se celebra en la ciudad, ella aprovecha para vender algunos productos; es el caso del mes morado, en donde vendió turrones, postre limeño, que por medio de pedidos pudo obtener ganancias extras. Es una vendedora muy convincente, motivo por el cual todo lo que vende le sale y se ve forzado a  suministrarse de más productos. Siente que su negocio es muy rentable, ya que gracias a ello puede ayudar a su esposo en cubrir los gastos del hogar, además  cuenta con el  apoyo de sus suegros, en el cuidado de su hijo. Es por esta confianza que trabaja duro y motivada en salir adelante, siempre brindando un trato amable a sus clientes. Con el tiempo, anhela vender ropa o una tienda de disfraces. Es su 16avo crédito con MFP y sabe que tiene que pagar puntualmente sus cuotas y esta dispuesta hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual la estiman mucho. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más productos de belleza, para abastecer los pedidos pendientes que tiene.
texts.en: Janet, 36 years old, is the mother of a happy family and the happy owner of the business. She lives in her in-laws' home, along with her husband and three children. Every day, she goes up and down the streets in her district with her catalog in hand, peddling an array of beauty products.
