Also, when it's the season for a holiday or festival that her city celebrates, she takes advantage of the time to sell some products; this is the case for Mes Morado (Purple Month), when she sold nougat candies, a dessert from Lima, and through these sales was able to get extra revenue. She is a very convincing saleswoman and is motivated by the fact that everything she sells leaves her, which forces her to supply herself with more products. She feels her business is very profitable, and thanks to that she is able to help her husband cover household expenses, besides, she counts on her in-laws' support for caring for her son. It is because of this confidence that she works hard and is motivated to succeed, always giving her customers friendly service. In time, she hopes to sell clothes or have a store for dress clothes. This is her 16th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she knows that she has to make her payments on time, and she is ready to do so. In her communal bank she is a very responsible member, motivated by the fact that they respect her greatly. With the loan that she is requesting, she will buy more beauty products so she can fill the pending orders she has.

loans.use: Stock up on beauty products to fill pending orders from her customers

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 19-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his family. Despite his young age, he is a proud new business owner; he has worked as a home electrician since 2007. He independently owns his personal business. Due to his newest experience in this field, he takes on small projects in addition of repairing home electricity upon request of the clients. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1100 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase additional electric tools and a special electric machine for his business.  The income from his business is an important source of income for himself and his family. He is confident that his work will continue to be successful in the coming year. In the future, he is working to take on more and bigger projects to build a good business reputation.

loans.use: to purchase additional electric tools and a special electric machine for his business

loans.name: Abdon Alfredo

texts.es:
Abdon Alfredo T. T. tiene 46 años. Es soltero, vive con los padres, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. No  Tiene hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL BATAN se encuentra ubicada 90 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla esta conformado por 21 socios que se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Abdon se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz desde hace mucho tiempo. Compra sus productos en el Cantón Bucay y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando.

Le gusta seguir trabajando con la familia.
texts.en:
Abdón Alfredo T. T., 46, is single and lives with his parents in Chillanes canton, Bolívar province.  He has no children.

Members of the El Batan communal bank are located 90 minutes from the Chillanes office.  They belong to Chillanes canton.  The bank has 21 members who are short cycle (cocoa bean, manioc, maize) farmers.  They have been in this line of work for a long time.

Abdón has been a cocoa bean, manioc and maize farmer for a long time.  He buys his products in Bucay canton and sells at Chillanes’ market and in his own settlement.

He is asking for funds to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for the cocoa bean crop.  Support from the loan will help him economically to meet his needs.  They face challenges like infestations, illnesses and changes in the weather.  His dream is to continue working.

He enjoys working with his family.

loans.use: For farming supplies and fertilizers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy and sell hens and goats

loans.name: Ven's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ven T., 49 years old, was selected as the village bank president by the 15 people forming this group loan in Liek village in Kandal province. All members of this village group loan will use their portions of the loan to support their different purposes.

Mrs. Ven T. earns her living by tailoring at home, earning a small income to support her family. Since her business is doing well, she wants to expand it and decided to ask for a loan to buy more fabric. Her husband, Mr. Sam Phorn, 55 years old, is a famer who owns 1 hectare of land where he cultivates rice for a living. This couple has three children: one is a police officer and the others attend the local school.

loans.use: to buy more fabric to expand her business

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy es socia del Banco Comunal Virgen de Cocharcar, tiene 39 años, es casada con 5 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de juguetes. Nancy aprendió de la venta de juguetes de su mamá pues ella se dedicaba a este negocio, viaja a Lima de ahí trae los juguetes y los reparte tienda por tienda. Nancy solicita un préstamo que lo invertirá en surtir su mercadería. A Nancy le gusta Finca porque le enseñan los valores, a quererse uno misma, gracias a sus ahorros pudo comprarse una mototaxi con la que ahora trabaja su esposo. Su sueño es poder tener un capital y poder abrir una pasamanería y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Nancy is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen de Cocharcas”. She is 39 years old, married, and has five children. Nancy sells toys and learned the trade from her mother since she was in this type of business. She travels to Lima and brings back toys to distribute from store to store.

Nancy is requesting a loan to invest in more merchandise. Nancy enjoys FINCA because she has learned values and how to love oneself. Thanks to her savings, she was able to buy a motorcycle taxi and now her husband can work. Her dreams include having capital, opening a decoration shop, and seeing her children become professionals.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of toys

loans.name: Ochoa

texts.es:
Y., tiene 45 años y tiene cuadro hijos, ella nació en el distrito de San Ana, provincia de la Convención del departamento del Cusco. Actualmente, Y. vive en la casa de sus suegros junto con su esposo e hijos. 
Y. es artesana y se dedica a elaborar artesanía de tipo muñequería. Ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio y le va muy bien. 
 
Y. espera recibir S/. 800 nuevos soles de crédito y utilizará este dinero para comprar materiales como por ejemplo tela y otras cosas más.
  
Y. pertenece al banco comunal “Kukuli” de la UMF Asociación Arariwa. El banco comunal tiene 13 ciclos de funcionamiento (Cada ciclo son 4 meses) y el banco comunal está bien administrado por la junta directiva.
texts.en:
Y. is 45 years old and she has four children. She was born in San Ana, a district of the Convención province and part of the Cusco department. Y. is currently living in her in-laws’ house together with her husband and their children.

Y. is a craftswoman and she engages in creating crafts dolls. She has been engaging in this activity for many years and things are going very well.
Y. hopes to receive a loan of 800 PEN that she will use to buy materials such as cloth and other things.

Y. is a member of “Kukuli”, a communal bank of the UMF Asociación Arariwa. The communal bank has 13 working cycles (every cycle lasts 4 months) and the bank is very well administered by the directing board.

loans.use: To buy cloth and other materials.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou L. is from the village of Olingan. She is 30 years old, married, and has 6 school aged children. Marilou operates a motorcycle in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marilou joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used for motorcycle registration. Marilou is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase spare parts for motorcycle repair. This will be the 2nd loan taken out by Marilou from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for motorcycle repair.

loans.name: Kang

texts.en:
Born in 1978, Kang D. is married to Che Emmanuel and has five children. She has been very hardworking from the day she joined GHAPE. Her desire is to work for her children’s education and pay for their school fees so that they can be educated. She decided to become a member of GHAPE due to her inability to get investment capital that could give her higher income to meet her children’s needs and the family's needs. 

With this loan, she plans to buy piglets and feed. This investment will help people in her community to have pork. She also wants to invest part of the loan toward purchasing a farm to start the growing of vegetables. 

She is planning to use the profits generated to sponsor her children in school. She will plow her profit back into her business and use part to care for her family. She also will use the proceeds to pay her children's school fees, and she will save some for rainy days. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the low cost of obtaining and paying back the loan.

About GHAPE:
 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works toward the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: piglets, feed, farm tools

loans.name: Jose Rolando

texts.es: Jose Rolando S.: se dedica a la venta de sandalias de plastico desde hace 6 años,es soltero con esfuerzo y sacrificio logro poner su negocio y vende en el marcado de su lacalidad,nos cuenta que le a hido bien porque en el lugar donde se encuentra vendiendo es rentable pero la clientela le pide nuevos estilos y a el le falta capital para poder invertir y comprar nuevos estilos en sandalias porque se aserca la epoca en que se vende y por ello la mercaderia se escasea es por ello que solicita este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en sandalias para generar mas ganancias y asi poder estar mejor economicamente.
texts.en: Jose Rolando S. has been selling plastic sandals for 6 years.  He is single and with effort and sacrifice he was able to establish his business and sell in his local market.  He tells us that things have gone well because the place where he is selling is profitable, but his customers want new styles and he does not have the capital to purchase new styles of sandals. The high sales season is approaching and  selection is scarce, so he is requesting a loan to purchase more sandals so he can generate more profits and be in a better financial position.

loans.use: to purchase sandals.

loans.name: María Dirmania

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Dios Con Nosotros  que se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela  el Florón  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros.

Aquí conocimos a la señora María, tiene 37 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual  tiene un hijo  de tres años el cual es su tesoro más preciado ya que no podía tener hijos y fue como una bendición. Su marido trabaja en Guayaquil.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que tiene un pequeño restaurante, el mismo que empezó con el crédito anterior, da gracias a  Dios y la Fundación Espoir por el crédito  ya que   pudo por fin echar a andar su negocio. Trabaja cuatro días a la semana y en estos días prepara desayunos y almuerzos,  nos cuenta que a pesar de que tiene poco tiempo su negocio  anda muy bien.
 
Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar víveres para preparar los alimentos, una licuadora y ciertas cosas que aún le faltan en su negocio. Este es su cuarto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le han dado.

Su sueño es agrandar mas su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Dios con Nosotros" communal bank meets every two weeks in the Florón neighborhood of the city of Portoviejo, which is known as the Ciudad del Valle (valley city)  because it is surrounded by mountains.

Here we meet Mrs. María who is 37 years old.  She has a common-law husband and a three year-old son who is her most prized treasure.  Before she was unable to have children, so he was like a blessing.  Her husband works in Guayaquil.

She is a grand homemaker and has a small restaurant which she began with a previous loan.  She is grateful to God and to the Espoir Foundation for the loan which allowed her to get started.  She works four days a week preparing breakfast and lunch.   She says that despite the fact that she doesn't spend a lot of time working, business is going well.

This loan will be used to buy food ingredients, a blender and other supplies that she needs.  This is her fourth loan through the communal bank and she appreciates the help she has received.

Her dream is to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy food ingredients, a blender and other supplies

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen C. is a 57-year-old widow with six children.

Carmen works hard to provide for her family. She sells plastic and glassware in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock for her business.

Carmen has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the business for 30 years and also earns an income from selling ready-to-wear clothing.

Carmen aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: To buy additional plastic and glassware.

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada San Miguel Soyaltepec esta comunidad tiene una laguna muy grande que da mucha pesca y trabajo cada año, tambien es conocida porque ahi se ubica la presa hidroele electrica Cerro de Oro.En esta comunidad vive el joven Angel, el tiene la edad de 36 años, estudio hasta el tercer grado de secundaria y es soltero.

Angel nos platica que hace mas de seis años inicio a trabajar en su propio negocio para poder ayudar a sus padres con los gastos de su hogar, el nos platica que vende Zapatos y perfumeria con sus amigos y vecionos de la comunidad, el nos dice que su venta la realiza por catalogo, casa por casa y con el pasar de los años ha ido haciendo mas clientes dia a dia lo cual le a ayudado a que su negocio prospere. el lleva sus catalogos a sus clientes, levanta un pedido, lo encarga a sus proveedores, cuando llegan sus productos los entrega con sus clientes y recibe su pago por su trabajo y producto.

el necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de zapatos, perfumeria y catalogos para poder realizar sus ventas.

el espera que con esta inversion su negocio cresca y deje buenas ganancias ya que desea en un futuro poner una pequeña tienda en el centro de su comunidad en la cual vendera sus zapatos y perfumes.

Angel es muy alegre y trabajador ademas de que es muy conocido en la comunidad lo cal le ayuda a hacer mas clientes y tener mas ventas.
texts.en:
In the State of Oaxaca, there is a community called San Miguel Soyaltepec.  This community has a very large lake which provides a lot of fish and a lot of work each year.  It is also well known because the Cerro de Oro hydroelectric dam is located there.  This community is where Ángel lives.  Ángel is 36 years old, single, and studied up to the third year of high school.

Ángel tells us that more than six years ago he started working in his own business so that he could help his parents with their household expenses.  He tells us that he sells shoes and perfumes to friends and neighbors in his community.  He says that he makes his sales door to door through catalogs and, over the years, he has gained more and more customers which has helped his business to prosper.  He takes his catalogs to his customers, makes an order, sends it to his suppliers and when he receives the products he delivers them to his customers and receives payment for his work and products.

Ángel needs this loan to invest in buying shoes, perfumes and catalogs so that he can make his sales.  He hopes that his business will grow with this investment and make him good profits since, in the future, he would like to set up a small store in the center of his community where he will sell his shoes and perfumes.

Ángel is very cheerful and hard working.  He is also very well known in the community which helps him to attract more customers and make more sales.

loans.use: to sell shoes and perfumes

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia forma parte del banco comunal “Nuevo Amanecer” perteneciente a la ciudad de Viña del Mar. 
Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de anticuchos (comida que consiste en ensartar trocitos de carne asada en unas brochetas de fierro). Delia se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 3 años. Además cuida a una persona de la tercera edad los días lunes, miércoles y viernes por las mañanas, ya que es paramédico jubilada. 
Delia se instala a vender sus productos afuera de un minimarket, utilizando una parrilla por ahora, ya que pretende mandar a fabricar un carro el cual le permita trasladar y vender sus productos con mayor facilidad. 
Su mercadería la compra en una distribuidora, especialmente la carne. 
Con el préstamo comprará materiales específicamente ruedas y latas de acero inoxidable y pagará la mano de obra para fabricar un carro. Además comprará carne. 
Sus metas son instalar su carro en fabricación afuera de un nuevo supermercado. 
Su familia es quien la ayuda en el traslado de sus productos y elementos a utilizar. Especialmente su hija quien  la ayuda a preparar y vender sus productos, sin embargo cuando su hija se encuentra trabajando Delia debe encargarse de todo el negocio sola.
Sus sueños a nivel personal son tener una casa de reposo para personas de la tercera edad, ya que Delia es paramédico jubilada.
Ella está agradecida del apoyo y crédito brindado por Fondo Esperanza. Además participa activamente de las reuniones, las cuales son muy gratas, ya que comparte con las demás socias.
Viña del Mar es una ciudad y comuna ubicada en el litoral central de Chile, conocida como la Ciudad Jardín debido a los jardines y patios que poseen algunas viviendas antiguas de la ciudad. También es considerada la capital turística de Chile.
texts.en:
Delia is a member of the “Nuevo Amanecer” (New Dawn) communal bank belonging to the city of Viña del Mar.

She makes "anticuchos" to sell (food consisting of pieces of meat grilled on metal skewers).  Delia has been in this line of work for 3 years.  In addition, she cares for a senior citizen every Monday, Wednesday and Friday in the morning since she’s a retired Paramedic.

Delia sets herself up outside a minimarket.  For now she uses a grill but she plans to have a cart made that will make it possible for her to transport and sell her products more easily.  She buys her ingredients, especially the meat, from a distributor.

She will use the loan to buy materials, specifically wheels and stainless steel sheets, and will pay labor costs to make the cart.  She will also buy meat.  Her goal is to set up the cart she’s having made in front of a new supermarket.

Her family helps her transport the products and equipment she’ll use, especially her daughter who helps her to prepare and sell her products.  However, when her daughter is at work, Delia has to be in charge of the entire operation by herself.

Her dreams on a personal level are to have a rest home for senior citizens since Delia is a retired Paramedic.

She is grateful for the support and the loan granted by Fondo Esperanza.  She participates actively in the meetings, which are quite enjoyable, because she shares with the other members.

Viña del Mar is a city and commune located on the central coast of Chile.   It’s known as the Garden City because of the gardens and patios some of the old houses in the city have.  It is also considered to be Chile’s tourism capital.

loans.use: to buy wheels and stainless steel sheets to build a cart, to buy meat and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Toribio

texts.es:
Toribio vive la comunidad de la Garita de Guanacaste. 
El es uno de los miembros de la junta Directiva de de la empresa de Credito Comunal la Garita S.A, una de las 110 empresas socias de EDESA en Costa Rica.
El solicita un préstamo de ₡400 000 (cuatrocientos mil colones) para la compra de una computadora portátil  que es para el manejo de Empresa de Credito la Garita S.A.
 En este momento es de mucha importancia ya que necesitan mejorar  el servicio al cliente, y así aumentar sus ingresos lo que incentivando el crecimiento de la Empresa.
texts.en:
Toribio lives in the Garita de Guanacaste community.  He is one of the members of the Board of Directors of the Empresa de Credito Comunal (Communal Credit Enterprise) La Garita S.A.  It is one of the 100 organizations belonging to EDESA in Costa Rica. 

He is requesting a loan for 400,000 colones in order to buy a portable computer to manage the Empresa de Credito La Garita, S.A.

It is now very important to him because he needs to improve customer service.  That way he will increase his income, which will encourage the Empresa to grow.

loans.use: to buy a laptop computer.

loans.name: Sek

texts.en: There are many Cambodians who make a living as local cultivators; one of them is Mr. Sek, who has been working in this sector since 2000. She and her husband grow rice, vegetables and other fruits on their own farmland that they inherited from their grandparents. From this business they can generate an income of around US$4.20 per day. This gentle couple has three single children, two of whom are employed as sewing workers at the factory. Currently, Mr. Sek’s house is in the process of being built and he has some problems with financing. Therefore, Mr. Sek has decided to ask for some funds from Kiva to finish the process of building his new house.

loans.use: to finish building his new house.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 43 years old.  He is married and has 3 children aged 8, 12, 15 – two are students.  

In 2001, he established his tailoring materials business. He gained tailoring experience from his uncle, who brought him up.  He was selling for his uncle until he became mature and could stand on his own.  With a small amount of starting capital, he has been able to establish his business to this level.  His business is so special to him because from it he has been able to acquire two town lots, on which he is planning to build a house very soon. He also uses his profits to educate his children and take good care of his home.

Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. This borrower has successfully repaid 2 previous loans, and now requires a new loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000 in order to pay for assorted materials, such as:   3 bales of poplin @ Le 429,000,  100 bales of lace @ Le 140,000, 10 bales of stickers @ Le 120,000, 5 cartons of thread @ Le 230,000, etc. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. 

In the future, he plans to open another outlet and employ one of his brothers there.  He hopes to start constructing his house after realizing the profit from this loan and moreover, give a quality education to his children in the future when he has become old.  Weather conditions affect his sales, especially  the rains.  The competition is minimal as he is different from competitor because he provides his customers what they want.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: buy tailoring materials

loans.name: Yina Aracelly

texts.es: Yïna de 32 años de edad es enfermera de profesion desde hace 14 años. Esta solicitando  su 7mo credito con el objetivo de comprar zinc y perlines para ponerle a su casa, ya que el que tiene se encuentra en mal estado y como se acerca el invierno y no quiere que sus hijos se enfermen por la humedad.  Sueña con ver su casa bien acondicionada, pues es el patrimonio que sus padres le dejaron y el que le quiere heredar a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Yïna is 32 years old.  She is a nurse by profession and has been in this job for 14 years.  She is requesting her seventh loan to buy corrugated metal sheets and beams for her home as her current roof is in a bad state of repair.  Winter is approaching and she does not want her children to become sick because of the damp.

Yïna dreams of seeing her home nicely finished as it is the inheritance that her parents left her and she would like to pass it on to her children.

loans.use: to replace her roof

loans.name: Nataliya

texts.ru:
Наталия замужем и воспитывает двоих сыновей. Она – предприниматель из Орджоникидзе. Наталия торгует разнообразной посудой: стаканами, тарелками, чашками, чайными, столовыми и кофейными сервизами, а также различными сувенирами. У нее 3 торговых точки, одна из них находится в большом торговом центре, куда заходят более состоятельные покупатели и, следовательно, повышается покупательская способность. Наталия занимается этим бизнесом уже 11 лет. Ее доход составляет 14.400 гривен. Чистая прибыль – 4.800 гривен. 

Наталия – молодая и предприимчивая женщина. У нее хорошо поставленный и перспективный бизнес. Наталия хотела бы получить кредит на сумму 15.000 гривен. Она планирует закупить дополнительное количество чайных, кофейных и столовых сервизов. Покупатели Наталии постоянно спрашивают что-то новенькое, поэтому она хотела бы удовлетворить их спрос. Сейчас в торговле Наталии наступило межсезонье. Ее товар пользуется спросом в праздники, поэтому она берет кредит сейчас, чтобы до Нового года было чем торговать. Люди, покупая посуду, получают положительное эстетическое удовольствие, доставляют удовольствие своим близким, преподнося подарки. 

Пометка: история на РУССКОМ языке
texts.en:
Nataliya is married and raising two children.  She is a businesswoman from Ordzhonikidze. Natalia sells various dishes: cups, plates, cups, teaspoons, tablespoons, coffee sets, and various souvenirs. She has three shops: one of them is in a large shopping mall, where more affluent shoppers go and, therefore, customers there have greater purchasing power. Nataliya has been in business for eleven years. Her income is 14,400 hryvnia. Her net profit is 4,800 hryvnia. 

Natalia is a young and enterprising woman. She has a well set-up and promising business. Natalie would like to receive a loan of 15,000 hryvnia. She plans to purchase additional tea, coffee and dinner services. Natalia's buyers are always asking for something new, so she wants to meet their demand. Now is the offseason in Natalia's business. Her products are in demand during the holidays, so she is taking out a loan now, so that before the New Year she will have something to trade. People who buy the dishes, receive pleasure from their beauty and give that pleasure to their loved ones

loans.use: To buy more tea services, coffee services, and dish sets.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña Juana se dedica a vender Toopers de plastico, tiene variedades en tamaños y modelos por lo regular siempre les vende a mujures, es mercancia de buena calidad no es de marca pero si son durables, por ejemplo trae consigo salseras, loncheras, tortilleros, vasos, platos entre otras cosas, Doña Juana nos dice que en ocasiones si ve dificil terminar de vender sus plasticos ya que no todas las amas de casa se animan a comprar, comenta que la situacion esta muy dificil y ella con tal de vender y de ganar aunque sea poco deja las cosas mas baratas pero no le gusta dejar las cosas fiadas ya que corre el riesgo de que algunas gentes no le paguen, tambien lo que se le ha echo muy dificil es conseguir sus clientes, porque son gente que tal ves en un momento te compren y despues de uno o dos meses te vuelven a comprar otra cosa diferente y en este momento doña Juana tiene sus clientes y por esa razon quiere comprar nueva mercancia y lo que le gusta que siempre que va por nueva mercancia hay nuevos modelos de toopers mas bonitos que los anteriores y eso significa que los puede terminar de vender, a doña Juana le conviene invertir por paquetes nos comenta que tiene mas ganancias y es mejor para ella por que evita ir mas seguido por cosas, tambien su esposo le ayuda en ocasiones para poder vender mas rapido las cosas porque en su trabajo ofrece a sus amigos, doña Juana tiene 4 hijos no son mayores de edad y el mayor entro a la secundaria, tiene 13 años de casada y 32 años de edad, vive en casa prestada y su esposo trabaja, el lugar donde viven es en el barrio las Peñas en una comunidad  que pertene al municipio de el Oro, México.
texts.en:
Juana earns her living selling plastic storage containers.  She carries a variety of styles and sizes and generally sells to women.  The products are good quality, not name-brand, but durable.  She offers, for example, gravy boats, lunch boxes, tortilla baskets, cups, plates, etc.  She tells us that it's tough at times to close a sale because not all the housewives are motivated to buy.

Juana says it's hard, but as long as she's making sales and earning at least a little money, she can sell for less, although she doesn't like to leave things on credit because she runs the risk of someone not paying for them.  It's also really hard to get customers, because when someone makes a purchase, it may be a month or two before they come back for something else and she lands the client.  Juana wants to buy new merchandise, so whenever people come looking for new products, she'll have new containers, nicer styles than what she had before and she'll be able to close sales.  She says she'd rather buy in bulk because it's more profitable and it's better not to have to shop so often.  

Sometimes Juana's husband helps her sell products faster because he offers them to his friends at work.  She has four children, none of them grown.  The oldest is going into middle school.  Juana is thirty-two and has been married for thirteen years.  She lives in a rented house and her husband works.  They live in the las Peñas neigborhood in a community in the Oro municipality in Mexico.

loans.use: to buy plastic containers to sell.

loans.name: 7 Phú Sơn 2 Group

texts.en:
Minh has a manufacturing business making wooden furniture. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business by purchasing more materials.

Minh is 41 years old and is married with two children. She is the leader of a 7-member group, the 7 Phú Sơn 2 solidarity group. She lives with one dependant in Thanh Hoa City, an urban town in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Minh's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. Minh has been involved in this business for seven years. The main hardship that she faces in her business is the lack of capital.

With her business profit, Minh hopes for her business to do well, to buy a motorbike, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase more materials to make furniture

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Victoria; tiene 67 años de edad,  la socia es viuda; la socia tiene 3 hijos los cuales son todos independientes; La  socia trabaja como comerciante minorista, la socia lleva mercadería a Puerto Maldonado; y hay distribuye al por mayor y menor verduras a los diferentes contactos que la socia ya tiene, la socia lleva las verduras que producen en el ande peruano como tomate, espinacas, albaca, perejil, apio, rabanitos, ajo, lechugas, cebollas con cola entre otros, la socia requiere el crédito para invertir en la compra de verduras al por mayor y para sus pasajes, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de mercadería de tipo verduras y para sus pasajes.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Victoria belongs to the CUSCO community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.  She is 67 years old, widowed, and has three children who all live independently.

Victoria is a retailer.  She transports merchandise to Puerto Maldonado and there she sells vegetables wholesale and retail to her different contacts.  She transports vegetables which are grown in the Peruvian Andes such as tomatoes, spinach, basil, parsley, celery, radishes, garlic, lettuce, green onions, etc.  Victoria needs this loan to invest in buying vegetables wholesale and to cover her travel expenses.

Victoria is grateful for the support that she will receive and, for her part, she pledges to make her repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (vegetables) and to cover for her travel expenses

loans.name: Burulbu's Group

texts.en:
Burulbu is the leader of this group. She is 59 and married to a man who is a retiree.  Six years ago, with an initial investment of 30,000 soms, the family started to breed livestock. Reselling livestock after fattening it, the family earns 13,000 soms per month. This profit made them able to build a house in the village and to open a kiosk. 

With money received from the loan Burulbu wants to purchase more livestock for breeding, fattening and further reselling.  In the future with the profits gained from reselling livestock, Burulbu wants to purchase a vehicle.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 

MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase livestock.

loans.name: Pelongo Group

texts.en:
Alicia is married with eight children. Alicia is 63 years old and lives in Aurora.

Alicia sells dried fish to earn a living and has had this business for 20 years. Each month, she earns PHP 4,000 doing this work. She has requested a loan for 11,000 to purchase more dried fish for her retail store.

Alicia has been a member of PMPC for five years. Alicia is the leader of a two person group.  Although they borrow as a group, each member of the group has their own business.

loans.use: to purchase more dried fish for her retail store

location.town: Pagadian - Balintawak, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur

loans.name: Alma

texts.en: Alma is 33 years old and lives in Bangkal, Ozamiz City. She is married and has 2 school-aged children and 1 infant. Alma has a business selling gasoline, earning approximately PHP 4,000 each month. She has a requested a loan to purchase items to use in her business. Alma has been a member of PMPC for 3 years. In the future, she hopes that she will not encounter failure in her business.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice has operated her milk selling business  in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last  five  years.  She is 23 years old, and a single mother of two school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET by an existing client and this will be her first loan.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy more milk to stock for her shop.

In future, Eunice hopes to expand her milk business  and increase profits.

loans.use: To buy more milk to sell.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es: Máxima, es una mujer trabajadora, tiene 34 años, convive junto a su pareja Filemon. Juntos habitan en una casa alquilada junto a sus 03 hijos, quienes son el motivo de sus esfuerzos. Hace 14 años que se dedica a la agricultura, ella junto a su esposo se levantan muy temprano para poder ir a la chacra donde cultivan hojas de coca; ya que es el único sustento para su familia. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es hacerlo con mucha dedicación ya que así produce mejores cultivos y considera que lo más difícil es tener que cargar los sacos llenos de produtos. Este será su crédito número 02 con MFP, por tanto espera de un pequeño préstamo para que pueda cumplir con su objetivo. En su banco comunal se siente muy alegre ya que trabaja con personas que la apoyan y comparten experiencias. El crédito solicitado de 2,000 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de una moto de carga para que pueda trasladar los sacos de hojas de coca hasta su localidad.
texts.en: Máxima is a hardworking woman of 34 years of age. She lives with her partner Filemon. Together they live in a rented house with their 3 children who are the reason for all their efforts. She has been farming for the last 14 years. She and her husband get up very early to go to the farm where they grow coca leaves, as it is the family's sole source of income. What she likes the most about her work is that it is done with so much dedication and in this way produces better crops. She believes that the hardest thing is to have to carry the sacks full of produce. This will be her 2nd loan with MFP and therefore expects a small loan with which to reach her goal. She is very happy with her communal bank as she works with people who support her and share their experiences. She will invest the requested loan of 2,000 soles (PEN) to purchase a motorbike to transport the sacks of coca leaves to her area.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport the crops.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is 35 years old and is married with three children aged between five and ten years old.  He owns a boutique selling various goods such as lotions, soaps and biscuits.  Samuel has seventeen years' experience and the hours of his business are from 6am to 8pm every day except on the weekend.  He currently employs three people to help him.

Samuel has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase various goods such as lotions, soaps and biscuits to sell.  With any profits from the loan, Samuel would like to satisfy his family's basic needs, start saving for his future and renovate his house.

loans.use: to purchase various goods such as lotions, soaps and biscuits to sell.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq.  He is 43 years old, married and has two children who work.

Ali has owned a barber shop since 2009. He offers hair cuts, shaves and beard trimming.  He has sufficient experience in this field and has a deep understanding of local consumer needs and he is well-known in the surrounding areas.

He is requesting a $1200 loan to make an aluminum showcase and to purchase a barber chair.  He is optimistic about his business development and hopes that the coming years will continue to bring him positive growth.

loans.use: to make an aluminum showcase and to purchase a barber chair.

loans.name: Kiwambi Cha Mkombozi Liyombo Group

texts.en:
Melto is a 40-year-old married man with eight children. Three of the children attend primary education. He has worked in agriculture growing coffee, maize and beans for 11 years. He faces lots of challenges based on crop diseases and high price of fertilizers.

Melto wants to overcome those challenges by asking for financial support, which can help him to buy insecticides and fertilizers. In five years to come, he dreams of increasing his scale of production from 5 to 12 acres, to buy clothes and a mattress and cover the medical expenses for his family.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth  lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. Elizabeth has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for four years, and works six days a week. She sells her products at the market by means of retail. Elizabeth has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She also generates additional income through selling piped water and running a small restaurant. 

The main business challenges for Elizabeth include seasonality, transportation and theft. She aspires to see her business grow bigger so that she can get enough profits to buy a delivery van to ease transportation. Elizabeth lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding her family.

loans.use: to buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is 33 years old and married to Mary. They are blessed with one child. He has been running a spare parts shop for the past ten years. He earns a monthly income of KES 20,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his second loan with KADET after repaying the previous loan successfully. Raphael will use the loan to buy spare parts to add to his business. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his child. His hopes and dreams are to buy a pickup and use it for transportation.

loans.use: to buy spare parts to add to his business.

loans.name: Pasami

texts.en:
Pasami is 42 years of age and is married with four children. Pasami sells fried foods in the local community. She has one year of experience in this business. Pasami needs a loan of 1,000 talas to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Pasami joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks because they lack collateral. This is Pasami's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 36 years old, married with three children, and living in Fort Portal, Uganda. For six years he has been running a workshop. His goal is educating his children and diversifying his business to include welding. His major challenge is limited funds and lack of electricity in his premises.

Paul needs the loan to install electricity in his workshop.

loans.use: to install electricity in his workshop.

loans.name: Sabiratou

texts.fr: Âgée de 26 ans, Sabiratou n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Sabiratou est mariée à un revendeur du nom de Nanfiou. Le couple a deux enfants, tous  sont scolarisés et à leur charge. Sabiratou vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari et assure ensemble avec son mari les différentes charges du ménage. Sabiratou vend des produits cosmétiques depuis sept ans et des mèches de façon secondaire ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer à l'éducation et à l'entretien des enfants. Sabiratou s'approvisionne dans une région du Bénin. La clientèle de Sabiratou devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Sabiratou sollicite l’appui financier de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter des produits cosmétiques et des mèches.

loans.name: Duterimbere 1 Group

texts.fr:
Dorothée  fait partie du groupe  Duterimbere1 et  habite à  Gitega. Elle a 34 ans et est mariée à Népomcène, un soudeur. Ensemble ils ont 6 enfants âgés de 9mois à 14 ans, dont  4 étudient. 

Elle fait le commerce de bière de banane  depuis  2 ans. 

Elle est à son sixième   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de banana pour préparer une grande quantité  de  bière  à vendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Dorothée is a member of the 'Duterimbere 1' Group and lives in Gitega.  She is 34 years old and married to Népomcène who is a welder.  Together, they have six children aged from nine months to fourteen years.  Four of their children currently attend school.

Dorothée has been selling banana beer for two years now.  This will be her sixth loan from the field partner, Turame.  She will use it to increase her working capital and buy many bananas to prepare a large quantity of beer for sale.  This will increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy many bananas to make a large quantity of banana beer for resale.

loans.name: Kiara Crhismark

texts.es:
Kiara tiene la edad de 25 años a su corta edad se siente muy preocupada por el bienestar familiar, sobre todo por sus hijos que están una edad muy pequeña; labora por su cuenta vendiendo joyas de plata, acero y horo, ademas ropa y calzado, junto a su Conyuge han salido adelante con esta actividad.

Por primera vez se presenta a Afodenic y mediante Kiva desea el préstamo para invertir en la construcción del sumidero e instalación de inodoro, por lo que necesita comprar cemento, arena, hierro, piedras canteras, tuberías, pega y demás  materiales a utilizar en la obra que dará inicio para el bienestar familiar.

Su próximo proyecto es hacer un cuarto para dar mas espacio y privacidad a su familia.

loans.use: hacer sumidero y gozar de un buen servicio higiénico en su vivienda, sobre todo sus pequeños hijos que lo necesitan para mayor comodidad y seguridad.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support three children. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 10400 loan through NWTF to buy a SOLAR LAMP.

She is getting the solar lamp because she wants to provide her children with bright light when they study at night.

Gloria is aware that by using the solar lamp, she is not only saving money, she is also helping the environment and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: to purchase solar lamp

loans.name: Vagif

texts.en:
Vagif is internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin region. He is 54, married. He settled with 3 children in Sumgait city. Vagif is the only breadwinner in family. It is necessary to note that Vagif is the one of the active clients of Normicro. All borrowed loans by him were paid back timely. His first loan was $300, bought 5 sheep. He spent the second loan $500 to buy 9 sheep. Third time he borrowed 800$ and bought 4 calves.
Now he is planning to buy 11 sheep and 1 calf in order to increase his income. Vagif applies for a loan amounting 1000$.

loans.use: To buy 11 sheeps and 1 calf

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand and diversify my business

loans.name: Vivian Kiyeh

texts.en:
Vivian is married with five children. Her husband does not bring in regular money since he is unemployed, so they have been facing difficulties providing for the needs of their children. Things became rougher when thieves broke into their house and took away all their property and meager savings. Motivated by these setbacks and the desire to see her children become responsible citizens,Vivian joined GHAPE. She has completed training in basic business development skills and she is now ready for her first loan.

Vivian plans on starting a convenient road-side fish roasting restaurant. Given a loan of $75, she plans to buy fresh fish, charcoal, groundnut oil and a few plates and an umbrella. She will provide her community with fast food in the evenings. She plans to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: Roasting of fresh fish

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is a responsible and hard working man; he's married and has two small children. His wife works as a secretary. Seeking a better life for his family, he struck out on his own and began leasing a taxi cab five years ago. Since then, he's acquired many regular customers and has increased his income. His family's welfare is what motivates him to work hard each day.

He's seeking a loan in the amount of US $475, to be repaid over six months, which will be used to perform preventive maintenance on his taxicab. Your help can make a huge difference in his business and Eduardo and his family thank you for your trust and support.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Eduardo es un hombre muy trabajador y responsable, es casado y tiene dos pequeños hijos y su esposa trabaja como secretaria. En busca de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia decidió independizarse y trabajar por su cuenta rentando un taxi hace cinco años, gracias a buen servicio que ofrece ha logrado tener clientes seguros e incrementar los ingresos que obtiene. El bienestar de su familia es lo que lo motiva a mejorar y esforzarse más cada día.

Para continuar trabajando Eduardo solicita un préstamo de $ 475 dólares que empleará en el mantenimiento del taxi para evitar cualquier tipo de accidente que pudiera presentarse, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Tu ayuda es de mucha utilidad para este negocio, Eduardo y su familia agradecen sinceramente tu confianza y apoyo.

loans.use: Taxi maintenance

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is twenty-nine years old, married, has one child and is expecting a second. Because her husband is unemployed, her family depends upon her income for their basic needs. Originally her business was selling soft drinks and canned beer. Her previous loans enabled her to expand to selling candies and soft drinks wholesale. She is requesting a loan of $275 so she can increase her stock. This will provide enough merchandise to require her husband help in the business, and they can work together to make a better future for their family.

loans.use: To purchase more items wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase merchandise and a freezer for store.

loans.name: Juan David

texts.es:
Juan is 36 years of age. His family consists of 7 members: five children who are 18, 16, 15, 12, and 5 years of age, all in school. The eldest studies and works as a secretary in the city of Santa Cruz. The family has rented a home in Ivirgarzama for 10 years. Juan has great projects planned, such as buying his own home, expanding his business, and helping his children develop their careers so that they may have better opportunities in the future. Juan has been repairing and selling spare parts for electronics for 10 years. He is well-experienced in this field. His business is located in Ivirgarzama on Leonardo Quispe Street. He likes the job he has chosen, and studied his trade in a vocational center. He was not able to obtain a college education due to his financial situation. Juan came to his present location from the city of Trinidad because he has more business and job opportunities in this tropical zone.

He has little competition in this area because there are only about 10 repair centers for television sets, sound systems, DVDs, etc., so the demand is high in this tropical region. The high humidity in this area causes electronic devices to malfunction, so people must turn to technicians, which is favorable for Juan’s business.

Juan is requesting this loan to buy more spare parts for electronics and thus improve customer service. For example, customers come in to have their electronic devices repaired, and Juan sometimes doesn’t have the necessary parts, which forces him to commute all the way to Cochabamba to get what he needs. This process not only wastes time, but also gives his business a bad reputation.

He has already requested 3 loans from our institution, and has good credit history. Despite the fact that they were not sizeable, his prior loans have been of great use to him and his business projects. As a result, he has been able to improve his business and his credibility as a technician. He is a growing entrepreneur in our institution.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer.

Juan tiene 36 años de edad, su familia esta compuesta por siete personas cinco hijos de 18,16,15,12 y 5 años de edad entre hombres y mujeres, todos estudian en el colegio, una de ellas que es la mayor estudia y trabaja como secretaria en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, viven en alquiler en la localidad de Ivirgarzama hace 10 años.

Juan tiene grandes proyectos tener una vivienda propia, un negocio mas grande y también de poder ver a sus hijos como profesionales para que tengan mayores oportunidades en el futuro.

Juan se dedica a la reparación y venta de repuestos de artefactos eléctricos hace mas de 10 años en la zona, tiene mucha experiencia en el rubro, esta ubicado en la localidad de Ivirgarzama sobre la calle Leonardo Quispe casi Av. Mortenson, le gusta el trabajo que emprendió en su vida, estudio para ello en un instituto de capacitación, no tuvo oportunidad de entrar a la universidad por razones económicas. Juan migró de la ciudad de trinidad, porque en el trópico hay mayores oportunidades de trabajo y negocio.

La competencia es menor en la localidad de Ivirgarzama ya que existen alrededor de 10 centros de reparación de artefactos eléctricos específicamente televisores, equipos de música, DVDs y otros, la demanda es alta en la zona, porque la zona tropical los artefactos eléctricos duran poco tiempo por varios factores sobre todo clima que es muy húmedo, la población necesariamente tiene que acudir al técnico lo que es muy favorable para Juan David porque hace sostenible su negocio y sus ingresos.

Juan solicito este crédito para la compra de repuestos de aparatos eléctricos, para mejorar la calidad de atención al cliente, por ejemplo un cliente viene y solicita la reparación y a veces Juan no tiene los repuestos necesarios para utilizarlos y necesariamente tiene que viajar a la ciudad de Cochabamba para traerlos cosa que demora mucho y puede representarle una mala imagen a su trabajo.

Él ya obtuvo varios créditos con nuestra institución, en una totalidad de 3 créditos, con un cumplimiento bueno, a pesar del pequeño monto que solicito en sus anteriores operaciones, le sirvió mucho, resultado de esté mejoro su trabajo y su imagen como técnico, es un cliente creciente en nuestra institución.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts for electronics

loans.name: Elva's Group

texts.en:
Mercedes and Elva are members of the community bank Sarita. They have both belonged to Sarita for a little over a year. In that time they have learned many things. Mercedes was originally scared to join the organization because she was told many negative things about it. She is now very happy that she joined and sees that the community bank is there to help her and make getting a loan as easy as possible. Elva says that the lessons she has received have helped her almost more than the loans and she has learned how to manage her home and take care of her children. They say that all of the associates work together and try to lead by example.

Mercedes is 41 and has two daughters, aged 19 and 13. She sells desserts such as cakes, torts, and chocolates. The community bank has been especially helpful for her because the other associates call her when they need a special dessert for a birthday or other celebration.

Elva is 30 years old and has many businesses. She sells natural health products, sometimes works in a salon, and once a week she travels to the jungle area to sell chicken and fish and then buy fruit which she sells in Ayacucho. She has been doing this for the past six years.

Mercedes and Elva need loans of 400 soles and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which will allow them to receive a discounted price by buying in a larger quantity.

They are currently saving to be able to build a house. Their dreams are to open their own stores. Mercedes would open a dessert shop and Elva would open a salon.

loans.use: Mercedes and Elva need loans of 400 soles and 1000 soles (3 soles = $1), which will allow them to receive a discounted price by buying in a larger quantity.

loans.name: Buziika Central B Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Harriet N.. She is currently in the business of tailoring and is requesting a loan to buy more cloth material. Harriet is 43 years old and is married. Her husband is a cash crop seller. She has 6 children ranging from age 10 to 25 and her children go to school. Each week, Harriet makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand to wholesale retail. Harriet has taken a loan from BRAC Uganda before in the amount of UGX 250000 in order to invest in a retail shop and the loan was paid back on time.

Harriet is joined in her small group by Sarah S., Anet B., Florence M., and Semna L.. Sarah S. has a business running a retail shop and wants to increase stock. Annet B. is currently operating a drug shop business and wants a loan to purchase more drugs to sell. Florennce M. operates a business of poultry keeping and wants to add capital. Semna L. is currently in the business of used clothing sales and is requesting a loan to boost business.

loans.use: To add to a tailoring business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es:
Gloria is a 41-year-old mother of 5. She makes garments out of the modest facilities she has outfitted in her home. Every day she receives orders from friends and other clients. This is why she has decided to purchase a recovering and darning machine to satisfy her clients with improved finished garments in less time.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Gloria de 41 años de edad es madre de 5 hijos, confecciona diversas prendas en las instalaciones del humilde taller que ha acondicionado en su hogar, a diario recibe pedidos de sus amigos y clientes y por esa razón ha decido adquirir una máquina remalladora y una recubridora a fin de otorgarle mejores acabados a cada una de sus prendas en menor tiempo para satisfacción de sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy a recovering and darning machine.

loans.name: Matale Lending Group 1

texts.en:
Christine Aslimwe, the group representative, is a 30-year-old mother of three. She also cares for her late sister's three children. All six of the children in her care attend schools for which she and her husband have to find the school fees.

Christine has had a retail shop at Matale for three years. Her dream is to develop the shop into a wholesale store by expanding its size and slowly slowly having the resources to buy in bulk for cheaper prices. For now, she wants to use the loan to add a second fridge to the shop.

This is a group loan. The loan funds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. The members mutually guarantee one another's loans. If one member does not repay, the other members are responsible.

loans.use: To pay for the group's various businesses and daily expenses.

loans.name: Diana

texts.en: Diana is married and she has one child. She has been the pharmaceutical business with her husband for the past 10 years now. She wants to use her loan to buy more drugs like pain killers, anti malarial drugs, antacids, cough mixtures, blood tonic, etc., to enable her to reach more clients. She hopes to buy additional drugs to increase her inventory. Diana is a member of the group called Paul Amantem. Members agree to guarantee each other to repay the loan. Diana’s husband is in the photo since she was at the beauty salon during the interview.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of pharmaceutical drugs

loans.name: Yun

texts.en:
Mrs. Yun C., 32, and her husband, Mr. Hong Tol were married in 1998. They have three children--two sons and a daughter. One of the children is in school. The family lives along National Road number five about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh.

Mrs. Yun has been selling grocery items for 10 years. Her husband is a taxi driver. Currently, she is in the process of creating another business. She is building a shop in front of her house to sell coffee to travelers, but lacks the money to complete the shop.

Mrs. Yun is requesting a loan of $1000 to build her coffee shop.

loans.use: To build a coffee shop

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
Delia sells lamb and alpaca at the Market 15 de Agosto. The idea came from her mother-in-law (who also is in the same business). She told her that it was very profitable business. She lives in the Yunguyo province. She joined the Wiñay Marca Communal Bank where she obtained a first loan of $105 that she used to buy two more sheep. With this new loan of $725, which will be repaid over a period of 4 months, she will buy an average of 13 sheep, which will allow her to improve her income. Delia always makes her payments punctually to the communal bank. Delia is 27 years old; she is married and has two small children. With this loan, she hopes to sell her products in other markets like Tacna, La Paz – Bolivia, to be able to buy her house and that her children are able to go to school.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva volunteer.

Delia se dedica a la venta diaria de carne de ovino y alpaca en el mercado 15 de Agosto, la idea del comercio la dio su suegra (quien se dedica a la misma actividad), le comentó que era muy rentable. Ella vive en el distrito y provincia de Yunguyo, Puno. La venta del producto era seguro por que ya tenia caseros diarios, es que se vio en la necesidad de buscar un crédito, motivo por el cual se asocio al Banco Comunal Wiñay Marca, a un inicio fue acreedora de un crédito de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles que lo invirtió en la compra de dos corderos mas. Con este préstamo de S/. 2000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará un promedio de 13 ovinos, lo cual le permitirá mejorar sus ingresos. Delia siempre paga sus intereses puntualmente al banco comunal. Delia tiene 27 años de edad, casada tiene dos hijos pequeños. Con el siguiente crédito espera vender sus productos en otros mercados como Tacna, La Paz – Bolivia, para poder comprar su casa y que sus hijos estudien.

loans.use: Buy sheep.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 37 years old. She is married with 1child, aged 3. She is a charcoal seller. Every day, she works from 6am to 7pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $300 from her sales.

Anna now hopes for a loan to buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.use: To buy more charcoal for her business.

loans.name: Ewoevi

texts.fr: Ewoevi K. est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère de 4 enfants tous à l’école. Elle est revendeuse, de puis plus de 7 ans, de céréales à Adeta, un village situé à environ 150 kilomètres de Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Elle désire par ce troisième crédit de FECECAV, augmenter la capacité de son commerce en achetant des sacs de maïs, de mils, d’haricots et darachides pour éviter les ruptures de stocks. Ces tonneaux dans la vue lui permettent de stocker ses marchandises. Elle compte sur cette chance pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Ewoevi K. is 45 years old, married, and a mother of 4 children, who all go to school. She has been a reseller for more than 7 years, in Adeta, a village about 150 kilometers from Lomé, the capital of Togo. She would like to use this third loan from FECECAV to increase the capacity of her business by buying bags of corn, millet, beans, and peanuts in order to avoid running out of stock. Having these barrels on hand will allow her to stock her merchandise. She is counting on this chance to better provide for her family.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy bags of corn, millet, beans, and peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase various goods to replenish her small grocery store.

loans.name: Youssef

texts.en:
Youssef is a 38-year-old mechanic living in Chweifat, a suburban area of Beirut. A father of two, Youssef has been working in the spare parts business for 13 years and decided on owning his own business. In 2001, he opened a car spare parts workshop in suburban Beirut and has been successfully managing it since then.

The loan of $1,200 would help him buy car spare parts and cater for his clients growing demands.

loans.use: To expand his inventory of spare parts.

loans.name: Dina

texts.en:
Dina L., 27, and her husband, Yun Yin, 31,  live in a small village about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh. They have two sons and they all live at home together.

Dina has been a garment factory worker for three years. Her husband has been a mason for seven years. The couple lacks the money to build a rest room to use in the family house. Therefore, Dina is requesting a loan of US$300 to build a rest room.

loans.use: To build one rest room to use in the family.

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.vi:
Chị LêThị Vân  năm nay 25 tuổi. Chị đang sống cùng chồng và hai con nhỏ tại Nghi Lộc tỉnh Nghệ An.Năm 2006 chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương  và vay vốn để đầu tư vào chăn nuôi bò và gà.  Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu nhập chính cho gia đình chị là từ chăn nuôi và trồng trọt với thu nhập 2.000.000đ/ tháng.
Vòng vốn tới chị Vân mong muốn được vay 9.000.000đ để tiếp tục đầu tư vào chăn nuôi.
texts.en:
Mrs. Lê Thị Vân, 25 years old, lives with her husband and two young children in Nghi Lộc district, Nghệ An province. In 2006, she became a member of the TYM Fund and used a loan to invest in raising cows and chickens. Currently, the main sources of income for her family are raising animals and growing crops. They earn a total of about 2,000,000 VND (122 USD) per month. In the next lending cycle, Mrs. Vân hopes to borrow 9,000,000 VND (550 USD) to continue investing in raising animals.

Translated from Vietnamese by Robert Sides, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising cows and chickens

loans.name: Jackelina  Mayke

texts.es:
Jackelina es socia del Bancomunal Luz de la esperanza.

Jackelina es conviviente, tiene 28 años, dos hijos de 6 y 3 años en el colegio fe y alegría, ella  solo estudio hasta tercer año de primaria por que  sus padres se separaron, ella se dedica a cuidar a sus cinco hermanos  que iban a estudiar mientras que ella quedaba en casa y su mama salía a trabajar; Por ese motivo ella no aprendió a leer ni escribir correctamente sabe un poco y se equivoca con frecuencia con los números, su esposo la ayuda cuando llega del trabajo, él trabaja en construcción, Jackelina se dedica a la venta de ropa, le vende a sus conocidos. 
Necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles para la  comprar ropa y venderla  a sus vecinas.  
Desde que esta en Finca recibe consejos de su promotora de cómo llevar su negocio, aprendido la importancia de ser honestad en el negocio para no perder la clientela y aprendió a ser   de ser puntual en sus pagos.

El sueño de Jackelina es saber leer y escribir bien, por que su hija le pregunta y ella no sabe que dice en los libros,  le gustaría tener un Kiosco para vender ropa, y no  estar por las casas ofreciendo su mercadería.
texts.en:
Jackelina is a member of the "Luz de la Esperanza" communal bank. Jackelina lives with her partner, is 28 years old and has two children, 6 and 3 years old. She studied only up to the third grade of primary school because her parents separated and she took care of her five brothers and sisters, who studied while she stayed at home and her mother went off to work. For this reason she did not learn to read and write correctly. She knows a little and frequently makes mistakes with numbers. Her husband helps her when her arrives home from work; he works in construction. Jackelina sells clothing to her acquaintances.She needs a loan for 1200 soles to buy clothing to sell to her neighbors. Since she has been in Finca she has received advice on how to manage her business, learning the importance of being honest in business so as to not lose customers and learning to be punctual in her payments. Jackelina´s dream is to read and write well, because her when daughter asks her she does not know what it says in books. She would like to have a stand for selling clothing and not be going from house to house selling her merchandise.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing for resale.

loans.name: Vilcanota Group

texts.es:
El nombre de este banco comunal se llama, "VILCANOTA"; Este nombre proviene de la época INKA, es el río mayor que alimenta a otros pequeños ríos en el valle de Cusco; Se funda este banquito el día 13 de febrero del 2009, y está ubicado en el distrito de Urcos, en la provincia de Quispicanchis del del departamento de Cusco, está situado a 1.15 hora de la ciudad del Cusco, considerado zona rural, la gente vive de la agricultura y ganadería, convinando así sus actividades domésticas, dentro de estas actividades muchos de los socios también son estibadores (cargan en sus pequeños bolquetes ormigón, arena, piedras, entre otros); Los socios estan sumamente agradecidos por la ayuda brindada, así mismo ellos se comprometen a compensar el préstamo a tiempo.

Este préstamo será invertido en, 08 socios invertiran para la compra de ovejas, y terneros, para mejorar la raza y así poder vender sus ganados a mayor precio, 02 socios invertirán el préstamo en la compra de accsesorios para sus bolquetes de carga pesada, de ese modo podrán seguir siendo alquilados; 02 socias invertirán el préstamo en la compra de productos para cocinar,ellas comprarán, carne, papas, sal, limónes, verduras, entre otras especies, puesto que ellas venden comida en el mercado local y desean mejorar sus servicio para atraer a más clientes.
texts.en:
The name of this communal bank is "VILCANOTA"; This name comes of the Inca times. It is the biggest river that feeds other small rivers in the Cusco valley. This small group was formed on February 13, 2009, and is located in the district of Urcos, in the province of Quispicanchis of the department of Cusco. It is 1.15 hour away from of the city of the Cusco, this area is considered rural zone. The people in the area live of agriculture and cattle, They combine their domestic activities with these. Many of the partners also are stevedores (they load in their small dump trucks concrete, sand, stones, among others); The partners are extremely grateful by the offered help, therefore they promise to repay the loan on time. This loan will used by 8 partners and they will invest it to buy sheep, and calves, in order to improve the race and then be able to sell their cattle at a better price. Two of partners will invest the loan in buying accessories for their heavy load dump trucks, this way they will be able to keep on being hired. Other 2 of the partners will invest the loan in buying cooking products like meat, potatoes, salt, lemons, vegetables, among others, since they sell meals at the local market and want to improve their service to attract more clients.

Translated from Spanish by Ana Gabriela Clark, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy and sell wholesale and retail animals.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 28-year-old engaged man who lives in Tyre, in southern Lebanon. Mahmoud has owns a computer and mobile phone shop. He repairs and sells computers and mobile phones, as well as their accessories. He requested a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase more merchandise for his shop and computer spare parts. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan.

Mahmoud is good at his work. His clients are his friends and neighbors. When he first started his business, he didn’t have the startup capital. Mahmoud decided on doing this business because of his experience in the business, as well as he likes working with phones and especially with computers.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise and computer spare parts

loans.name: Diomar

texts.es:
Diomar es socia del Bancomunal Amigas Unidas.
Diomar  es separada, tiene 48 años  una hija de 28 años, que trabaja  
Diomar vendía comida en el mercado durante dos años, lo dejo por qué no-tenia quien le ayudó, hace siete años se  puso a vender productos de belleza por catalogo. 
Diomar necesita un crédito de 2000 soles, para invertirlos en  la compra de productos de belleza por catalogo. 
Desde que está en Finca, ha aumentado su capital, ya no necesita estar pidiendo prestado a otras personas dinero que le cobrarán altos intereses. 
El sueño de Diomar es tener una tienda bazar.
texts.en:
Diomar is a partner in the Amigas Unidas Community Bank. She 48 years old and separated. She has one daughter who is 28 years old and works independently. Diomar sold food in the market for two years, but she had to abandon the business because she didn't have anyone to help her. Seven years ago she began to sell beauty products via catalog. Diomar needs a loan of 2000 soles to invest in beauty products. Since working with Finca she has increased her capital, and now she doesn't need to ask for loans from people who charge high interest rates. Diomar dreams of owning a store in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in beauty products

loans.name: Debagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe Debagnouma (6 femmes toutes mariées) avec une moyenne d’âge de 38 ans, 4 enfants,  vivent dans des  familles polygames à Médine un des quartiers populaires de Sikasso 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles mènent diverses  activités  qui sont entre autres la vente de tissus, de condiments (tomate, oignon, cube magie, etc.), de  boissons et la restauration.
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de satisfaire le besoin de leur clientèle. Elles sont à leur dixième  prêt solidaire et tous les prêts précédents se sont  bien dénoués.
Avec ce nouveau prêt, elles comptent acheter, 50 paniers de tomates, 8 douzaines de tasses en plastiques et aluminiums, un stock de condiments, 10 rouleaux de tissus, 100 kg de pomme de terre, des poulets etc. Elles s’approvisionnent au marché de Médine et au grand marché de Sikasso . 
Les marchandises sont vendues  au marché, dans les concessions et de  façon ambulante à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes et la plupart au comptant.
Elles envisagent réaliser chacune un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 15.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisée pour les besoins de la famille et l’autre partie sera investie dans les activités.
Les femmes du groupe Debagnouma ambitionnent être grossiste.
texts.en:
The members of this Debagnouma group (6 women, all married) with an average age of 38, 4 children, live in polygamous families in Médine, a working class neighborhood of Sikasso, third administrative region of Mali. They have diverse businesses, among others selling fabric, condiments (tomatoes, onions, Maggi cubes, etc.), drinks, and cooked food.

They work together with the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso so as to satisfy the needs of their clientele. They are on the 10th solidarity loan and all the preceding loans have been correctly repaid. With this new loan they intend to buy 50 baskets of tomatoes, 8 dozen bowls made of plastic or tin, a stock of condiments, 10 bolts of cloth, 100 kg of potatoes, chickens, etc. They buy their supplies at the market of Médine and at the big open-air market of Sikasso.

The merchandise is sold in the market, out of their compounds, and door-to-door to a clientele composed of men and women, mostly for cash. They each expect to make an average monthly profit of 15,000 F CFA of which part will be used for family needs and the rest reinvested back into their businesses.

The ambition of the women of the Debagnouma group is to become wholesalers.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various articles and making cooked food for sale

loans.name: Folake

texts.en: Folake's husband's name is O. and they have five children. She is 46 years old. Folake sells cooked foods, sarongs and plastics. She is requesting the loan amount of N50, 000 to purchase more plastics to sell. Folake is a LAPO client. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more plastics to sell

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy G. is a 53-year-old mother, widowed and blessed with four children. She lives in Pigsag-an, Cagayan de Oro City in Southern Philippines. Three of her children are in school. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. 

Mercy's business has existed for almost a year now and it’s getting better. But due to the demands of her customers, she wanted to have more items in her store. To be able to support this, she wanted to obtain a loan from HSPFI (a Kiva partner) amounting to Php 11,000 to purchase grocery items.

This will be a great help for the family to earn more income especially since she is the only one who earns money for the family. Sometimes, her son helps her to earn money by planting bananas and the fruit is sold through peddling in their neighborhood and nearby villages.

loans.use: To purchase more grocery items for her sari-sari store

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Mungun

texts.en:
Mungun D. lives with his wife and his infant daughter in Arhangai province, one of Mongolia's central provinces. Mungun got married two years ago and his daughter was born just eight months ago. His wife is a cook in a local restaurant but now stays home taking care of her infant daughter.

Mungun makes various household items and furniture in wood. He has been running a small carpentry shop since 2005. He mostly makes traditional wooden furniture by request of local customers. Since the start in 2005, he has done well and his business capital has increased from 200,000 MNT to 600,000 MNT (100,000 MNT is approximately $75).

In the future, he hopes to purchase a small truck for his business. The truck would enable him to deliver raw materials to his carpentry shop by himself, instead of buying expensive woods from retailers. He requests a loan to purchase various woods for his carpentry business.

loans.use: To buy various woods for his carpentry business

loans.name: Lawal

texts.en: B. is 48 years old and married with two children. B. sells provisions. She is requesting for the loan of N120,000 to purchase provisions to sell in order to meet customer demand. She says thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Betty Adela

texts.es:
La señora Betty Adela A. Azabache, tiene 52 años D. edad, vive en el distrito D. Moche, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º D. secundaria, tiene 10 hijos y 5 dependen económicamente D. ella porque se encuentran estudiando.
Betty se dedica a la crianza D. animales como: cerdos, ovejas, cuyes, vacas para luego venderlos.
