Con el primer crédito D. 300 nuevos soles lo utilizo para comprar mas animales y posteriormente venderlos.
El crédito D. 300 nuevos soles, lo invertirá en la compra D. mas animales (cerdos, ovejas).
Betty sueña con aumentar la crianza y comercialización D. sus animales.
texts.en:
Mrs. Betty Adela A. Azabache is 52 years old, she lives in the district of Moche, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru.

The entrepreneur studied until 5th graD., has 10 children, 5 still economically dependent on her as they are studying.

Betty breeds animals such as pigs, lamb, guineapigs, and cows which she later sells. With the first loan of 300 nuevos soles she bought animals which she later sold. The loan of 300 nuevos soles will be spent on buying more animals (pigs, lamb). It is Betty's dream to increase the number of animals and market them.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase animals to breed and sell.

loans.name: Los Colavoradores, Group 7

texts.en:
Nadine Reculé (far right) is the coordinator of a solidarity group within Los Colavoradores, an Esperanza Bank of Hope from Juan Dolio, a town near San Pedro de Macorís in the Dominican Republic. Nadine is an immigrant from Haiti, where she was trained as a nurse. Unfortunately, she has been unable to get a job as a nurse here in the Dominican Republic, so she has had to find other ways to make a living. Two years ago she opened her own colmadito, a small convenience store she runs out of her home. She currently sells snack items such as soda, candy, and chips. Unsatisfied with the current state of her business, Nadine has applied for her first-ever microloan! With the loan money, she plans to invest in food supplies such as rice, beans, and cooking oils. 

Nadine has two daughters, ages six and four, who are both in school. She says that she wants nothing more than for them to grow up to be nurses. 

Please lend to Nadine and her group as they strive to achieve their goals!

loans.use: Rice, beans, cooking oils

loans.name: Las Amigas Group

texts.es:
Marcela C.  tiene 49 años, vende radios pequeñas hace 18 años en la feria “16 de Julio”, donde tiene su puesto de venta,  y sale a vender los días Jueves y Domingo, los demás días atiende a su familia ya que tiene 5 hijos, aunque ya son mayores ella no los quiere descuidar. Marcela ingresa al grupo hace 3 años, por invitación de una de sus amigas y manifiesta que le gusta la forma de trabajo, sobre todo compartir con sus amigas en cada reunión. Actualmente necesita el préstamo para seguir comprando mercadería, es decir, radios pequeñas ya que está pensando en dar a crédito.

Las demás integrantes del grupo tienen sus propios negocios como  la costura de prendas, venta de dulces, comida, repuestos de autos, muebles y alimento seco y requieren el préstamo para la compra de mercadería y materia prima.

loans.use: COMPRA DE MERCADERIA Y MATERIA PRIMA

loans.name: Latoya

texts.en:
Latoya K. is a 24-year-old woman living in the town of Lotopa.  She is married and has 1 infant-aged child.  To make a living, Latoya operates a tailoring business.  She provides children's tailoring services to local community members.  Latoya has done this for over 2 years and earns approximately 500 WST a month.

In 2009, Latoya joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Latoya is requesting a loan from SPBD for the first time.  Latoya is now requesting a new loan of 1000 WST which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials.  Latoya plans to use the extra money she makes to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD:
SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific.  SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on a respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders."

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

loans.name: Bol

texts.en:
Bol R. is currently in the business of selling dried fish and is requesting a loan to purchase more fish to sell.  

Bol is 39 years old and is Married with a husband that is a builder. She has 3 children and her children go to school.  

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open up a shop.

 BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase more fish to sell

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 53 year old man who lives in Beirut, capital of Lebanon with his wife and their four children. Ali has owned a clothing store for over thirty years. He requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his store. This is his second cycle and he has always paid on time. 
His previous loans helped him improve his store by diversifying his merchandise and answering more his clients’ needs. Ali is special in his work because his has competitive prices and is generous with his clients because they can bargain prices. His clients are mainly his friends, neighbors and passer-bys. When he first started his business, he had to face difficulties since he took after his father’s work and he was already known and had a good reputation in his region. In the future, he plans on improving his store by diversifying more his merchandise and start selling children’s clothes as well.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan S. is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 to help him pay school fees and other school related charges for his five children. Hassan was born in 1961 in the Kambia district, in northern Sierra Leone. He is married to a farmer and they have five children, four of whom are in secondary schools and the last is not of school going age.

loans.use: Pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina operates a transportation business, and she also had a retail store but it has been closed for one year now. She would like a loan of 5,000 Philippine pesos to use for repairs and maintenance of her motorcycle and to reopen her small retail store in order to earn more income.

Merlina is 51 years old and she is married to Romeo E.. The couple is blessed with four children: their eldest is a housekeeper, age 27; followed by a teacher, age 22; next to her is a college student, age 16; and their youngest is a high school student, age 14 years old. They are presently living in the village of Pinoma, Cauayan City. Their house is located near the rice farm and along the village road. She hopes and prays that Kiva lenders will grant her requested loan so she can manage her budget and have a stable business.

loans.use: Repairs and maintenace of her motorcycle and to reopen her retail store

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen A. is a 46-year-old married mother of one child. She lives with her family in Chaani, Mombasa where she is a tailor. Hellen has been running her tailoring shop for six years and it is a success.

She joined KADET recently and is glad to be accessing her first loan to finance her shop. With the loan she plans to buy more garments to be able to satisfy the customers she serves, who are mainly area residents.

In future she hopes to become an established and sought-after clothing designer.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To buy more garments for the tailoring shop she runs

loans.name: Kudirat

texts.en:
Kudirat lives in Lagos State, Nigeria. She sells cooking oil and frozen foods at retail prices to her customers. This is the high season for her business and she hopes to make more profits during this season. She has been in this business for 2 years.

She is happily married with 3 children and she is 32 years old. She is a LAPO client. LAPO (Lift Above Poverty Organization) is committed to improving lives in Nigeria.  She hopes for a loan amount of 140,000 NGN to purchase more cooking oil and frozen foods to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more cooking oil and frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Iko

texts.en:
Iko U. is currently in the business of selling rice and beans in the market. She is requesting a loan to stock more bags of rice and beans to sell.  

Iko is 30 years old and married to a police officer. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  

In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The micro-finance program, which is targeted toward returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Stock more bags of rice and beans to sell

loans.name: Exsilda

texts.es:
La señora Exsilda, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Santa Ana”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 63 años  y es madre de 06 hijos, ya independientes.

Su carácter y su anhelo de cumplir sus sueños, le motivaron a emprender su propio negocio de venta de abarrotes con cuyas ganancias aportaría al ingreso económico en su hogar, desde su  inicio a la fecha ha ido ganando clientes. Se encuentra ubicada en su misma casa. Hoy en día cuenta con clientes fijos que a diario acuden a su casa, a comprar porque en ella  encuentran todo los productos que el ama de casa necesita y es quien personalmente les atiende  con el carisma que le caracteriza. 

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,000.00, comprará arroz y azúcar en sacos; galletas, fideos y sales en paquetes, leche y conservas de pescado en cajas y en variedad de marcas, huevos en javas y artículos de higiene personal para continuar dando una mejor atención a sus clientes. 

Exsilda, se siente muy bien para continuar trabajando y esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos por ayudar a mujeres como ella a tener oportunidades de desarrollarse en el medio donde se desenvuelven.
texts.en:
Exsilda, 63, is a member of the "Santa Ana" communal bank, which is in Moyobamba district, Moyobamba province, San Martín department. She is married and the mother of six children, all of whom are now independent. Her character and desire to see her dreams come true motivated her to open her own grocery store in her home. The earnings from the store go to meeting household expenses. From the beginning she has been acquiring regular customers. Currently, they come to her house on a regular basis because they find all the items a housewife needs and because they receive the personal attention that she, herself, gives them with her characteristic good humor and charisma. With this 1000 sol loan she will buy sacks of rice and sugar, cookies, pasta, packages of salt, cases of milk and preserved fish of various brands, flats of eggs and personal hygiene items to continue to provide excellent customer service. Exsilda feels good to continue to work and is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping women like her to have the opportunity to develop in their areas of interest.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 73 años su actividad económica es venta de tortillas y cuajadas. Hace más de 34 años que se dedica a este negocio, por lo que es una actividad que le gusta mucho pues todos los días se levanta muy temprano, para realizar las cuajadas para ofrecerlas a sus clientes. Irma es una mujer muy responsable y que disfruta de su trabajo ya que por medio de él ha podido mantener a su hijo de 14 años de edad, que está a su cargo y con mucho esfuerzo le ha brindado lo necesario. Ella solicita este financiamiento para capital de trabajo para la compra de maíz, cuajada y leña que son la materia prima necesaria para la buena elaboración de sus productos. Su deseo es seguir adelante con este negocio que su único medio de vida.
texts.en:
Irma is 73 years old and sells tortillas and curds. She has been in this business for more than 34 years. Irma enjoys her work very much and wakes up very early each day to start making the curds to sell to her customers. She is a very responsible woman who works hard to support her 14 year old child and provide everything that is needed.

This loan will be used as operating capital to purchase corn, curds, and firewood, which are the raw materials needed to make her products properly. Irma hopes to succeed in this business since it is her only means of making a living.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for making tortillas & curds

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fish in bulk

loans.name: Viky

texts.en: Viky S. is 31 years old, married, and has three children. She works in the Grand Marché de Hédranawoé selling cereals and other diverse products. She began this business ten years ago and is now asking for her first loan from Kiva partner, WAGES. She will use this loan to purchase corn, beans, and other grains and cereals to sell to her customers. With this loan, Mrs. S. will be able to help support both her family and her business.

loans.use: To purchase grains and cereals for resale

loans.name: Ruchika

texts.en:
Ruchika is a 27-year-old woman living with her husband and two children, aged 10 and 5, in the town of Dickwella, in southern Sri Lanka.

Ruchika has a coir-making business that she runs independently, while her husband has his own fishing business. She has been in the coir making business for three years, which consists of extracting the fibers of a coconut to be woven together into different forms of rope or yarn, which can then be woven together to make products such as floor mats.

Ruchika is a hard-working woman who is very knowledgeable about her business. She is asking for a 30,000 LKR loan in order to purchase more raw materials in order to extract the coir. Eventually, in the future, she hopes to purchase a new coir machine with her profits.

For now, Ruchika hopes to expand and develop her business further as there is low competition in the area and she sees room for expansion.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials

loans.name: Enhtaivan

texts.en: Enhtaivan is 52 years old and lives with his wife in Arhangai province, Mongolia. He and his wife live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. Enhtaivan makes gold and silver goods in his town. He started his business in 1995 with a working capital of $7 and over the years he has expanded his business and gained much experience. Currently, his working capital exceeds $845. Enhtaivan has a loyal customer base because of his well-designed and high quality products. Enhtaivan is requesting a $705 loan to purchase more silver for his business.

loans.use: To purchase more silver

loans.name: Edwin Antonio

texts.es:
El joven Edwin Antonio M. G., tiene la edad de 26 años es casado y junto a su esposo y su hijo recién nacido habitan en el Barrio Juan Ramón Padilla, desde hace tres años tienen una moto taxi, la cual es su fuente de ingresos.

Dentro de sus mayores necesidades de la familia M., esta la construcción de su vivienda es por esta razón que solicita un préstamo para la compra  de materiales de construcción tales como bloques, cemento, hierro y tablas de madera, con esta inversión podrán ayudar a este joven matrimonio a edificar su vida y ofrecerle a su pequeño hijo de nueve meses de nacido, mejores condiciones de vida debido a que el pequeño, ha mostrado multiples complicaciones en su salud y desean realizar la inversión para la comodidad del pequeño.
texts.en:
Edwin Antonio M. G. is 26 years old, married and he lives with his wife and new born son in the Juan Ramón Padilla neighborhood. For the last three years they have had a motorbike taxi, which is their source of income. Among the M. family's greatest needs is the building of their home. This is why he is asking for a loan - to buy building materials such as blocks, cement, iron and planks of wood. With this investment you will be able to help this young married couple build their life and offer their young new born son better living conditions. Given that the child has had multiple heath complications they want to make this investment for the comfort of their child.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build his house

loans.name: Bernard

texts.en: Bernard, a 45-year-old married father of two, is a carpenter of 17 years' experience with two employees.  His wife is employed as a teacher.  Bernard joined a group in Faulu Kenya so that he could easily access loans.  He previously secured a loan of Kes. 25,000 to buy a plot of land and is now requesting a loan of Kes. 50,000 to buy timber. Describing himself as a focused man, Bernard hopes to own several workshops in the future.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To expand her husband's oil shop business.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina G., 35, is from the village of Bitag Pequeño, Baggao, Cagayan. She is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Gina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Gina has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns around 3,000 PHP whenever she sells her raised animal.

In 2009, Gina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from ASKI. Gina is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Gina from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Vennicah

texts.en:
Vennicah K. O. is twenty eight years old, married, and has two children aged eight years old and three years.

Vennicah’s business is located at Juja, a busy market in Thika. Thika is the region in Kenya known for the production of pineapples. She has been selling vegetables such as tomatoes, kale, cabbages, carrots and other vegetables for the last two years to the local people.

Vennicah says that this business is profitable and the major challenge she has is fluctuating market prices, hence selling her produce at low prices. Changes in weather patterns also affects the production and harvest of these vegetables, hence affecting the prices. However she works very hard to keep her business doing well.

Vennicah is using her loan of Kes 50,000 to buy more vegetables to expand her business. She hopes to grow her business and be able to supply in larger quantities to the local people. She describes herself as very hardworking.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables to expand her business

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty tiene 55 años, vive con su esposo y sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Hace mas D. 40 años se dedica a bordar, para ello cuenta con un taller artesanal, en donD. su hija la ayuda en esta labor. La experiencia que tiene le ha servido para realizar bellos bordados, es así que disfruta haciéndolo por la tranquilidad que le proporciona, además que requiere toda la concentración posible, para hacer cada falda, como colocar lentejillas e hilos  dorados, plateados y D. otros colores. Una vez que ha terminado D. producir, su clientela  compra  muy satisfecha las prendas, porque conocen la calidad del trabajo, D. esa manera la recompensa es buena, es por eso que Betty desea tener mayor producción. Este es su noveno crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte D. su grupo comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. insumos y materiales necesarios para sus bordados, que son: hilos D. diversos colores, así como aplicaciones en lentejuelas e hilos especiales (dorados y plateados) y telas.
texts.en:
Betty is 55 years old and lives with her husband and 5 children in her own home. She has been an embroiderer for more than 40 years and has her own workshop, in which she now works with her daughter. The experience has allowed her to make some beautiful embroidered patterns. It is a job that she enjoys for the calmness it gives her. She requires a great deal of concentration to complete every skirt, given the time it takes to add all the sequins and gold, silver and other coloured threads. Her customers buy her clothing with great satisfaction because they recognise the quality of her work. And it is for this reason that Betty would like to increase her output. This is her ninth loan with MFP. She is very pleased to have the financial support and has always proven to be a responsible borrower. She likes being a member of a communal group because everyone in the group is responsible and offers mutual support. With the loan that she has requested, Betty will buy the necessary materials for making her embroidered clothes, such as special thread in various colours (e.g. gold and silver), sequins, and fabrics.

Translated from Spanish by Cameron Graham, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics, sequins and special thread in different colours

loans.name: Claudia Esmeralda

texts.es:
Claudia tiene 30 años D. edad resiD. en El municipio D. San Rafael D. Oriente, Departamento D. San Miguel, es casada, vive con el esposo y tienen una hija D. 2 años D. edad, ella tiene un negocio donD. venD. productos D. primera necesidad “ Tienda “.
El negocio lo realizo por iniciativa propia, el esposo la apoya, no tiene horario definido y sus clientes son los vecinos y personas que circulan por la zona, ella necesita el préstamo para compra D. productos como son: leche en polvo, azúcar, frijoles, aceite , arroz y otros productos D. primera necesidad que los cliente demandan.
El sueño D. Claudia es mantener el negocio y prepararse procesionalmente ya que el esposo actualmente estudia enfermería, y ella le gustaría también especializarse en esta misma carrera.
texts.en:
Claudia is 30 years old, married, and lives in the municipality of San Rafael D. Oriente, Department of San Miguel, with her husband and their 2 year old daughter. She iniciated the business, called "Shop", which sells necessities. She is supported by her husband, has no set schedule, and her customers are neighbors and people traveling around the town. She is requesting a loan to purchase products such as powdered milk, sugar, beans, oil, rice, and other products that the customers ask for. Claudia's dream is to maintain her business and as her husband is studying to become a nurse, prepare herself professionally for the same career.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products such as powdered milk, sugar, beans, oil, rice

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is a 40 year old married lady.  For ten years, she has been operating a salon. Since she joined Lifestyle group in Faulu Kenya, her business has really improved. This is because she previously serviced three loans from Faulu Kenya. She has been successful in repaying her loans, hence she has been guaranteed another loan of 50,000 KES. She will use the money to add inventory of make-up and cosmetics. She hopes to expand her business for better income so as to invest in building her own home in the future. She dreams of opening many outlets in ten years.

loans.use: To add inventory of make-up and cosmetics.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth B. is from Barangay San Jose in the town of Talibon. She is 24 years old, married and has two young kids. She raises pigs to fatten and sell. She also makes rice cakes that she sells in the morning. In the afternoon, she makes "halo-halo", a popular dessert snack in the Philippines. It is a mixture of shaved ice and milk to which are added various boiled sweet beans and fruits. Elizabeth also cooks fried chicken. She spends time feeding the pigs late in the afternoon. 

Elizabeth joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elizabeth is requesting a new loan of 6000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed & other supplies. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Elizabeth from CEVI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.en:
Asuncion C., aged 50, has three children – one in college, one in high school, and one in elementary school. She works hard each day to cover her daily costs and help send her children to school. For the past ten years, Asuncion has run her own sari-sari store (general store) and barbeque, and has used her earnings to support her family.
Asuncion has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to help restock her sari-sari store with groceries, soft drinks, and toiletries. She hopes that the additional inventory will attract new customers and help grow her business.
Asuncion has been a member of Kiva partner, Center for Community Transformation (CCT), since 2005 and has consistently attended weekly fellowship* meetings. She hopes that her business will continue to expand and that some day she will be able to afford her own vehicle and provide additional money for her children's education.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To purchase inventory

loans.name: Rubilee's Group

texts.en:
Rubilee H. is from the village of San Vicente Bajo, Oroquieta City. She is 30 years old. Rubilee is the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by GDMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are each responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if either is delinquent or defaults.

Rubilee is married. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store. Her main source of income comes from selling sugar, milk, coffee, noodles and canned goods. Rubilee has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 2800 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rubilee joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rubilee is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which she will use to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Rubilee from GDMPC.

<b>About GDMPC<b>

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: For business expansion.

loans.name: Haby

texts.fr:
Haby K. a plus de 53 ans est mariée et mère de 7 enfants (5garçons et 2 filles). Elle réside avec son époux, ses deux co-épouses et leurs enfants à Hamdallaye, un des  quartiers populaires de la ville de Sikasso (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Haby K. après avoir mené beaucoup d’activités sans succès notamment l’agriculture au village, elle s’est initiée à cette activité d’achat et de vente de calebasses et divers depuis plus de dix ans. 
Dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, elle décida d’adhérer au programme crédit de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso il y a environ cinq ans. Après 6 prêts solidaires (prêt du groupe) dans une Association des femmes de son quartier (Association BENKADI de Hamdallaye), elle est présentement à son troisième prêt individuel. Ses prêts précédents ont été  tous correctement remboursés. 
Ainsi, elle sollicite ce troisième prêt pour acheter, 10 colis de calebasses à Tona région de Ségou (quatrième région administrative du Mali) avant de les revendre  en détail au grand marché de Sikasso près de la mairie centrale de la localité à une clientèle composée généralement des femmes et surtout des miniers.
Elle envisage réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 170 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé essentiellement pour augmenter son fonds de commerce, contribuer aux dépenses familiales et payer les intérêts de son prêt.
texts.en:
Haby K. is over 53 years old, married and mother to seven children (five boys and two girls). She lives with her husband, his two other wives and their children in Hamdallaye, one of the working-class districts of the town of Sikasso (the Republic of Mali's third administrative region).

Having had many unsucessful activities, notably village farming, she began her business buying and selling calabashes (fruit grown on a vine which can be dried and used as bottles or utensils) and other items more than ten years ago. 

In order to satisfy her ever increasing customer base, she decided to join the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwaso's loan program about five years ago. After six group loans, as part of an association of women from her neighborhood (Hamdallaye's Benkadi Association) she is currently on her third individual loan. All her previous loans have been repaid in full. She is thus requesting a third loan to buy ten parcels of calabashes in the Tona area of Ségou (Mali's fourth administrative region) before reselling them on a retail basis at the large market in Ségou near to the town hall at the centre of the town, to a customer base made up mainly of women and above all miners. 

With this loan, she expects to make a monthly profit of 170,000FCFA, which will be used primarily to expand her business, contribute to family expenses and pay interest on his loan;

loans.use: To buy parcels of calabashes

loans.name: Ruben Neptali

texts.es:
el señor Ruben Neptali P. tiene 25 años de edad, tiene casa propia, esta casado y dice sentirse muy feliz.
Ruben es empleado de Tropigas donde se desempeña como agente de ventas.
Ruben tiene 2 hijos por los cuales trabaja muy fuerte para sacarlos adelante, es muy responsable ademas cuenta con buenos principios morales y religiosos. varios vecinos a su casa de habitacion hablaron bien de el.
el credito lo utilizara para comprar materiales de construccion ya que desea remodelar su casa, esto es para darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ruben Neptali P., 25, has his own home and is married and reports he feels very happy. 

Ruben is an employee of Tropigas [a butane gas supply company] where he works as a sales agent. 

Ruben has two children for whom he works very hard in order to get them ahead. He is very responsible and also has good moral and religious principles. Several of his neighbors spoke highly of him. 

He will use the loan to purchase construction materials since he wishes to remodel his house in order to give his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: To purchase cement, iron rods, lime, sand, rock

loans.name: Nora Azucena

texts.es: Nora Azucena tiene 30 años, ella se dedica a una pulpería. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio. Su pulpería está localizada en su vivienda tiene una gran variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes, Realiza su trabajo sola para poder ayudar con los gastos familiares, trabaja desde muy temprano ofreciendo los productos se levanta temprano desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 9 de la noche. Con el préstamo quiere comprar productos como golosinas, refrescos, detergentes, pan y granos básicos. En el futuro quiere terminar de construir su casa y asegurar el estudio de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nora Azucena, 30, earns a living with a general goods store, a business she has had for more than four years. Her store is located in her home and she has a great variety of products to offer her customers. She works alone to be able to help with the family expenses. She opens shop and begins working very early. She gets up early and works from 7 in the morning until 9 at night. 

With the loan she wants to buy products such as candies, drinks, detergents, bread and basic foodstuffs. In the future she wants to finish building her house and see that her children are able to complete their studies.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Tatay Sumpa Group

texts.en:
Meet with members of the “Tatay Sumpa” group from Magburaka, a town in northern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Hawa T. is the leader of this group. The 50-year-old is married to a businessman and they have five children. Hawa sells cooked rice, cooked foofoo (food made out of cassava roots), and fried cakes. She has been a businesswoman for 10 years now.  With her share of this loan, she will buy cooking ingredients: palm oil, rice, onions, etc. at wholesale.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients – palm oil, rice, onions, etc. at wholesale

loans.name: Delia Reyna

texts.es: Delia Reyna F. de 60 años de edad, reside en el municipio de San Martín el cual se encuentra en el departamento de San Salvador. Ella vive junto a su esposo con quien trabajan muy duro para salir adelante. Delia posee un bazar en el cual comercializa ropa para hombres, mujeres y niños, entre las cuales hay ropa usada y así también prendas de vestir nuevas. Así mismo comercializa cremas para el cuerpo, y el cabello, cosméticos y zapatos. Durante 14 años y medio Delia ha trabajo en este negocio en el cual ha ido creciendo poco a poco tras muchos sacrificios. Ella solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda contar con el dinero necesario para comprar mayor cantidad de ropa nueva y usada, así mismo para comprar zapatos y cosméticos, los cuales son los que más se venden.
texts.en:
Delia Reyna F. is 60 years old.  She lives in the town of San Martín, in San Salvador department.  She lives with her husband and they both work hard to get ahead in life.  Delia owns a store where she sells men's, women's and children's clothes.  She sells both used and new clothes.  She also sells body creams, hair creams, cosmetics and shoes.

Delia has been in this business for fourteen and a half years and her business has grown little by little with a lot of hard work.  She is requesting a loan so that she has the money she needs to buy a larger quantity of new and used clothes.  She would also like to buy shoes and cosmetics which are what she sells the most of.

loans.use: To buy clothes and cosmetics to sell

loans.name: Nani Maiya

texts.en:
Mrs. Nani Maiya D. lives in Sanepa, Lalitpur. She lives with her husband Mr. Ashukazi D. and three children. Her husband is a taxi driver. Her daughter is studying in grade 12, her sons are studying in grades 10 and 9 respectively.

Mrs. D. opened a grocery shop two years ago to uplift the living standard of her family. Their condition is not good, and it is hard to provide a good education for her sons because in Nepal the cost of education is very high. That's why she opened the shop.

Due to a lack of funds she can’t buy goods for her shop. So she has applied for Rs 10000.00 loan to buy goods such as rice, dal, noodles, and so on. She wants to provide a better education for her children and to help her husband to upgrade the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buys grocery goods for her shop

loans.name: Thlang

texts.en:
Thlang S., 45, is a local rice cultivator who has been farming on her own land for many years. In addition, she raises a few pigs behind her home. She is married to Hun Hoerng, age 44, who helps her in the farming business. This couple has seven children, five of whom are single, and two are married and live in their own house.  

Presently, the weather is dry and it may affect Thlang S.’s business. She faces a difficult season if she is not able to irrigate her crop. Thlang S. is taking out her loan to purchase a machine that she uses to pump water for her crops.

loans.use: To purchase a machine that she uses to pump water for her crops.

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: La  señora Marina dedicada a la venta de productos en su tienda de barrio, la señora  se encuentra durante todo el día en su domicilio atendiendo el negocio de esta manera también puede estar con sus hijos para alimentarlos y solucionar algún problema que ellos lleguen a tener. La tiendita que atiende es bastante concurrido por el buen trato que emite doña marina. Debido  a la demanda la señora piensa ampliar su negocio para satisfacer de mejor manera a todos los clientes que frecuenten su venta por este motivo solicito el crédito para la compra de mercadería como aceite, arroz, azúcar, fideo, galletas, etc. es una persona joven muy trabajadora, con ganas de superación, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marina sells products out the small store located in her home.  She spends the entire day attending to her business in order to provide an income for her children and take care of any problem they might have.

The store is very busy because Doña Marina provides great service.  Because of the high demand she wants to expand her business and provide the best for her customers.  She is requesting the loan to buy more goods such as oil, rice, sugar, pasta, cookies, etc.  She is a very hard-working young person who wants to succeed.  She is very grateful to the institution for the support she has received.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for retail sale

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
Don Jorge, un señor de 61 años de edad, reside en Jiquilisco departamento de Usulután, es agricultor en pequeño, vive con su hija, él es un agricultor de experiencia, cultiva sus tierras y la cosecha le sirve para comercializar y para uso familiar.
Don Jorge está solicitando un préstamo para comprar insumos y cultivar pipianes, ya que no dispone de fertilizantes y tratamiento de plagas, por lo que espera solventar la necesidad con el préstamo.
Su aspiración es recibir una buena cosecha dentro de seis meses, que sus frutos sean sanos y de buen tamaño, ya que de esto depende para comercializarlo bien y que sus ingresos sean buenos.
texts.en:
Jorge is a 61-year-old man who lives in Jiquilisco in the Department of Usulután with his daughter. He is a small-scale experienced farmer. He farms his lands and uses the harvest for sales and for family use.

Jorge is requesting a loan to purchase supplies and to grow pipián (a squash known as ‘cushaw’ in the United States), as he doesn’t have fertilizers or pesticides. This is why he hopes to resolve this need with the loan.

He wants to have a good harvest within six months and wants his crops to be healthy and good-sized, as this determines if they sell well and if his earnings are good.

loans.use: To buy supplies, fertilizers and pest treatments to grow pipián

loans.name: Slayman

texts.en: Slayman is a 55 year-old married man and father of a single boy. Slayman has worked in construction since 1975.   He specializes in sanitary work.  He started a new small business and wants to improve it through a loan from Al Majmoua. His business is to curve iron sanitary pipes and sell them. He states that this work is going to be better from the moment he gets the suitable tools for it. Slayman deals with a lot of contractors who like his way of treating clients. He 's well known in the region and he's of a good reputation. Through the loan, Slayman will pay for his son's university fees and hopes he can see him as an important man in the future.

loans.use: To buy tools for his new business, and to pay for his son's university fees

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es: La Señora Alba Luz tiene la 39 años, su estado civil es acompañada, Doña Alba tiene 4 hijos menores de edad, sus propósitos son seguir manteniendo la atención de sus clientes y así mismo mejorar el nivel de calidad del pan que ella elabora. La actividad económica a la que se dedica es la venta y elaboración de rosquillas, cosa de horno entre otros, el negocio está ubicado en el reparto la resistencia. Inicio porque ella necesitaba proporcionar ingresos  a su familia, es entonces que decide establecer este medio de vida en su vivienda, aunque al principio no fue fácil realizar este tipo de trabajo, sin embargo Doña Alba aprovecho la oportunidad. Este financiamiento para la compra de harina, huevo, mantequilla moldes entre otras cosas.
texts.en: Alba Luz is 39 years old, and she has a partner and four young children. Her goal is to continue providing service to her customers and to improve the quality of the bread that she bakes. She works making and selling donuts and other baked goods. The business is located in an area she annexed from her home. She began because she needed to provide income for her family, then she decided to establish this way of earning a living in her home. Although it wasn't easy to do this sort of work in the beginning, Alba nonetheless took advantage of the opportunity. This loan will be used to buy flour, eggs, butter molds, and more.

loans.use: Business capital

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria de 61 años, es una mujer trabajadora que tiene 10 años siendo viuda. Con esfuerzo y dedicación ha podido surtir la mercadería que vende para tener ingresos y poder asegurar su vejez. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su ventas, vende zapatos, camisas, pantalones, bisutería de algunas marcas vendidas por catalogo. Trabaja en diferentes horarios ya que vende a crédito su mercadería. Para seguir con sus ventas y aumentarlas quiere comprar con el préstamo zapatillas, ropa, bisutería. En el futuro quiere continuar con su negocio para seguir asegurando sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Maria, 61, is a hardworking woman who has been a widow for 10 years.  With effort and dedication she has been able to stock her business with merchandise that she sells, so she can have an income and savings for her old age. 

She has a lot of ambition for her business.  She sells various brands of shoes, shirts, pants and jewelry from catalogs.  She works a variety of schedules, and she sells her merchandise on credit.  In order to continue with her business and increase her sales, she wants a loan to purchase sneakers, clothing and jewelry.  In the future she wants to keep her business going so that she can be assured of a continuous income.

loans.use: to buy sneakers, clothing and jewelry

loans.name: Jenny Lissette

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Dios Con Nosotros se reúne cada quince días en la ciudadela  el Florón  de la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital manabita conocida como la Ciudad del Valle por encontrarse rodeada de muchos cerros.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Jenny, tiene 22 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 2 años y seis meses. El marido es comerciante. Ella nació en Salinas pero hace 5 años se vino a vivir a esta linda ciudad y en ella formo su familia.

Ella es una gran ama de casa que para ayudar a su esposo realiza el crédito para el negocio de él, el cual se dedica  a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  venta es puerta a puerta y nos cuenta que le realizan muchos pedidos sus clientes y también va a vender a otras ciudades. Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00  hasta las 15h00, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería la va a comprar a Guayaquil.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace tres ciclos y le gusta porque con los créditos puede ayudar a su esposo y sentirse útil para el bien de su familia.
 
Su sueño es algún día tener su propio local comercial.
texts.en:
The communal bank Dios Con Nosotros [God is With Us] meets every two weeks in the Florón residential community in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí Province known as the City in the Valley because it is surrounded by many hills.

Here we meet Jenny, who is 22 and has a common-law marriage from which she has one son who is 2 and a half years old. Her husband runs a small business. She was born in Salinas, but 5 years ago she came to live in this lovely city and settled down to raise a family. She is a great housewife who wants to help her husband and is getting the loan for his business. 

He sells all types of clothes, door-to-door, and Jenny tells us that his customers place many orders with him, and that he also goes to other cities to sell. He works every day from 8 am until 3 pm. He sells on credit and collects payments every two weeks. He buys his merchandise in Guayaquil. 

This loan he's going to use to purchase more merchandise, including pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing. Jenny has been in the communal bank for three loan cycles and she likes it because she can help her husband through the loans and feel useful for the good of her family.  Her dream is to someday have her own shop.

loans.use: to purchase pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Angella

texts.en:
Angella N. lives in the Nakulabye neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has no children.  Angella has a bar.  She has been in this business for 5 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Angella sells her products at home, by wholesale and retail.

Angella has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin.

The main business challenges for Angella include defaulters and the rainy season because she works in a muddy area. Angella lives in a home that has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include rent and school fees.

loans.use: To buy more crates of beer and jerrycans of local gin

loans.name: Irma

texts.es:
La señora Irma G. tiene la edad de 47 años, solo primaria y esta casada, ella vive en la comunidad de El Jicaro esta comunidad se encuentra a 20 minutos de la vidriera y pertenece al municipio de Tierra Blanca en el estado de Veracruz.

Doña Irma nos platica que hace 8 años su esposo dejo de trabajar ya que lo pensionaron y de pension no le dan mucho asi que no le alcanzaba para cubrir con los gastos del hogar y platicando con su esposo decidieron iniciar a trabajar en la venta de carne de cerdo, ellos tienen una pequeña carniceria en la entrada a la comunidad en donde ademas de vender carne tambien venden  chicharrones, carnitas, tacos dorados y longaniza. 

ella nos platica que no solo vende sus productos para llevar y comer en la comodidad de su hogar, sino que tambien ha puesto una pequeñas mesas en su carniceria y a invertido en compra de refrescos para que sus clientes coman en su tienda si lo desean. 

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en la compra de cerdos, variedad de chiles, aceite, tomates, cebolla, especias y refrescos para poder hacer su venta de carne y comida.

ella desea en un futuro con sus ganancias ir agrandando su negocio para brindarle un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Irma G. is 47 years old.  She has an elementary school education, is married, and lives in the El Jicaro community, located 20 minutes from the glass plant, and part of Tierra Blanca, Veracruz.

Irma tells us that her husband retired eight years ago and began drawing his pension, but it is not very much and was not enough to cover the household expenses.  After discussing it with her husband, she decided to begin selling pork.  They have a small butcher shop on the outskirts of the community, where they also sell pork rinds, carnitas, fried tacos, and sausage.

She also tells us that they not only sell the items to go, but have also set up some tables and began selling soft drinks so that her customers can eat in the store if they want.

She needs this loan to invest in hogs, peppers, cooking oil, tomatoes, onions, spices, and soft drinks to prepare the meat and food.  She wants to expand her business with her earnings so that she can provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Marilu

texts.es: Marilu, de 45 años, es una mujer trabajadora y alegre, esta casada con Raúl, de 50 años, ambos tienen 3 hijos, pero solo viven con dos de ellos, Miguel de 26 y Elva de 18 años, ellos viven en su casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Chiras. Le gusta mucho mantenerse activa y ocupada, por ello se dedica a diversos oficios; desde preparar pan y pasteles que diariamente, seguido de la agricultura, donde es socia con una amiga y juntas cuidan sus siembran de arveja, maíz, habas y papa; hasta finalmente dedicarse a la ganadería en donde cría 5 carneros, 3 vacas y 4 chanchos; a los que alimenta, para luego vender su carne. Los pobladores de su pueblo la conocen de lo  trabajadora y comerciante que es, por ello acuden a ella para comprar la carne que expende. De esa manera obtiene buenas ganancias, tanto así que lo que tenía no le abastaba, por lo que tuvo que comprar animales de otra granja para beneficiar de su carne y cumplir la demanda que tiene. En adelante quiere abrir una pequeña carnicería donde sus clientes puedan comprar y elegir la cantidad de carne que necesita. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Progresistas de Chiras”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde se siente satisfecha de pertenecer a su banco comunal porqué todos ahí son como una gran familia. Marilu, invertirá el crédito en la compra de 9 kilos de chancho, 11 kilos de carnero; los cuales adicionará a la carne que ya posee para poder abastecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Marilú, 45, is a hard working, cheerful woman.  She’s married to Raúl, 50, and they have three children but only two of them live with them, Miguel, 26 and Elva, 18.  They live in their own house located in Chiras.

She likes to keep busy and occupied so she has several occupations from baking bread and cakes daily to farming which she does in partnership with a friend; together they care for their pea, corn, broad bean and potato crops.  Finally, she raises livestock.  She has 5 sheep, 3 cows and 4 pigs that she feeds to later sell their meat.

Residents of her town are aware of her work and of the sort of merchant she is and because of this come to her to buy the meat she sells.  She earns good profits this way so much so that what she had wasn’t enough so she had to buy animals from another farm to use their meat to meet customer demand.

She is a member of the “Progresistas de Chiras” communal bank and this is the second MFP loan.  She feels satisfied belonging to the communal bank because everyone there is like a big family.  

Marilú will invest the loan in the purchase of 9 kilos of pork and 11 kilos of mutton which she’ll add to the meat she already has in order to be able to supply her customers.

loans.use: to buy 9 kilos of pork and 11 kilos of mutton.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: Julio Cesar es soltero, tiene 27 años de edad, es maestro de educación física, se dedica a impartir enseñanza sobre curso de deportes y tambien es arbitro en las diferentes ramas deportivas, tiene 2 años de experiencia en esta profesion. Decide solicitar un préstamo que le servirá para la compra de una computadora para uso personal, ya que debido a la necesidad de tener su informacion a tiempo y ordenada, va a comprar este activo que le beneficiará mucho en su desepeño laboral, con el fin de mejorar su condición de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en: Julio Cesar is 27 years old and single.  He is a physical education teacher who teaches all types of sports and is also a referee for a variety of sporting events.  He has two years of experience in this profession.  He decided to request a loan to buy a computer for personal use, since he needs to have information in a timely and orderly fashion.  This purchase will benefit him a lot in carrying out his work, and will help him toward his goal of improving the living conditions for himself and for his family.

loans.use: to buy a computer

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. One of the children is still attending school. She has been running a clothing store since 2008. She only sells women's clothes. She has a good number of clients passing by her shop because she always presents the new clothes collections. Her business income is vitA. for her family; she is supportive of her husband. Today, she is requesting to borrow $1,200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to expand her store’s inventory with the new summer collection. She’s certain that the loan will help her diversify her merchandise selection. In the future, she is hoping to sell women's perfumes in her store.

loans.use: to purchase a new summer collection of clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This borrower is 37 years old.  She is married and has 1 child aged 7. In 2004, she established her provisions business. She started her business because she wanted to promote her well-being in life. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 850,000 every month. She would like a loan of Le 5,000,000 to buy larger quantities of assorted food items in bulk. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 300,000. In the future, she plans to build a house and open another shop. She is very determined and hardworking. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To pay for assorted provision items

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.es:
El Sr. Teodoro tiene 53 años y esta casado con la señora Nilda de 50 años, tienen cuatro hijos una mujer y tres varones, estudiando y trabajando actualmente.
Empezo como aprendiz cuando tenia 13 años desde entonces se dedica a la chaperia,  pintura y reparación de automóviles, actualmente cuenta con su propio taller donde repara todo tipo de automóviles. Comenta que ya que desde pequeño ha trabajado no teme a ningún reto. El se define como un hombre luchador, trabajador y muy responsable por sobre todo. Dice que le gustaria que sus hijos estudien y que terminen alguna carrera  en la Universidad ya que el no tuvo la misma suerte.
El solicita el credito para la compra de mas repuestos para los vehículos que repara, de esa forma no tiene que recurrir a proveedores muy caros.
texts.en:
Teodoro is 53 years old and married to 50 year-old Nilda.  They have four children: one daughter and three sons, who are currently in school.

Teodoro started working as an apprentice when he was 13 years old.  Since then he has been panel beating, painting and repairing cars.  He says that as he has been working since he was a boy, he doesn't fear any challenge.  He describes himself as a tenacious, hard-working and very responsible man.  He says that he would like his children to study and finish a university degree as he did not have that same opportunity.

Teodoro is requesting a loan to buy more spare parts for the vehicles that he repairs.  In this way, he will not have to buy from very expensive suppliers.

loans.use: to buy car parts

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a farmer in Nyamira and is also employed in a local tea factory. He has been practicing mixed farming for 7 years, selling his tea to the Kenya Tea Development Authority, while milk, maize, beans and bananas go to the local market.

David has requested a loan of 46,800 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. He says he will use the income to improve his family living standards and the milk to supplement the family meals. David is optimistic he will be able to buy more dairy cows and expand his farm by purchasing more acreage. David says marketing products and animal feeds are the challenges that need to be addressed for future growth of his farming business. He is looking forward to paying the loan to acquire more.

loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia de 39 años de edad, vive con su familia en su casa propia, la cual cuenta con sólo servicio de luz, ubicada  en la zona rural del departamento de Lambayeque.  Esta zona se caracteriza porla actividad agrícola, ganadera, artesana y turismo.

Alicia desde hace 2 años a instalado su negocio en su domicilio, donde vente todo tipo de útiles de oficina y también brinda servicio de fotocopias, es un negocio que no tiene mucha competencia en la zona donde vive, es conocida por sus vecinos, sus clientes mayormente son los escolares y con los ingresos que obtenga cubrirá sus necesidades diarias de su hogar.

Ha solicitado un préstamo  a Edpyme Alternativa de 2000 nuevos soles para comprar mercadería para abastecer su tienda para satisfacer la necesidad de sus clientes, al aumentar sus ventas podrá solventar su crédito otorgado, mejorando el nivel de vida de su familia.  Alicia es una persona de empuje y muy trabajadora con la intención de que su familia se supere y logre sus metas trazadas.
texts.en:
Alicia, 39, lives with her family in her own house which only has electricity and is located in a rural part of Lambayeque Department.  This zone is noted for farming, animal husbandry, crafts and tourism.

Alicia has had a home-based business for the last two years where she sells all sorts of office supplies; she also provides copying services.  It’s a business that does not have much competition in the area where she lives.  She is well known by her neighbors and her customers for the most part are students.  She uses income earned to cover her household’s daily needs.

She has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to buy merchandise to stock her store to meet customer demand.  Increasing sales will allow her to repay the loan she was granted while improving her family’s standard of living.  Alicia is a dynamic person who is very hardworking; her goal is that her family improves and reaches all the goals they set for themselves.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her business.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa lives in West Point. She is  38 years of age, married and has three children aged between 11 and 18. Her children are in school and live at home. Hawa's husband is a driver. Hawa received money from her husband to start her business. 
One of the problems Hawa faces in her business is that her business place is not ideal. She is requesting a loan to purchase rice, oil, pepper, bitter ball (a bitter green fruit) and okra for her business. She enjoys the buying side of her business. Her plans are to send her children to school and build a house and a shop.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil, pepper, bitter ball and okra.

loans.name: Jessica Belinda

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Jessica; tiene18 años de edad,  la socia es soltera; la socia trabaja en una lavandería, ella es estudiante y este año terminara la secundaria, la socia estudia y trabaja por lo que en esta ocasión desea un crédito ella requiere el préstamo para invertir en sus estudios, la socia terminara sus estudios secundarios, ella piensa preparase para dar el examen de ingreso al próximo año para la universidad y seguir una carrera profesional la socia dice que le gustaría estudiar turismo pero aun está en duda y por el momento ella seguirá trabajando para seguir manteniéndose. La socia solicita el prestamo para invertir en sus estudios.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the communal bank "CUSCO" which is located in the Huanchac District in the province and department of Cusco.

Jessica is 18, single and works at a laundromat.  She is also a student and will be finishing high school this year.  She is requesting a loan to pay for school expenses so she can graduate.  She wants to prepare for the college entrance exam and would like to study Tourism, but is still unsure at this point and must keep working to support herself.  The loan will be used to pay for her education.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To pay for tuition.

loans.name: Gulnazi

texts.en:
Gulnazi, 47, is from the village of Ninotsminda in the Kakheti region. She is married and lives with her husband, Malkhaz, and their 24 year old son. Gulnazi and Malkhaz are leading the family agricultural business. They own two milk cows and sell dairy products (mainly milk and yogurt) in the village. The family also grows maize on a 1.2 hectare piece of land, which is sold in the local market as well. 

Gulnazi has requested a loan for sowing wheat. She will use part of the loan to purchase the wheat and part to pay the workforce which will help them on the plot in the cultivation and sowing process.

Gulnazi will sell wheat locally and she will use this additional income for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase wheat for sowing and to pay the workforce which will help her on the plot.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.ru: Саломат получила хорошую прибыль и расширила свою деятельность, купила ксерокс. Сейчас вместо нее в дилерском центре работает ее брат. А сама Саломат занялась торговлей на рынке города Душанбе. Она арендует магазин, где продает ткани и набор для новорожденных. Она берет кредит для покупки тканей и парфюмерии.
texts.en: Salomat made a good profit and expanded her business, she bought a Xerox machine. Right now her brother works instead of her in the dealer center. Salomat now does sales on the market of Dushanbe. She rents out a store where she sells fabrics and kits for the newborns. She is taking out the loan to buy fabrics and perfumes.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and perfumes.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 35 years old and a married woman with seven children, five of whom are in school. She has a business of selling bananas in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for six years.

Margret requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan with the hopes of expanding her business. She will use the profits to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase more bananas to sell

loans.name: Komilchon

texts.ru: Комилчон молодой специалист по выращиванию сельхозкультур и откорма скота. Он женат, имеет двоих детей. Для содержания своей семьи он работает на земле и выращивает пшеницу. У него имеется крупный рогатый скот. После сбора пшеницы отходы целесообразно использовать для корма крупного рогатого скота. Комилчон хочет получить займ для покупки несколько голов крупного рогатого скота и семян пшеницы для посева. Он надеется получить кредит и обвешает целесообразно использовать его.
texts.en: Komilchon is a young specialist in growing agricultural crops and fattening up livestock.  He is married and has two children.  In order to support his family, he works on the land and grows wheat.  Komilchon also owns cattle.  After harvesting wheat, it is smart to use the waste to feed livestock.  Komilchon wants to obtain this loan to buy several heads of cattle and wheat seeds for sowing.  He hopes to get this loan and promises to use it accordingly.

loans.use: to buy cattle and wheat seeds

loans.name: Diego

texts.es: El Joven Diego se dedica a la confección de chalecos, chamarras y otras prendas de vestir que le soliciten, el negocio se encuentra ubicado el la ciudad del Alto de la Paz Bolivia, por la populosa zona de la 16 de julio, esta zona es conocida por ser comercial ya que los habitantes se dedican en su mayoría a la compra y venta de artículos de primera necesidad y otros que satisface la demanda de esta ciudad. El Joven Diego es soltero, por las noches estudia en la universidad publica, su mayor sueño es de concluir sus estudios profesionales y así servir a su país contribuyendo al progreso, para brindar un futuro mejor a su futura familia, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de un equipo de sonido para su uso personal.
texts.en:
Young Diego sews vests, jackets and any other articles of clothing he’s requested.  The business is located in the city of El Alto in La Paz, Bolivia, in the crowded 16 de Julio neighborhood.  This zone is noted for being commercial and its residents are for the most part merchants of staple items and other merchandise that meets the city’s demand.

Diego is single and is attending public university in the evening.  His greatest dream is to complete his professional studies to serve the nation contributing to its progress and to provide a better future for his future family.  

He will use the money he’s requesting to buy a sound system for his personal use.

loans.use: to buy sound equipment.

loans.name: Francoise

texts.en:
Francoise is 25 years old and is married with one child.  Francoise owns a business selling women's clothes.  She has five years in this business and the hours of her work are from 8am until 7pm every day except on Sunday. 

Francoise has requested a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company in order to purchase more women's clothes to sell.  With any profits, she will be able to save for her future and reinvest in her business.

loans.use: to purchase more women's clothes for resale.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and has five children.

Adel is a carpenter; in 2008 he decided to open his own workshop. He makes bedrooms and furniture. He has more than fifteen years' experience in this field, has a good reputation and is becoming well-known in his area.

He decided to apply for a $1800 loan in order to pay the annual rent for his workshop. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to pay the annual rent for his workshop

loans.name: Orlando

texts.en: Orlando is 59 years old, a laborious farmer in their community. Disregarding his age, he patiently works in the field. This is the family's primary source of income, where he gets the income used for their every day needs. This causes him to care a lot about his farming business. In fact, he is asking for a loan amount of PHP25,000 as additional funds to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, pesticides and fertilizers to improve his business. He wants to yield better crops through this loan as well as adding to his hard work and endurance. Hopefully, he will achieve his desired income so that he can improve his family's living standards and to save for their future use.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as corn seeds, pesticides and fertilizers.

loans.name: Fadme

texts.es: La señora Fadme trabaja como abogada consultora en uno de los Ministerios Públicos y su esposo es consultor independiente. El crédito lo requiere para pago de maestría en el área legal que es su profesión. Fadme es casada y tiene un hijo .Vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona  de Cota Cota de la Ciudad de La Paz. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito y por el carácter social-educativo es que se lo canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Fadme works as a consulting attorney for one of the public ministries and her husband is an independent consultant. The loan she is requesting will be used to pay for a Master’s degree in law since that is her profession. Fadme is married and has one child. She lives at her parents’ house in the District of Cota Cota in the city of La Paz.

This is the first time she has requested a loan. Due to her social character and her continuing education, her request is being referred to Kiva.

loans.use: to pay for a Master's degree in law.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali is a 24-year-old single man. He has owned a special tannour bread bakery since January 2011, having had seven years of experience in this field. Tannour bread is made in a clay oven called a tannour. This technique is still being used in some traditional bakeries, just like the one Ali owns, and that's what gives his business a special place among competitors. 

Ali is a hard worker, and he works his best to improve his business as much as he can. He plans to make a small happy family in the future, but today all he is looking forward to is expanding his business as much as possible. To do this, he has asked for Kiva partner Al Majmoua's help, requesting a loan in order to buy the necessary flour and diesel for his business at the special price he can get by paying his bills in cash.

Ali is planning to expand the business and to add a special menu to his business.

loans.use: To buy flour and diesel necessary for his business

loans.name: Vitaliy

texts.ru:
Виталий живет в селе Приветное. Он занимается сельским хозяйством вместе со своей семьей. У него есть жена и двое сыновей. На 45 сотках земли Виталий выращивает ранние овощи: 5 000 помидор, 20 000 кустов капусты, 10 000 лука, 15 000 перца. Огородничеством занимается уже 10 лет. На данный момент в хозяйство вложено около 60 000 гривен.  

Виталий и его семья живет за счет своего бизнеса. Чем больше средств они вкладывают в содержание теплиц и уход за урожаем, тем качественнее и ранее они получают свой урожай. Виталий обратился к КИВА за кредитом в размере 15 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить семена, пленку, удобрения, агроволокно, а также установить отопление в теплицах и покрыть транспортные расходы, связанные с бизнесом.  
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Vitaliy lives in the village Privetnoye. He works with agriculture together with his family. He has a wife and two sons. On his 45 acres of land Vitaliy grows vegetables: 5 000 tomatoes, 20 000 cabbage bushes, 10 000 onions and 15 000 peppers. 

Vitaliy has worked with vegetable farming for 10 years. Up until now he has invested around 60 000 hryvnia in the farm. He and his family live off their business. The more money they invest in the maintenance of greenhouses and care for crops, the better and earlier they get their crops. 

Vitaliy turned to Kiva for a loan in the amount of 15 000 hrvynia in order to buy seeds, tape, fertilizer, agricultural fabric (to cover plants to protect them from insects, prevent weeds etc), and also to install heating in the greenhouses and cover transportation costs associated with the business.

loans.use: to buy seeds, tape, fertilizer and agricultural fabric, and to install heating in the greenhouses and cover transportation costs associated with the business

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.en:
Narcisa is a 55-year-old, married woman with two children.  Her youngest child is 18 years old and still attends school.  Narcisa is a farmer in San Miguel, Bohol Province in the Philippines.  She has been growing and selling rice for twenty years.  Narcisa provides for her family with her farming income.  She works hard to support her family and send her child to school.

Narcisa has requested this loan to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs.  She hopes that her business will grow.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en: Cristina is a 32yrs old married and have two children,her husband is a carpenter.Cristina operating her business at exactly 10yrs,it is their source of income and the provider in their daily needs and the income of her husband is for the tuition of her two children.Cristina took a new loans because she wants her business become a one stop shop in her barangay and also to have a good business to cover their needs of her two children.Cristina improve their living through this business because she earn.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods for her sari-sari store

loans.name: Nicolás

texts.en:
In Monclova, Coahuila lives Mister Nicolas, a very hard working and responsible man. Some time ago he started his own business in repairing and selling jackets. He started by repairing two jackets and the client was pleased and started to recommend him to other people. Later he started to buy used jackets to repair and then sell them. He decided that it was better to start his own business than to keep working for the company where he worked because his earnings were greater and it permitted him to give his family a better quality of life.

He now requires a loan of $475, which will be put towards the purchase of a bulk of jackets to generate further earnings. Thanks to Mister Nicolas\' business they do not have to depend on but instead help their children that are now married and need their support. Do not leave them alone - they thank you.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer.

En Monclova, Coahuila vive Don Nicolás, un hombre muy trabajador, responsable y trabajador, hace tiempo que inició su propio negocio de reparación y venta de chaquetas. El comenzó reparando dos chaquetas y al cliente le gusto y empezaron a recomendarlo con más gente, después empezó a comprar chaquetas usadas para repararlas y posteriormente venderlas. Decidió que era mejor desarrollar esta actividad propia que seguir laborando en la empresa para la que trabajaba, pues esto le genera más ingresos y le permite brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

El ahora requiere de un préstamo de $475 DLLS, mismos que utilizará en la compra de un lote de chaquetas y con esto generará más ingresos. Gracias al negocio de Don Nicolás ellos no dependen se la ayuda que sus hijos, quienes ya están casados, eventualmente les brindan, ahora ellos necesitan de tu apoyo, no los dejes solos, ellos te lo agradecen.

loans.use: PURCHASE JACKETS

loans.name: Festus Che

texts.en:
Born in 1967, Festus is married and father of two boys and one girl. He has not forgotten when thieves visited him and when the Urban Council confiscated vehicles from his garage at a time he was greatly struggling to build it with loans from GHAPE. However, he decided to forge ahead in the belief that obstacles will always be there but life has to continue. Festus is a fourth-time borrower. From his three previous loans he provided mechanic services to car owners in his community. He is proud of owning a functioning garage.

Given a loan of $800, he plans to buy old cars and spare parts and service some of the old cars in his garage. He is convinced that he will succeed because of lessons from the past, the quality of his work, and the ever-increasing customers resulting from the bad roads. His dream is to expand his garage and provide apprenticeships to other young people.

He plans to pay loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Buying old cars and spare parts

loans.name: Boun

texts.en: Mrs. Boun K. L., 42 years old, is a mother of 4 children who are students, and lives in Siem Reap province, Cambodia. She and her husband (pictured here) raise ducks in their field and sell their eggs to a market. This couple has to get up early in the morning to feed the ducks and collect eggs for their wholesalers. With this business activity, K. L. typically makes about $10/day in revenue to supplement their household income. In order to increase their livestock and satisfy her clients' needs, K. L. hopes to use the loan to purchase ducks and feed. In the future, she is thinking about making more money to provide her family with a better quality of life and offer her children a high level of education.

loans.use: To purchase more ducks to raise in a field.

loans.name: Hai

texts.en: Mrs. Hai H., 32 years old, lives in Kampong Cham and earns a living selling fish and raising pigs.  She earns about $5/day from her business activities, and her husband (pictured here) earns $5/day as well working as a mechanic.  This income allows the couple to send their 3 young children to school, something they are very proud of.  This loan will be used for Mrs. Hai H. to purchase more pigs and build a pig pen to handle the animals.  She hopes to continue growing her business by buying more and more pigs.

loans.use: To purchase more pigs and to build a pig pen

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en:
Jacqueline, married, and mother of one child, is 31 years old. She is an ambitious woman. She owns a small gifts and perfumes shop in Bourj Hammoud, in the Northern Suburbs of Beirut.

Jacqueline has been a client of Al Majmoua for the past 2 years and used the 2 consecutive loans she received to increase her inventory. Jacqueline is very good in marketing and has excellent communication skills. She has a solid base of loyal clients, observes the market trends, and is able to answer her clients needs before they even ask.

Jacqueline wants to borrow $1,000 in order to buy new varieties of perfumes and some trendy but affordable pieces of jewelery to expand the inventory of her shop.
