loans.use: Purchase new fragrance bottles, "faux-bijou", small toys and gadgets for her gifts and perfumes shop

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina, age 46, lives in a 2-room house with her 4 daughters and 1 grand-daughter. Her husband left them several years ago, and her son is now in the army. Two years ago, Selina opened a business, “Masagese Grocery,” to support her family. At her store, Selina sells alcoholic beverages, sodas, cookies, and water. Each day, she sells about 50 bottles of beer at around 95 cents each and 50 bottles of soda at about 25 cents each. In a week, she earns a profit of around US$200, which she uses on school fees and to pay for inventory delivery.

Earlier this year, Selina took out a loan to increase the store's inventory and paid it back successfully. She now hopes to take out a bigger loan of US$275 for the same purpose. She belongs to the group Subira (Swahili for “patience”), which consists of 21 other members who keep each other accountable and help each other pay back their loans.

loans.use: Increase of inventory

loans.name: Romelia

texts.es:
Mrs. Romelia is a partner of the Communal Bank “The Mercies”, she has a juice store (sells juices and fruit extracts), her juices are sought after by the people of Carhuaz and visitors to the city. Her business is located at the central market in the Province of Carhuaz in the city of Ancash. With this loan of 1,200 soles, which will be paid off in 4 installments, she will buy 100 papaya, 50 pineapples, 1 sack of sugar, 20 units of Algarrobina (a Peruvian syrup), 10 liters of honey and a crate of milk. She is 55 years old, widowed and has 7 children, her income allows her to educate and better her family.

Translated from Spanish by Fallon Shields, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Romelia es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Mercedes”, tiene una juguería (venta jugos y extractos D. frutas), sus jugos son solicitados por los carhuacinos (pobladores D. la zona) y visitantes a dicha ciudad. Su negocio está ubicado en el mercado central D. la Provincia D. Carhuaz, Departamento D. Ancash. Con este préstamo D. S/ 1,200.00 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 cuotas, comprará un ciento D. plátanos D. isla y D. seda, 2 cajas D. manzana, 2 cajas D. naranja, 1 ciento D. papaya, medio ciento D. piña, 1 saco D. azúcar, 20 unidades D. algarrobina, 10 litros D. miel D. abeja y una caja D. leche. Ella tiene 55 años D. edad, es viuda y tiene 7 hijos, sus ingresos le permite educar y sacar adelante a su familia.

loans.use: The purchase of fruits for wholesale.  The purchase of supplies.

loans.name: Sulma's Group

texts.en:
Sulma, Miriam, and Katty have belonged to the community bank Kalllapanchik, which means “our force” in Quechua, less than six months. In their community bank they have learned to be responsible and punctual. They have also learned to value themselves and to be honest.

Sulma is 23; she lives with her partner and one-year-old child. Sulma rents a stand in the Nazarenas market where she sells vegetables. She has had this business for four months. With her new loan Sulma will begin to sell sandals.

Miriam is 24 and lives with her partner and two-year-old daughter. Miriam works with her husband driving a motorcycle taxi. Before this Miriam sold vegetables but stopped in order to spend more time with her daughter. Now that her daughter is older she has decided to start her vegetable business again. With her new loan she will travel to markets in the surrounding area and buy fruits which she will sell in the Nery Garcia market.

On the other hand, Katty is 19 and lives with her partner and four-year-old son. Katty rents space in the Jesus Nazareno neighborhood where she runs a beauty salon.

Sulma, Miriam, and Katty need loans of 400, 1000, and 200 soles (3 sole = $1), which will be invested in buying sandals, celery, squash, carrots, peaches, and tuna, a local fruit which comes from a cactus.

An important part of the community bank is the interest-earning savings account that each associate has. Zulma, Mariam, and Katty plan to use their savings to develop their business, buy a car, and in the case of an emergency. Their dreams are to own a home, to have a stable and successful business, and to give their children a good education.

loans.use: Sulma, Miriam, and Katty need loans of 400, 1000, and 200 soles (3 sole = $1), which will be invested in buying sandals, celery, squash, carrots, peaches, and tuna, a local fruit which comes from a cactus.

loans.name: Zulfu

texts.en:
Zulfu is married and has one child. He is 33 years old and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fizuli region. He has since settled in this Fizuli region in the Kayidish village, which is specifically built for IDPs.

He has five years of experience in this business of appliance sales. Now, he needs a loan of $950 to buy home appliances in order to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy home appliances

loans.name: Tania

texts.es:
Mrs. Tania belongs to the communal bank “Mujeres Perservantes 2” (the perserverant women) , located in the building “Los Unidos”, in the district of Yarina Cocha, in the department of Ucayali. She is 32 years and is the mother of 3 children and a husband.

Presently, she sells beauty products. She wakes up very early to take care of her children and perform her domestic duties. In the afternoons, she leaves her home to offer products to her customers.

With a loan of 1000 Soles, which she will repay in 4 months, she will invest one part in the purchase of beauty products (like lipsticks, colognes, perfumes, eye shadows, etc.), and she will invest the other part in fixing up her house.

Tania feels very happy because her business in growing and this brings her a felling of tranquility and also helps her to support her family.

Translated from Spanish by Gabe of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Tania pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Perseverantes 2, ubicado en el Asentamiento Humano Los Unidos Mz. C Lt. 2, del Distrito de Yarina Cocha del Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 32 años y es madre de 3 hijos, su esposo es counter,

En la actualidad ella vende productos de belleza, se levanta muy temprano para atender a sus hijos y realizar los quehaceres domésticos, y por las tardes se dedica a salir a ofrecer sus productos a sus clientas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1000 el cual será pagado en 4 meses, lo invertirá una parte en las compra de productos de belleza como labiales, colonias, talcos, perfumes, sombras, etc., y otra parte lo destinara para el arreglo de su casa.

Tania se siente muy contenta por que su negocio crece, y eso le brinda tranquilidad tanto económica como familiar.

loans.use: invest in beauty products

loans.name: Maria Patricia

texts.es:
. Maria Patricia is a physiotherapist and she works at a medical center from Monday through Friday. She has a young daughter who attends school and she is separated from her husband and the only person to generate an income for the family. She lives in the area of Miraflores in the town of La Paz. It is the second time she requests a loan and her credit history reports her as a number 1 client meaning that she has fulfilled her obligations repaying satisfactorily. The loan will be used to buy instruments for physiotherapy and thus Patricia will be able to become independent and set up her own medical center. Her work, responsibility, and desire to improve have given her the opportunity to gain admittance to this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Patricia es Fisioterapeuta y trabaja en un consultorio de lunes a viernes. Tiene una hija pequeña en edad escolar y esta separada de su esposo, es la única que genera ingresos en su familia. Su domicilio se encuentra ubicado en la zona de Miraflores de la ciudad de La Paz. Es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con cumplimiento bueno en el pago se su obligación. El crédito que solicita será utilizado para comprar instrumentos de Fisioterapia y así poder independizarse en su trabajo, y en el futuro instalar un consultorio. Su trabajo, responsabilidad y las ganas de superación le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito.

loans.use: Purchase instruments for physiotherapy to set up own medical center.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth G. is thirty six years old. She is married with three children. The children are currently in school.

Elizabeth trades in vegetables and sells commodities like tomatoes, pepper, garden eggs and onions. She is a very industrious woman who is able to combine her business and motherhood. Elizabeth thinks her business can grow better with the help of a loan. She would use the loan to buy increased stock of tomatoes, peppers, garden eggs and onions to serve her customers. She hopes to increase her income to support her children’s education.

She belongs to the community group called Shepherd Trust Group. In the group, members support each other help each othe repay the loans.

Joyce Mensah, Elizabeth’s sister, is in the photograph because Elizabeth had gone to take supply of goods when the photograph was taken.

loans.use: To buy increased stock of tomatoes, peppers, garden eggs and onions.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Mrs. Seng C., age 53, and her husband, Mr. Pin Pang, age 51, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 1981 and have 6 children: 5 sons and 1 daughter. Their daughter is a hairdresser at home. Of the other 5 sons, 4 of them are in school, and the oldest son helps in his father’s business.

Mrs. Seng has been selling mangoes for 5 years. She bought them from her villagers for resale at the market in Phnom Penh, while Mr. Pin has been in the business of recharging batteries and cleaning a motor shop for 3 years.

Now Mrs. Seng is requesting a loan of US$300 to rebuild a beauty salon for her daughter.

loans.use: To rebuild a beauty salon for her daughter

loans.name: Jhony Antonio

texts.es:
Jhonny Antonio is 28 years old. He works as a security guard and also, together with his wife, runs a clothing business. All of their work is motivated by the search for the best way to deal with their difficult economic situation.

Jhonny has a young son. With a lot of effort the couple pays for his education and they plan to continue doing so as long as they are able. Jhonny has been a security guard for 2 years and selling clothing for 1 year. They started the business with money the family had saved.

They would like to increase their inventory and will use this loan to buy women's and children's clothing, in order to offer a wider selection of products to their clients.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Jhonny Antonio tiene 28 años de edad se desempeña como guarda de seguridad, y también junto a su esposa administra un negocio de venta de ropa, todo esto en busca de poder sobrellevar la difícil situación económica.

Tiene un pequeño hijo al que con mucho esfuerzos le dan sus estudios y planean seguírselos dando mientras ellos puedan. Jhonny tiene 2 años de ser guarda de seguridad y un año de dedicarse a la venta de ropa. Empezaron el negocio con dinero ahorrado de la familia.

Desean aumentar el inventario de su negocio y con el préstamo comprará ropa de dama y niños para diversificar la oferta a sus clientes.

loans.use: To buy clothing for women and children

loans.name: Gladis Asunciona

texts.es:
Gladis is 49 years old and married. She started a degree in accounting, but left the program because she needed to take care of her young children. Gladis has two children who both work. She lives in San Pedro D. Lloc District, Pacasmayo Province in La Libertad state.

María started selling candies in a sales stand near Razuri school 14 years ago. The council was renting her the space, but later closed it because it wasn’t profitable. As Gladis is good at making and decorating cakes, she decided to start a business doing this, which has gone quite well. She currently has a sales stand at the San Pedro D. Lloc food market, where she not only sells cakes but also sells party decoration supplies. She also sells breakfast really early in the morning.

Thanks to a female friend, Gladis become a member of the Libertad [Freedom] Community Bank. She received an initial loan of 300 soles [about US $100], which she used to purchase cake decorations. With a loan of 1,200 soles [about US $ 425], which will be paid back in six months, Gladis plans to purchase tables, oven hood, blender and food mixer to improve her business selling breakfast. She will use any remaining funds to purchase technology for making decorations. Gladis hopes to learn how to make piñatas.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

La señora Gladis Asunciona tiene 49 años, está casada, estudió hasta II ciclo D. Contabilidad, no continuó estudiando porque sus hijos estaban pequeños y tenía que cuidarlos, tiene 2 hijos, los cuales trabajan, vive en el Distrito D. San Pedro D. Lloc en La Provincia D. Pacasmayo en el Departamento D. La Libertad.

La empresaria empezó hace 14 años vendiendo golosinas en un kiosco cerca al colegio Razuri, el concejo le alquiló el local, pero lo cerró porque no era rentable; como sabe preparar y decorar tortas se dedicó a este negocio en el cual le ha ido muy bien, actualmente tiene un puesto en el mercado D. abastos D. San Pedro D. Lloc donD. no solo venD. tortas sino también elabora y venD. adornos para fiestas D. todo tipo y además muy temprano, por la mañana venD. desayunos.

Gracias a una amiga ingresó al Banco Comunal “LIBERTAD” donD. recibió su primer préstamo D. S/. 300.00 con este dinero compró adornos en acrílico para tortas. Con el préstamo D. S/. 1200.00 que cancelará en un plazo D. 6 meses tiene pensado comprar mesas, campana extractora, licuadora, batidora, para implementar mejor el negocio D. la venta D. desayunos y si le alcanza tecno por para elaborar adornos. Ella sueña con aprender a elaborar piñatas.

loans.use: Purchase of tables, oven hood, blender, food mixer

location.town: San Pedro de Lloc - La Libertad

loans.name: Victor Eduardo

texts.es:
Victor se dedica a la cría de ganado vacuno, cuya producción de leche Comercializa a PIL Andina (Planta Industrializadota de Leche).
 
Vive. en la comunidad de Vilaque de la Provincia Los Andes del departamento de La Paz, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de La Paz.. Es casado y tiene tres hijos de 8, 4 y 2 años respectivamente.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la compra de  ganado de raza mejorada para incrementar su  producción y por lo tanto sus ingresos..
 
Es su segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le califica para otorgarle el préstamo
texts.en:
Victor raises cattle whose milk he sells to the PIL Andina milk plant.

He lives in the Vilaque de la Provincia Los Andes community in the state of La Paz, located two hours from the city of La Paz. He is married and has three children, 8, 4, and 2 years-old, respectively.

The loan will be allocated to the purchase of a better breed of cattle to increase his production and therefore his income.

This is his second loan with Impro, his completed evaluation qualifies him to be granted this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of Livestock

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El Sr. Fernando está solicitando un préstamo para poner un portón que le está haciendo falta a su casa y que esté más segura.

El Sr. Fernando nos comento que hace ya barios años tuvo un accidenté donD. lo atropellaron y quedo mal D. L. cintura y el trabajo lo pensiono ese es su ingreso D. el y D. un hijo D. 13 años que vive con el.

Fernando por los gastos del accidenté no le a podido hacer mejoras a su casa, y el está solicitando un préstamo $ 425.00 dlls para poner el portón a su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Fernando is asking for a loan to install a front door on his house to make it more secure. Fernanco tells us that a few years ago he had an accident where he was knocked down and now has a bad back and his work’s pension is his income to support his 13 year old son who lives with him. Fernando, because of the expenses of the accident, has not been able to make improvements on his home and he is asking for a loan of $425.00 to put a secure door on his home.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a secure front door

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en: Victoria O. is a 44-year-old widow and mother of five. Victoria sells provisions, foodstuffs and drinks from her shop. As a widow, her business has become her primary source of income. She needs the loan amount of 61,000 N to buy more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She expresses her gratitude to all Kiva lenders and LAPO Microfinance.

loans.use: To buy provisions, drinks, and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia O. sells drinks, body creams, and other provisions from her home. She requests a loan of $700 to purchase more drinks, body creams and provisions to sell. She is 48 years old and married with 5 children. All her children are all in school. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, provisions and body creams to sell

loans.name: Moen

texts.en: Mrs. Moen Y. was born in 1947 and she now lives in Kok Romeat village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who can make a little income growing rice because she owns a small piece of land to cultivate rice on. She now wants to expand her rice revenue so she decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy another piece of land to cultivate rice. She hopes to increase her rice revenue in this way. Mrs. Moen Y. is a widow with two children who are both employed in a garment factory.

loans.use: to add to her savings to buy a piece of land to cultivate rice on

loans.name: Valentina

texts.es:
Valentina  es socia del Bancomunal Luz de la Esperanza. 
Valentina Tiene 43 años, es separada, tiene dos hijos de 12 y 7 años, estudia en el colegio Ella es cuzqueña, ella empieza a trabajar desde los 16 años en diferentes oficios.
Estando ya casada trabajo en una  casa atendiendo un anciano, todo el día pero descuidada a sus hijos y tuvo que renunciar, y  decidió vender  sanwish en la puerta de su casa  por las noches de 7pm –11 pm, y por las mañanas estaba desocupada, un tío le propuso entrar en sociedad para vender menús ella  acepto el negocio y vende en el mercado modelo de villa el salvador.  

Desde que esta en Finca se siente más segura por que se siente respaldada por que encuentra orientación para su negocio, ha  logrado comprar  su carro sanwichero, una vitrina, y ampliar su negocio.
Necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles, para invertir en la compra de saco de papas, salchichas, aceite, platos descartadles.    
El sueño de Valentina es seguir trabajando y lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Valentina is a member of the Luz de la Esperanza Community Bank. Valentina is 43 years old, is separated, and has two children who are 12 and 7 years old and in school. She is a Cuzcan and she began working 16 years ago in different positions. When married, she worked in a home attending to an elderly person all day. However, she neglected her children and had to give up that job. She decided to sell sandwiches in the entry of her house at night from 7-11PM and in the mornings, she was unemployed. An uncle proposed that she go into town to sell her menus. She accepted the business and she sells in the model market of Villa El Salvador. Since being in Finca, she feels more secure since she feels supported since she finds guidance for her business. She has managed to buy a sandwich cart, a glass case, and to grow her business. She needs a loan of 1,200 soles to invest in the purchase of a bag of potatoes, sausages, oil, and disposable plates. Valentina's dream is to continue working and to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She needs a loan of 1,200 soles to invest in the purchase of a bag of potatoes, sausages, oil, and disposable plates.

loans.name: Mayra Lucía

texts.es:
MAYRA LUCIA, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras”, ubicado en el Jr. 7 de Junio N° 576, en L. ciudad de Pucallpa, distrito de Callería, tiene 22 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en una panadería, no tiene hijos.

El primer préstamo que recibió fue de Trescientos Nuevos Soles (S/. 300.00), compró teckno poor, cartulinas, grampas, ambiento su local, elL. confecciona piñatas, se compro una vitrina para mostrar sus confecciones, decora locales, fiestas infantiles.

Con este préstamo de S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, compró artículos para fiestas infantiles, juguetes, peluches, gorros, sorpresas, globos, serpentinas, etc. y decora locales para todo acontecimiento.

Agradece a ManueL. Ramos por confiar en elL. a pesar de ser muy joven pero es responsable, por darle L. oportunidad de administrar su propio negocio gracias a sus préstamos.
texts.en:
MAYRA LUCIA belongs to the community bank “Las Triunfadoras” (The Winners) located in Jr. 7 de Junio N° 576, in the city Pucallpa, district of Callería. She is 22 years old, her husband works in a bread store, and she doesn’t have any children. The first loan that she received was 300 Nuevos Soles (S/. 300.00). She bought Teckno Poor items, cards, staplers. In her store, she makes piñatas, and she bought a cabinet to show off her handiwork, that decorates places and children’s parties. With this loan of S/. 1,500.00 Nuevos Soles, she would buy articles for children’s parties, toys, stuffed toys, caps, surprises, balloons, toy snakes, etc., and decorate places for any kind of event. Thanks to ManueL. Ramos for having confidence in her since she is very young, but she is responsible, for the opportunity to administer her own business thanks to the loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jessica Kaminsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy items for kids' parties

loans.name: Martha Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Martha S. se dedica en el Mercado la Terminal de León a su negocio de venta de ropa y bolsos desde hace 10 largos años habiéndose destacado como una muy buena comerciante por lograr mantener su núcleo familiar y brindar excelente atención a sus clientes.

Hoy en día ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito para la compra de la mercadería debido a que la requiere en estos momentos y por esto espera muy confiadamente que su crédito será otorgado sin ningún problema.
texts.en:
Martha S. sells clothing and bags in the Terminal de León Market. For ten years she has stood out as a good businesswoman in order to support her immediate family and provide excellent service to her customers. Nowadays she has turned to Ceprodel to receive a loan in order to buy merchandise that she currently needs. She confidently hopes that her loan will be granted.

Translated from Spanish by Shanti Singh, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Merchandise

loans.name: Roger

texts.es:
Roger tiene un vehiculo que trabaja como taxi, actualmente es chofer asalariado y maneja una minibús pequeño ya que el vehiculo de su propiedad está en mal estado y  no cuenta con los recursos suficientes para poder pagar los gastos de reparación.
Vive en la zona de Pampahasi de la Ciudad de La Paz, en casa de sus padres.
El crédito será destinado para mantenimiento completo del vehiculo.
Es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, con este crédito tendrá la oportunidad de mejorar sus ingresos y podrá trabajar con su vehiculo propio
texts.en:
Roger has a vehicle that he uses as a taxi, but currently is working as a salaried chauffeur and drives a mini bus since his own vehicle is in bad shape and he does not have the sufficient resources to pay the repair costs for it. Roger lives in a house with his parents in the Pampahasi area of La Paz. The requested loan will be used to completely repair his vehicle. This is the first time that Roger is asking for a loan with IMPRO, and with this loan he will have the opportunity to increase his income and to work as a taxi driver using his own vehicle.

Translated from Spanish by Julia Kaplan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Costs of repairing his taxi

loans.name: Félicienne

texts.fr:
H. Félicienne est née vers 1965 à Porto-Novo, Capitale Administrative et Politique du Bénin; dans le Département de l'Ouémé au Sud du Bénin. Félicienne est mariée et mère de quatre enfants. Félicienne passe de ménage en ménage pour collecter des bidons et bouteilles vides qu'elle revend au niveau de sa boutique. Mais depuis quelques temps, Félicienne a délaissé cette activité au profit de la vente des fournitures de bureau et des fournitures scolaires. En plus de la boutique de fournitures, Félicienne a également une boutique de produits lubrifiants à sékandji, dans la Commune de Sèmè Kpodji. Félicienne a déjà eu deux crédits avec ALIDé; crédits qu'elle a bien remboursé et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Aujourd'hui, Félicienne sollicite un troisième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de commerce afin de mieux faire fasse à la demande de ses clients. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
Félicienne H. was born around 1965 in Porto-Novo, administrative and political capital of Bénin, in the Department of the Ouémé in the south of Bénin. Félicienne is married and mother of 4 children. She used to go from household to household to collect big cans and empty bottles which she re-sold in her shop. However, for some time now, Félicienne has left off this business in favor of selling office and school supplies. Besides her little shop with office and school supplies, Félicienne also has a little shop with lubricants in Sékandji, in the Commune of Sèmè Kpodji.

Félicienne has already had two loans from ALIDé which she reimbursed correctly and used to raise the level of her businesses. Today, Félicienne is requesting a third loan to bolster her working capital so as to better deal with the demand of her customers.

The significance of ALIDé in the local language of Bénin, Fon, is "there is always a pathway for the poorest of the poor". Bénin is a small country in West Africa next door to Nigeria; the GDP per inhabitant stands at US$ 1,500.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of mobile phone rechargeable cards, cartons of notebooks, and jugs of lubricants

loans.name: Fumilola

texts.en: Fumilola is 28 years old. She is married to A., who is a carpenter, and they have three children. She sells drinks and foodstuffs. Fumilola is requesting a loan of N100,000 to purchase more drinks to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks to sell

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Fatou G. est âgée de vingt sept ans (27) ans, elle gère  depuis un an une mercerie au niveau du marché central de Mbour. Elle a démarré son commerce avec un prêt qu’un ami  lui a accordé qu’elle a fini de rembourser  avec les revenus tirés de son commerce. Pour  renforcer son fonds de commerce et maintenir sa clientèle, Fatou  sollicite un prêt de l’IMCEC. Elle est célibataire  et vive avec ses parents qu’elle aide pour la dépense quotidienne.
texts.en:
Fatou Guey, age 27, has been managing a sewing supplies shop for a year at the central marketplace of Mbour. She started this business with a loan from a friend that she repaid with the revenues from her business. To boost her working capital and to maintain her customers, Fatou is requesting a loan from IMCEC. She is unmarried and lives with her parents, whom she helps by covering their day-to-day expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Ana Dayssi

texts.es: Ana Dayssi S. M. vive en Zacatecoluca ubicado en el departamento de la Paz, Dayssi tiene 24 años de edad está acompañada con Willian y tienen un pequeño niño de 3 añitos llamado igual que su padre Willian. La pequeña familia vive en casa de madre de Willian padre. Dayssi  se dedica a su negocio que es una tienda con productos de consumo diario y por las tardes hace venta de tortillas, Dayssi solicita este crédito, porque quiere surtir su tienda con variedad de productos que sus clientes le demandan.
texts.en:
Ana Dayssi S. Mejia lives in Zacatecoluca located in the department of La Paz, Dayssi is 24 years old and lives with her couple Willian, and their 3 year old son, named after his father, Willian. The small family lives at Dayssi's mother in law's house. Dayssi works at her grocery store and in the afternoon she prepares tortillas, Dayssi requests this credit, because she needs to supply her store with a variety of products that her clients demand.

Translated from Spanish by Nina Delgado, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products

loans.name: Marvic

texts.en:
Marvic B. is from the city of Oroquieta City. She is 43 years old. Marvic is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marvic owns & operates a "sari-sari" (general) store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Marvic has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 6000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Marvic joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marvic has successfully repaid a previous loan from PMPC. Marvic is requesting a new loan of 12000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Marvic from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About PMPC:Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To puchase additional stock

loans.name: Reina

texts.es:
La señora Reina, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Nuestra Sra. D. Guadalupe”, Distrito D. Bellavista, Provincia D. Bellavista, Departamento D. San Martín. Es casada, tiene 40 años y es madre D. 03 hijos, ya independientes.

Ante la necesidad D. aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por ella misma, emprendió un pequeño  negocio D. venta D. abarrotes con su primer crédito D. S/. 300.00 obteniendo muy buenos resultados desD. un inicio por la calidad D. sus productos, sus precios cómodos y la buena atención al cliente.
En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donD. sus principales clientes son los vecinos D. su barrio.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 2,200.00, comprará  más productos para surtir su negocio como arroz y azúcar en kilos, huevos en javas,  insumos para el aseo personal y limpieza del hogar, gaseosas en paquetes, golosinas  y otros productos para mantener contenta a su clientela.

Hoy se siente muy feliz D. la labor y servicio que brinda y agradece a Manuela Ramos, por apoyar a personas como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas familias y mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Reina belongs to the Our Lady of Guadalupe Communal Bank, Bellavista district, Bellavista province, San Martín department. She is married, 40 years old, and the mother to 3 grown children. Upon needing to add to her family’s household income, she began a small business selling groceries all by herself with a loan for S/.300.00 soles. She was successful from the start because of the quality of her products, her attractive prices, and good customer service. Today she continues this same business located in her own home, where her primary customers are her neighbors. With this loan for S/.2,200.00 she will buy more products to stock her store such as kilos of rice and sugar, crates of eggs, personal care products and household cleaning products, soda pop, candy, and other products to keep her customers happy. Today she is very happy with the work and service she provides and she is grateful to Manuela Ramos for supporting people such as herself who wish to work and get ahead. She hopes to continue on for a long time and help many families and women entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products to stock her business

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace M. is divorced and has four dependents. She has received schooling through senior high school.

Grace sells fresh fish in Elmina, which she has done since 2006. She uses her income to pay school fees and bills. She will use the loan to purchase more fish for resale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Grace plans to save and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more fish for resale

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
José is a member of the Purple Christ communal bank. He is married, 57 years-old, and has 5 children, three of which live with him and two of which are married. 

José works as a taxi driver but has recently started a new business selling accessories for parlor games. He sells chalk, gloves, and cases for billiards. He also does minor repairs on tables and pool cues. José says that since he joined FINCA he has learned to be responsible with loans and to value clients. 

José needs a loan of 2,000 soles to buy carpentry machinery to make more accessories and repairs. His dream is expand his business to sell sports accessories to stores and eventually become a distributor.

loans.use: buy carpentry machinery to make more accessories and repairs

loans.name: Keal

texts.en: Keal P., 52, has a lot of experience in making rattan furniture.  She produces and sells her furniture to traders directly from her family home. She typically generates around $5 USD a day from her business and shares her income to meet her family’s needs. She is married to Eoun, 55, who is a local carpenter. Four of their children are married and the other two are school-age children. Keal P. would like a loan for business capital. She will use half of the loan for her husband as an investment in his carpentry business, and with the rest of loan she will buy more raw materials to make furniture.

loans.use: For carpentry and furniture making

loans.name: Roosevelt's Group

texts.en:
New Connection is a group of five borrowers led by Roosevelt B., who is 46 years old and married with six children. They range in age from five to twenty years old and are enrolled in school at levels from kindergarten to tenth grade. B. also cares for two siblings.

B. is a high school graduate but because he never had the means of attending a university, he decided to go into business. He lives in Congo Town, Monrovia, Liberia. Congo Town is a mixed community of poor and middle class Liberians.

B.’s business is footwear. He buys wholesale and sells retail to residents of downtown Monrovia, Liberia. He has been 
running this business for more than nine years and believes the key to success in business is serving your customers with good products, and that is just what B. has been doing.

B. is able to provide for his family with the income from this business and wants to expand his business to the level of owning a store. He needs this loan to purchase more footwear at wholesale prices and sell at retail to acquire more profits. He dreams of giving his children a better education so that they can fit into society.

loans.use: To purchase more footwear to sell.

loans.name: God Is Able Group

texts.en:
God Is Able is a group of five borrowers led by Matinah D. who is 29 years old. She is a single mother of three children aged 1 to 9 years old and their educational levels  kindergarten-2nd grade. Matinah also cares for two siblings.

Matinah is a 12th grade student but also does business to support she and her children in order to continue education. She and her family lives in Banjour but she works in the Dualla market, a big market where farmers brings their goods from out of town to sell. It is situated north of Monrovia, the capital of Liberia.

Matinah's business is selling chicken and spare-ribs in the Dualla market. She has been running this business for five years and gives appreciation to the business for taking care of she and her family; providing a more comfortable life for them.

Because Matinah keeps her business place clean and neat, customers are attracted by that. She needs this loan in order to purchase more new goods to serve her customers.

Matinah is hoping to become an importer of different kinds of goods. She dreams of building a house for herself and her family.

loans.use: to purchase more new goods to serve her customers.

loans.name: Edward A.

texts.en: Edward A. K. was born in 1961 in Bombali district, northern Sierra Leone. Edward is married and he is a father of three lovely children who are attending primary schools. Edward is seeking a loan of SLL 1,000,000 for the first time from Kiva through SMT. Edward will use this loan to pay school fees and other school related charges for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Prum E., 34, lives in the province of Pursat, Cambodia, where she owns a plot of land next to her house, growing both rice and vegetables. She can plant her crops twice a year, and she was taught this by her grandfather.

Besides her farm work, she raises pigs and also takes time to catch fish with her husband for extra revenue. She is currently a good mother of two school-aged children.

Prum E. will be using her first loan to purchase a cow which she will use to help reduce her hard labor in the farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a cow for agricultural purposes

loans.name: Bilikisu

texts.en: Bilikisu is 30 years and married with a child. She is a focused, hard worker. She sells groceries and medicines at retail prices to her customers. She hopes to own a super market in the future. She lives in Ogbomoso, Oyo state, Nigeria. She has been in this business for five years. S. hopes for a loan of 50,000 NGN to buy more groceries and medicines to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more groceries and medicines to sell

loans.name: Fernando

texts.es:
El Sr. Fernando Guzmán Vía  tiene 20 años de una familia de escasos recursos económicos y recientemente a formado su hogar con Mirley Minosca Guardia que ahora es su esposa, el Sr. Fernando trabaja como ayudante de carpintería y su esposa se dedica a la venta de ropas en el mercado de Chimore.  

El Sr. Fernando vive en la zona Naranjal de la ciudad de Cochabamba, en un cuarto en alquiler juntamente con su esposa, ya que actualmente no cuenta con una casa propia, así que no tiene garantía de un inmueble propio u otros, por eso para ellos fue difícil obtener préstamo de otros bancos, solo el Cidre tuvo la iniciativa de darle la mano otorgándole un crédito con la tasa de interés más baja,  el crédito lo destinara para aumentar su capital en la venta de ropas de su esposa.  

El Sr. Fernando Guzmán Vía  nos cuenta que su mayor deseo es tener su propio taller de carpintería, así podrá tener sus propios clientes para los trabajos de carpintería, de este modo ahorrar dinero, posteriormente comprarse un terreno donde podrá construir su casa para su familia.
texts.en:
Fernando Guzmán Vía, 20, is from a family that has scarce economic resources. He recently formed a home with Mirley Minosca Guardia, who is now his wife. Fernando works as a carpenter’s helper. His wife sells clothes in the Chimore market. Fernando lives in the Naranjal area of the city of Cochabamba in a rented room with his wife. They currently do not have their own house. Because he does not have the guarantee of his own property or other things, it was hard for them to get a loan from other banks. Only Cidre helped them by giving them a loan with lower interest. The loan is to increase the capital in his wife’s clothing sales. Fernando Guzmán Vía tells us that his biggest desire is to have his own carpentry shop. That way he would be able to have his own customers for his carpentry work. In this manner he would save money. Later he would buy a piece of land where he could build a house for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy wholesale clothes to sell at retail

loans.name: Espiritu Santo Group

texts.es:
Marco M. de aproximadamente 35 años, se dedica junto a su esposa a la elaboración de cera para piso, utilizando keresone, gasolina y parafina, de éstos el más difícil de conseguir es el último (parafina) se tiene que comprar por cantidad, sino no lo venden para lo cual necesitan el préstamo, ofrecen sus productos a diferentes empresas como bancos, entidades financieras, oficinas y otros. Ellos tienen esperanza de hacer crecer su negocio y que tenga muchos frutos.
Las demás integrantes del grupo Espíritu Santo que pertenecen al Centro Focal Los Andes cuentan con diversas actividades económicas de producción, comercialización y servicio.
texts.en:
Marcos M., who is approximately 35 years old, together with his wife, manufactures floor wax using kerosene, gasoline and paraffin. Paraffin is the most difficult to get of these ingredients; it must be purchased in bulk or it will be sold and unavailable. This is why they need financing. They sell their product to various businesses like banks, financial institutions, offices, and others. They hope to see their business grow and that it will yield many fruits. The other members of the Espíritu Santo group that are members of the Los Andes Focal Center have other commercial, production and service lines of work.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials (paraffin) and merchandise.

loans.name: Rosa Marina

texts.es: Rosa Marina M. A. de 55 años de edad, reside en Tonacatepeque, departamento de San Salvador. Su grupo familiar esta conformado por su esposo el cual trabaja como albañil y así mismo como agricultor, tres hijos y un nieto. Ella posee una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad, como sopas, embutidos, leche, crema y otros productos más. Rosa es una señora muy trabajadora la cual cuenta con muy buena reputación por parte de sus vecinos ya que siempre se ha esforzado por ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar y por trabajar arduamente por sus hijos, dos de los cuales ayudan a su padre en el cultivo de maíz. Rosa solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir la tienda con todo lo necesario para poder mejorar sus ventas y de esta manera obtener mayores ganancias.
texts.en:
Rosa Marina M. A. is 55 years old. She lives with her husband, three children and a grandson in Tonacatepeque, San Salvador. Her husband is a bricklayer and a farmer. She owns a general store where she sells basic products, such as soups, sausages, milk, cream and others. Rosa is a hardworking lady who has a great reputation with her neighbors. She has made a great effort to help her husband with the household expenses and to work hard for her children, two of which help their dad growing corn. Rosa is requesting a loan to buy merchandise for her store hoping to improve her sales and obtain better profits.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her general store.

loans.name: Armando

texts.es:
Armando tiene 47 años, es un padre de familia dedicado y vive al lado de su esposa y sus 2 hijos. 
Hace 5 años tomó la decisión de crear su propia fuente de ingresos, instalando una tienda de abarrotes que con el tiempo ha crecido y hoy es un minimarket. Debido a la gran variedad de los productos que ofrece se ha ganado la preferencia de la clientela, siendo la buena atención el valor agregado que brinda en su establecimiento. 
Armando y su esposa atienden desde muy temprano y durante todo el día, de esa manera logran alcanzar el éxito de su negocio. Su deseo a futuro es tener una distribuidora de productos alimenticios.

Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, ella es una persona responsable que ha demostrado gran habilidad para trabajar en equipo junto a sus compañeros de banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita será utilizado en la compra de más mercadería en productos comestibles envasados, como conservas de fruta y pescado; además de detergentes.
texts.en:
Armando is 47 years old. He is a dedicated father and lives with his wife and two children. 5 years ago he made the decision to create his own source of income by starting a grocery store. With time it has grown and today it is a minimarket. Due to the wide variety of products he offers, he has won over the customers. The service is the added value his establishment offers. Armando and his wife start work very early and work all day long. This way they are able to attain success with their business. His wish for the future is to have a food product distribution. This is the second time that he has had a loan with MFP. He is a responsable person who has demonstrated a great ability to work on a team together with his fellow communal bank members. The money that he is asking for now will be used for the purchase of more packaged food product merchandise, such as fruit and fish preserves, as well as detergent.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase merchandise

loans.name: Kosowoa

texts.en: Kosowoa N. sells cement, charcoal and hardware products in Lomé, Togo. She is married and has 3 children. Mrs. N. has over ten years of experience in this field. She opened her business in 1998 and is now asking for her fourth loan from WAGES. She will use a third of this loan to replenish her stock of hardware products and use the remainder to purchase charcoal for resale.

loans.use: Purchase of charcoal and hardware

loans.name: La Estrella Flat Group

texts.es:
ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA LA ESTRELLA FLAT PORQUE SE CONSIDERAN EN UNAS PERSONAS QUE SI LOGRAN LO QUE SE PROPONGAN VAN A LLEGAR HASTA LA  ESTRELLA MAS BRILLANTE. LAS SIETE PERSONAS DEL GRUPO Y SUS ACTIVIDADES SON MARICELA T. VENTA DE REFRESCO, POLLO, JUANA C. VENDE TAMALES, MARIA DE LOS ANGELES VENDE REFRESCO Y UN POCO DE ABARROTES, MARGARITA N. VA A VENDER BIRRIA, ADRIANA BETZABEL VENDE COLCHAS, MARIA C. BISUTERIA Y JENY L. VENDE ROPA.


LA SRA. MARIA DE LOS ANGELES ESTA CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS. LA SRA. QUIERE  AGRANDAR SU NEGOCIO Y PONER UNA TIENDITA YA QUE EN DONDE VENDE ES AFUERA DE SU CASA Y POR AHÍ NO HAY TIENDAS CERCA Y A SI ELLA SE PODRIA SUSTRIR MEJOR Y OBTENER MAS GANANCIAS.  CON ESTE CREDITO VA A COMPRAR REFRESCO, JABON, HUEVO, AZUCAR, ETC. SU META EN UN FUTURO ES DARLE UNA MEJOR VIDA A SUS HIJOS  Y A SI PODERLOS APOYAR PARA QUE SEAN UNOS PROFECIONALES.


HASTA  AHORA ELLA SE SIENTE MUY CONTENTA CON SU GRUPO YA QUE TODAS SABEN RESPONDER ANTE CUALQUIER SITUACION QUE SE LES PRESENTE  Y APOYARSE COMO EL GRUPO QUE SON.  DA GRACIAS A KIVA Y FUNDACION REALIDAD POR VOLVER A CONFIAR EN ELLAS Y DARLES DE NUEVO UN CREDITO Y DICEN QUE NO LOS VAN A DEFRAUDAR.
texts.en:
This group is called “La Estrella Flat” because the members believe if people achieve what they set out to do, then they will shine like the brightest star. The seven members of this group and their business activities are listed below:

• Maricela T. sells soft drinks and chicken. • Juana C. sells tamales. • Maria de los Angeles sells soft drinks and a few groceries. • Margarita N. plans to sell beer. • Adriana Betzabel sells bedspreads. • Maria C. sells costume jewelry. • Jeny L. sells clothing.

Sra. Maria de los Angeles is married and has three children. She wants to expand her business and open a small store that is away from her house. Since there are no other stores in the area, she wants to keep her business well-stocked so that she can generate the most income. With this loan, she will buy soft drinks, soap, eggs, sugar, and other items. Her goals for the future are to provide a better life for her children and support them so that they can become professionals.

So far, Maria is happy to be with a group that knows how to respond to any situation that presents itself. As a unit, the members are supportive of one another. She thanks Kiva and Fundación Realidad for trusting them again by providing a new loan. They say they will not disappoint anyone.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase soft drinks, soap, eggs, sugar, and other items

loans.name: Pol

texts.en: Mrs. Pol A. is a 50-year-old merchandise trader. She has a store in the market where she stores many sets of grocery inventory to sell. She sells items such as cooking ingredients, plastic goods and canned goods. Almost of her clients are middlemen who buy her products to retail in their village. Pol A. is married to Touch Bori, age 50, who assists her in the business. The family has three school-aged kids who are dependent on their income. Pol A. wants to accumulate a larger amount of inventory but she has no capital to make that possible. So, she decided to seek a loan from Kiva’s field partner, HKL. She will buy different types of plastic goods and cooking ingredients for her store. (Mrs. Pol A. was busy at her business activity when the photo taken, so her husband is pictured instead.)

loans.use: To buy different types of plastic goods and cooking ingredients for her store.

loans.name: Ouch

texts.en: Ouch D., age 27, is married and resides with his child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia. He has a young child. He operates his motorbike as a driver, earning an income of USD 7 per day to help cover the family expenses. His wife is a recycler, earning an income of USD 8 per day. His wife always travels throughout the city to buy and find recyclable material. D. is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to purchase a trailer and more recyclable materials to expand his wife business. This is his first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: To buy a trailer and more recyclable materials

loans.name: Martin Ismael

texts.es:
El Joven Martin Ismael S. es casado y con una carga familiar de 3 niños varones que están edad escolar, él es trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 8 años desempeñándose como recolector en el tren de aseo, además cabe mencionar que el habita en una comunidad llamada Villa Dolores y que a 5 km de ella es donde alquila tierras para sembrar, ya que aparte de su trabajo para la Alcaldía él se dedica a la Agricultura.
El joven ha obtenido con Ceprodel 6 créditos, desde el año 2006 se convirtió en cliente de Ceprodel, los cuales ha utilizado para invertirlos en la siembra Arroz y frijoles
texts.en:
El Joven Martin Ismael S. es casado y con una carga familiar de 3 niños varones que están edad escolar, él es trabajador de la Alcaldía Municipal de Chichigalpa desde hace 8 años desempeñándose como recolector en el tren de aseo, además cabe mencionar que el habita en una comunidad llamada Villa Dolores y que a 5 km de ella es donde alquila tierras para sembrar, ya que aparte de su trabajo para la Alcaldía él se dedica a la Agricultura. El joven ha obtenido con Ceprodel 6 créditos, desde el año 2006 se convirtió en cliente de Ceprodel, los cuales ha utilizado para invertirlos en la siembra Arroz y frijoles

Translated from Spanish by Alex J, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Gastos Personales (Pago de Alquiler de tierras y Preparación de Tierras).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy sugar, cooking fat and maize flour

loans.name: Yelena

texts.en:
Yelena is married with two grown children. She sells bed linens and sheets, as well as blankets in the central marketplace of her hometown of Novomoskovsk. Yelena owns a big vending facility in this market, which is located in a busy spot where hundreds of potential customers pass by every day. She has been in this business for two years. Currently, she has 30,000 Grivnyas worth of inventory. Her profit amounts to 4,500 Grivnyas.

Yelena is requesting a loan of 5,000 Grivnyas to increase assorted merchandise she offers for sale. She believes financial assistance will help her grow her business and generate additional income as a result. Yelena's grandson has leukemia and needs expensive medication. Yelena invests a portion of her profit in treatment of her little grandson. She is a great optimist and tries to live on the brighter side of life.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This entrepreneur is 40 years old and married. She is a seamstress. She will use this loan to purchase an embroidery machine and cloth. She has been doing domestic sewing for more than 10 years. She’s a skilled woman in this area of business. All of her neighbors ask her to sew their clothes. The price of her sewing is reasonable, so many clients wish to go to her. She possesses a high reputation in the district. She is planing to develop her business in the future. With the the income from her business, she can help her husband with the family's living expenses.

loans.use: To buy an embroidery machine and cloth

loans.name: Ailen

texts.en:
Ailen A. is a 33-year old married woman who supports her family by operating 2 business ventures:  a General Store and Farming. She lives in Prk. Maligaya, Barangay Malingin, Bago City, Negros Occidental.  

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2005 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and farming businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable.  She now earns an average income of PHP7,000. Ailen is now borrowing PHP 28,000 so that she can buy more fertilizer and inventory for the general store.  

This will be her 14th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP25,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey towards economic freedom. Ailen aspires to elevate her family's living conditions and to ensure their future well-being by following the  Dungganon way. 

About NWTF:  In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional Working Capital

loans.name: Maria Juana

texts.es:
La Señoras. María P. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Amistad, vive en la parroquia de Cumbe la misma que se caracteriza por sus paisajes, su gente se dedica  a la agricultura y ganadería, mucha de su población ha migrado a la ciudad y también ha a varios lugares del mundo en busca de una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias.

Nuestra socia tiene 72 años de edad, es viuda hace 35 años,  logro construir  en su juventud su casa la misma que es pequeña, vive solo con una hija quien es madre soltera y le ayuda para los gastos de la casa.

La Señora. María se dedica a la cría de pollos, chanchos y cuyes los que vende en su comunidad, también se dedica a la agricultura y sus productos son para el consumo de su hogar.

Es nuestra socia hace 3 años y los créditos le han beneficiado para su negocio,  su nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de más pollos, chanchos y en su alimento.

Su sueño es seguir conservando su salud para poder trabajar.
texts.en:
Ms. María P. is a member of the communal bank Nueva Amistad. She lives in the parish of Cumbe, which is characterized by it's landscapes. The people there work in agriculture and cattle. Much of its population has immigrated to the city and to different places in the world seeking a better quality of life for their families. Our member is 72 years old and has been a widow for 35 years. In her youth she was able to build a small house. She lives alone with a daughter who is a single mother and who helps with household expenses. María raisies chickens, pigs and guinea pigs, which she sells in the community. She also works in agriculture and her products are for home consumption. She has been a member for 3 years and the loans have benefitted her business. Her new loan will be used to buy more chickens, pigs and their feed. Her dream is to continue to stay healthy to be able to work.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs, chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Edy Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Eddy Antonio C. García es padre  de familia  de seis hijos tres de ellos  se encuentra en edad escolar.
El préstamo solicitado es para  utilizarlo en la compra de medicamento y gasto de la operación de su esposa.
Don Eddy dice  que toda la plata  que ha trabajado  con Ceprodel  la ha utilizado en el mejoramiento de su casa de habitación, y ha mejorando su hogar de acuerdo a sus posibilidades de sus ingresos y los prestamos brindados.
texts.en:
Eddy Antonio C. García is the father of six children, three of whom are of school age. He is requesting a loan to use the funds to buy medications and to pay for an operation for his wife. Eddy says that he has used all of the funds he has received from Ceprodel to improve his house; he has improved his home in accordance with the opportunities provided by his income and the loans offered to him.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying medications and paying for an operation for his wife

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying jewelry

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buying tools for his auto workshop

loans.name: Oyunsuren

texts.en:
Oyunsuren D. lives with her mother, husband and two children in an apartment in the Chigeltey district of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband runs a taxi service to support his family. Her two children attend a secondary school. Oyunsuren is a salesperson and started her business by selling shoes and clothes in 2007 in the Bumbugur market, one of the main markes in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. However, her business had not proven too successful so she decided to start trading a grocery products like floor, rice and sugar in the Bars Market, Ulaanbaatar's biggest grocery market, in April, 2010. 

Oyunsuren is a very hardworking and  intelligent person. She is requesting a 1,300,000 MNT loan to grow her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more floor, rice and suger

loans.name: Mabel

texts.en:
Mabel B. is from Barangay 5, Tangub City. She is 20 years old and single. To make a living, she owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products such as shampoo, lotion, first aid medicine, canned goods and snacks in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Mabel joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan  from GDMPC. 

Mabel is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her 4th loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Stella

texts.en: Stella T. is currently in the business of selling clothes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock more clothes to sell.  She is 25 years old and is married to a husband who is a driver. She has two children and her children do not go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her clothing sales business.

loans.use: Stock more clothes to sell

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
Juana es una madre D. D. familia D. 40 años D. edad que resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en el sector San Nicolás, una zona rural del distrito D. Zaña, un distrito conocido a nivel regional por sus costumbres y danzas D. origen afro – peruano, se encuentra ubicado a cuarenta minutos D. la ciudad D.  Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace diez años a la comercialización D. animales menores. Ella adquiere animales a sus vecinos para criarlos y engordarlos. Cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los venD. a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona o los comercializa en una feria que toma lugar una vez por semana en el vecino distrito D. Cayaltí. Los ingresos que percibe D. esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. los gastos familiares.

Juana desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más animales para aumentar su nivel D. ventas y percibir más ganancias, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.

Juana es una mujer tranquila y entregada a su trabajo. Las personas que le conocen le consideran una persona honrada y confiable.
texts.en:
Juana is the mother of a family, she is 40 year sold and she lives together with her husband and their children in the community of San Nicolas, a rural region in the district of Zana. The district is regionally known for its customs and their Afro-Peruvian dances. It is located forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

For the past ten years she has been raising livestock. She acquires livestock from her neighbors to raise them. When they have reached a certain level in the development she sells them to merchants who visit the region or she sells them in country fairs once per week in the neighboring city of Cayatli. The profits she earns will be used to cover the family's expenses.

Juana wishes to expand her business with the purchase of more livestock, wishing to see an improvement in the sales and in her earnings. She has requests a first time loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1000 nuevos soles to meet her objective. 

Juana is a calm person who is very devoted to her work. Those who know her consider her to be an honest and trustworthy person.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 41 años, es una madre de familia muy noble y amigable, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus hijos. El negocio al que se dedica Sonia, es la venta de gaseosas y cervezas, actividad que lo realiza junto al taller de mecánica donde trabaja su esposo. Es así que se levanta temprano, para tener listo el almuerzo, que luego es llevado a su negocio, en donde ofrece estos platillos mediante previo pedido. Es esta su rutina y le va muy bien por lo que se siente muy contenta realizando su actividad. Lo que más le gusta de su negocio, es llevar su cuenta en orden, anotando las ventas y compras de cada día. Es por eso que esta segura de la rentabilidad de este negocio, y espera con el tiempo instalar su negocio en su casa, de ese modo estar pendiente de sus hijos. Es su 16avo crédito con MFP y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas como lo venia haciendo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy activa y pendiente de las reuniones que realizan. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará más cajas de cervezas y gaseosas para tener su negocio mas abastecido de este producto.
texts.en:
41-year old Sonia is a fine friendly woman who lives in her own house with her husband and children. She earns her living by selling soft drinks and beer near the workshop where her husband works. 

Sonia gets up early to prepare food which she then takes with her to her place of work. She sells these previously-ordered meals. It’s a job that is going well and she feels happy doing it. Sonia most enjoys keeping the accounts in order, noting sales and purchases each day. This way she knows if the business is turning a profit. One day she hopes to run the business from her home so she can spend more time with her children.

This is Sonia’s 16th loan with Kiva partner MFP, and she promises to make the repayments punctually as she always has done in the past. In her community bank she is a very active member and participates in the meetings. With the loan she will buy more cases of beer and soft drinks so her business is better stocked.

loans.use: to buy more cases of beer and soft drinks

loans.name: Hands Together Ii Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Hands Together II” group. They are small-scale businesspeople based in Waterloo, a small-town in western Sierra Leone where “Shine on Sierra Leone” partnered with SMT to start a branch. This is the first loan these entrepreneurs are accessing from SMT/Kiva lenders. With this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more profit and, consequently, improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Hawa K.. Hawa is 27. She was born in Yeleh village but she is currently residing in Waterloo together with her husband and three children. Her husband is a driver and her children are attending both primary and secondary schools, respectively. For five years now, Hawa has been selling slippers, toothpaste, toothbrushes, body lotions, etc. With this loan, will buy the above-mentioned items at wholesale to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy slippers, toothpaste, toothbrushes, body lotions, etc. at wholesale to add to her business

loans.name: Abbass

texts.en:
Abbass is a 38-year-old married man and is a father to three kids. Abbass has been selling numerous useful things such as combs, nails, hammers, etc. for three years. He doesn’t own a shop or a car, he uses a taxi to sell his products. 

Abbass is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a Renault RAPID car necessary for his business.  Abbass has a good reputation.  He’s also a smart businessman. He hopes to expand his business to wholesale in the future.

loans.use: To buy car for business

loans.name: Fabian

texts.es: Fabián, de 40 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Isabel de 34 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente Fabián a logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañana se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a su cacao, café y coca, los cuales posteriormente venderá en la ciudad de San Francisco, ya que es ahí donde obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es que puede disfrutar de la libertad de laborar en sus verdes campos, lleva 24 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra todo el día, sin que le quede mucho tiempo para realizar otras actividades. Para más adelante, espera poder comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar su producción. Este es el sexto crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo de su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesto a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es un socio muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy respetado. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono e insecticidas para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Fabián is 40 years old.  He is a very modest and hard-working man who lives in his own home together with his wife, 34 year-old Isabel, and his four beloved children for whom he would like to provide a better quality of life.

Through hard work, Fabián has managed to give his crops a good start.  Every morning he gets up very early to irrigate and care for his cacao, coffee and coca crops which he will later sell in the city of San Francisco since that is where he obtains the best prices for his products.  What Fabián most likes about his work is that he can enjoy the freedom of working in his green fields.  He has been in this business for 24 years and he considers the most difficult part of his work to be the fact that he has to work on his land all day long without having much time left to do anything else.  

In the future, Fabián hopes to be able to buy more land to increase his production.  This is his sixth loan from MFP.  He knows that this loan will help him quite a bit in making progress in his business which is why he is prepared to make all his repayments on time.  He is a very responsible member of his community bank which means he is very well respected.  Fabián will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles he is requesting to buy manure and insecticides for his crops.

loans.use: To buy manure and insecticides

loans.name: Tsetsgee

texts.en:
Tsetsgee M., 49 years old, is a married women who lives with her husband and two children in the Songino-Hairhan district of Ulaanbaatar. Her husband is a driver, and her two sons operate taxis, too.

Since 1995, Tsetsgee began selling meat in the Harhorin local market. Her business is stable and she is currently making 350,000 MNT a month. She continues to make progress and has since gained a lot of experience.

Tsetsgee is a woman of integrity and says, “I’m planning to buy a new car for my son’s business.” She is requesting a 2,300,000 MNT loan to buy four cows for their meat as well as to increase her working capital.

loans.use: To buy four cows for their meat

loans.name: Yanaptasiñani Group

texts.es:
La Banca Comunal “YANAPTASIÑANI” es un grupo de 7 mujeres y u1 varon que han decidido unirse para recibir crédito, capacitación y atención en salud,  serán parte del centro focal de Juan Pablo II, ellos están iniciando su primer ciclo.

Cada una de las socias tiene negocio propio, de servicio, producción o comercio. Entre ellos tenemos: pensión, venta de dulces y refresco, tienda de barrio, chofer, venta de CD´s, venta de productos de Belleza, venta de fruta.

Para su organización, la B. C. Yanaptasiñani cuenta con una mesa directiva integrada por una presidenta, la señora  Naty, una tesorera, la señora  Nancy y una secretaria de actas, la señora  Rosa.

La  Presidenta, la señora  Naty vive con su esposo y sus tres hijos (los tres hijos ya han conformado su hogar) la señora Naty tiene desde hace cinco años una tienda de abarrotes, también vende huevo, gaseosas.  Sin embargo, ella comenta que antes contaba con una pequeña tienda en su domicilio y estuvo con ella durante quince años, hasta que se decidió por abrir una tienda en un lugar más comercial.

La señora Naty atiende el negocio desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 11 de la noche, con la ayuda de su hija.

El préstamo solicitado por la señora Naty fue por Bs.2000.- y será destinado para la compra de huevo.

La señora Naty indica que esta es su primera experiencia como socia de Pro Mujer,  cuando se le consulta que es lo que le atrae de la institución, ella responde “participar en el grupo”.
texts.en:
The “YANAPTASIÑANI” communal bank is a group of seven women and one man who have decided to join together to get loans, training and health care. They will be part of the Juan Pablo II central office. They are starting their first cycle.

Each one of the members has their own business, in service, production, or merchandise. Among them, they are: a guesthouse; a candy and drinks sales business; a corner store; a driver; a CD sales business; a beauty product business; and a fruit sales business.
For its organization, the Yanaptasiñani community bank has a board of directors made up of a president (Mrs. Naty), a treasurer (Mrs. Nancy), and a secretary (Mrs. Rosa).

The president, Mrs Naty, lives with her husband and three children.  Naty has had a grocery store for five years, and she also sells eggs and pop. She tells us that she once had a small store in her home for fifteen years, until she decided to open a store in a more commercial area.

Naty tends to her business from 6:00 am until 11:00 pm, with her daughter's help.

The loan Naty requested is for 2000 Bs--and it will be used for the purchase of eggs.

Naty says that this is her first experience as a Pro Mujer client. When asked what attracts her to the institution, she responded "participating in the group".

loans.use: the purchase of eggs

loans.name: María

texts.es:
María pertenece al banco comunal “Bannen” perteneciente a la ciudad de Lota. Ella se dedica a la confección y venta de tejidos a máquina en su misma casa, desde hace 20 años. Sus 2 hijas también trabajan con ella en este negocio.  Tiene como cliente fijo un colegio en donde entrega tejidos para los alumnos y muchos clientes particulares. Además María vende ropa de mujer.
Con este préstamo, María viajará a Santiago (capital de Chile) a comprar mercadería, es decir: lanas, hilos y ropa de mujer de verano.
Su sueño es comprar una máquina automática de tejido y una máquina semi industrial para  aumentar de esta manera su producción y alcanzar a más clientes.
María vive con sus 2 hijas y su esposo.
Para María los préstamos de Fondo Esperanza han sido un apoyo que le han permitido crecer en su negocio, ya que ha comprado algunas máquinas necesarias para sus tejidos y gracias a sus ganancias ha hecho arreglos en su casa.
Lota significa en mapudungun, idioma de nuestros indígenas mapuches, "pequeño lugarejo”. Es una comuna costera ubicada cerca de la ciudad de Concepción al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Lota es célebre por sus grandes yacimientos carboníferos muy ligados a la historia y desarrollo económico de Chile, así como por sus trabajadores de la minería subterránea, cuyas difíciles condiciones de vida fueron descritas por el escritor chileno Baldomero Lillo en su libro "Subterra".
texts.en:
María belongs to the "Bannen" community bank which is located in the town of Lota.  Her business is making and selling knitted garments.  She makes her products by machine in her own home.  She has been in this business for 20 years and her two daughters also work with her in the business.  One of her regular customers is a school to which she delivers knitted clothes for the students and she has many private customers.  María also sells women's clothes.

With this loan, María will travel to Santiago (the capital of Chile) to buy merchandise: yarn, threads and women's summer clothes.  Her dream is to buy an automatic knitting machine and a semi-industrial machine to increase her production and reach more customers.  María lives with her two daughters and her husband.

Fondo Esperanza's loans have helped support María and enabled her to grow in her business since she has used them to buy necessary machines for making her knitted products.  Thanks to the profits she has made, she has also been able to make repairs to her home.

Lota means 'small hamlet' in Mapudungun (the language of our indigenous Mapuche people).  It is a coastal town located near the city of Concepción, in the south of Chile, in Bíobío region.  Lota is famous for its large coalfields which are very much linked to Chile's history and economic development.  It is also known for the workers in its underground mining industry whose difficult living conditions were described by the Chilean writer Baldomero Lillo in his book "Subterra" (Below Ground).

loans.use: To buy merchandise: yarn, threads and clothes

loans.name: Sabohat

texts.en: A. Sabohat is 45 years old, married and has one child. Sabohat’s business is sewing national women’s dresses. Eight years ago, she started offering her services as a seamstress to her neighbors and acquaintances. She does this work with only one sewing machine right now. She sells finished clothes in the market. Fortunately, the good service that Sabohat offers, and the good materials she uses, have helped her to expand her small factory. As a result of a large number of orders, she needs a loan for different kinds of fabrics so she may fill the orders. Sabohat thanks you for your trust and support. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics

loans.name: Monica Liliana

texts.es:
Madre cabeza de familia de 2 hijos, trabaja como profesional de belleza y hace domicilios para arreglo de uñas y cabello, adicionalmente trabaja en un almacén donde vende diferentes productos textiles.

Mónica necesita comprar mercancía para tener mucha mas oferta de productos para sus clientes y así sus ingresos aumentaran y la calidad de vida de su familia será mucho mejor.
texts.en:
Monica is a mother and head of a family of 2 children.  She works as a beauty professional and makes house calls to do nails and hair.  In addition, she works in a department store where she sells different textile products.
