Monica needs to buy merchandise in order to offer her customers more products and thereby increase her income.  Then her family's quality of life will be much better.

loans.use: BUYING BEAUTY CARE MERCHANDISE TO SELL

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” COMUZONE III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Benedicta; la socia tiene 58 años D. edad, casada y tiene 5 hijos; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio D. baños turcos (saunas) ella trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo en este negocio que llevan años sacándolo adelante, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con muchas ganas D. salir adelante, esta es la única actividad que realiza la socia la cual le lleva bastante tiempo en organizar todo comprando e implementando cada vez que necesita su negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra D. toallas, sandalias, shampus, jaboncillos entre otras cosas más que necesita para ponerlo en alquiler en su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en:
This is Benedicta.  She is a member of the communal bank, Comuzone III, which is located in the District of Cusco, pertaining to the Province and the Department of Cusco.

She is 58 years old, married, and has 5 children.  She works daily at her sauna business, which she co-operates with her husband.  She is a very cheerful person, with a great desire to move ahead.  This is her main job and it takes her a large amount of time to organize everything, buying and implementing everything that her business needs.

She is seeking a loan to purchase towels, sandals, shampoos, and little soaps that she needs to have available at her business.

She is happy about the credit and she promises to fulfill all of her payments.

loans.use: To purchase towels, sandals, shampoo, and little soaps that she needs to make available at her business.

loans.name: Ricardo

texts.es:
Ricardo T. tiene 27 años de edad, está casado con la señora Linet Calizaya, tienen una hija pequeña a la cual cuidan con mucho cariño y dedicación, ellos viven en el barrio de Esmeralda sud que se encuentra cerca de la  localidad de Sacaba del departamento de Cochabamba. Ricardo es albañil de profesión, él trabaja todos los días desde muy temprano y debido a las circunstancias de su trabajo sufre un gran desgaste físico pero ello no le impide que colabore a su querida esposa en las obligaciones del hogar. 

Ricardo quiere el préstamo para que compre una cocina grande con la cual su esposa pueda preparar hamburguesas y luego venderlas por las tardes y noches aprovechando que cerca de su casa hay un colegio el cual es un mercado seguro. Ricardo está muy agradecido con la gente que por medio de Kiva le puede dar la oportunidad de contar con mejores medios de producción para que pueda incrementar los ingresos familiares y así consiga un mejor estilo de vida.

Ricardo entre sus planes futuros planea sacar un nuevo préstamo para que pueda comprar un vehículo para toda su  familia.
texts.en:
Ricardo T. is 27-year-old man who is married to Linet Calizaya. They have a young daughter, whom they look after with much affection and dedication. They live in the Esmeralda Sud neighborhood, located near the Sacaba locality in the department of Cochabamba. Ricardo works as a bricklayer, working every day from the early hours of the morning. Because of his work conditions, he is physically worn out, but this does not prevent him from collaborating with his beloved wife with the housework.

Ricardo wants this loan to purchase a big stove for his wife so that she can make hamburgers and sell them in the afternoon and evening, taking advantage of the fact that they live close to a school--a definite market. Ricardo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, who can give him the opportunity to obtain better means of production so that he can increase the family income, thus obtaining a better lifestyle.

Ricardo plans to obtain a new loan in the future so that he can purchase a vehicle for the whole family.

loans.use: to purchase a stove and start food business.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice N. is 28 years old and lives in the town of Kibuli in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has two children.  One of her children is currently in school.  Alice has a drug shop, which she has had for five years.         

To help expand her business, Alice has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more medicine for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Alice hopes to generate greater profits and sometimes buy food for the family.  In the future, Alice hopes to expand her drug shop business.

loans.use: to purchase more medicine for resale.

loans.name: Eulalia

texts.es: Eulalia, natural del distrito de Palmapampa, tiene 33 años, es una mujer sociable y trabajadora, vive en su propia casa junto a su esposo Félix de 39 años y sus 4 queridos hijos, quienes son el impulso de todos sus esfuerzos. Los verdes campos del poblado de Palmapampa, ubicado en la selva tropical del departamento de Ayacucho, han sido en la vida de Eulalia un lugar muy agradable para trabajar, desde muy pequeña sus padres le enseñaron esta labor y ahora ella tiene sus propias tierras en las que trabaja con mucho esmero y sacrificio. Hoy cultiva cacao, café y plátano; en total posee 04 hectáreas de terreno. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus tierras, ya que así siente que los meses de arduo trabajo le brindan la calidad de sus frutos. Lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus cultivos desde su comunidad de Palmapampa  hasta los centros de acopio situado en la ciudad de San Francisco. Con el tiempo espera juntar el dinero suficiente para comprar nuevas tierras. Este es su tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene la responsabilidad de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y está dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia que pone el orden a todo el grupo. Con el crédito solicitado comprará madera para cercar los flancos de su vivienda ya que las maderas anteriores están deterioradas
texts.en: Eulalia is originally from the district of Palmapampa, she is 33 years old and is a sociable and hardworking woman. She lives in her own home with her husband, Felix who is 39 years old and their 4 beloved children who provide the drive for all of their efforts. The green fields of the Palmapampa town are located in a tropical jungle of the Ayacucho department; the area has made Eulalia’s work life a very pleasant one. From a very young age her parents taught her to work the fields which she now does on her own land and works with a lot of care and sacrifice. Today she grows cocoa, coffee and plantains; she owns 4 hectares of land. What Eulalia enjoys most about her work is harvesting her fields since she feels that months of hard work give her the quality of her work. She has worked in this field for 15 years and says that the most difficult aspect of her work is hauling her crops from her Palmapampa community to the collecting centers in the city of San Francisco. Eulalia hopes in the future to get enough money to buy new land. This is her third loan with MFP and knows that she has a responsibility in paying all of her quotas on time and is willing to do it. In her communal bank, she is a member that provides order to the group. With the loan she will buy lumber to fence in the sides of her home since the previous wood is deteriorated.

loans.use: buy lumber to fence in her home.

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yessica tiene 21 años de edad,  vive con su hija en un caserío llamado Pasabar los Mayanga, donde no cuentan con servicios básicos.  Está ubicado en el distrito de Olmos a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  

Yessica se dedica a comercializar todo tipo de ropa en general. Ella ofrece su producto a sus familiares y a las personas de su comunidad, en algunas oportunidades también vende en los caseríos aledaños. 
Esta actividad es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su hogar y se vale de ella para solventar sus gastos diarios.

Yessica desea adquirir mas mercadería de temporada para ampliar  su negocio pues durante estos meses la demanda de prendas de vestir aumenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 700 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.

Yessica es una joven bastante trabajadora y empeñosa, las personas que le conocen admiran sus ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
texts.en:
Yessica is 21 years old and lives with her daughter in a small village called Pasabar los Mayanga.  She does not have basic services.  Her home is located in Olmos district, two hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Yessica sells all kinds of clothes.  She offers her products for sale to her family members and people in her community.  On some occasions, she also sells in neighboring villages.

This business is very helpful as far as her household finances are concerned and covers her daily expenses.

Yessica would like to acquire more seasonal merchandise to expand her business over these coming months when demand for clothes increases.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 700 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa which will help her to achieve her goal.

Yessica is a hard-working and driven young woman.  People who know her admire her desire to get ahead and make progress.

loans.use: to acquire seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Ninosca

texts.es: Ninosca tiene 46 años, vive con sus 4 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más D. 10 años se dedica a L. crianza y venta D. cerdos, del mismo se dedica al cultivo D. papa y maíz. ElL. en compañía D. sus hijos ejecutan estás labores, que es indispensable para su sustento diario.  El establo que posee se encuentra dentro D. su casa, en el que diariamente se encarga D. su alimentación y procurar aumentar L. cantidad que tiene. Para elL., lo considera bastante rentable, L. venta D. cada animal tiene un precio muy alto, por ello desea intensificarse en su crianza. Por otro lado, trabaja cocinando para un restaurantes turísticos, así tiene un ingreso extra. En adelante desea tener mayor cantidad D. cerdos en su establo. Este será su crédito número 9 con MFP,  reconoce que el pertenecer a un banco comunal  le ha servido para mejorar su actividad a L. vez que admira L. solidaridad D. cada uno D. sus integrantes, por lo que renueva su compromiso D. seguir en su banco comunal siendo puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en L. compra D. sacos D. abono porque en esta oportunidad sembrará alfalfa que le servirá para alimentar a sus animales.
texts.en:
Ninosca, 46, lives with her four children in her own house.  For over ten years she’s been raising pigs to sell; she also raises corn and potatoes.  She does these chores, which are indispensable for her daily support, with help from her children.  Her stable is located in her house and she daily takes care of feeding and trying to increase the number she has.  For her, it’s quite profitable; the sale price of each animal is very high and this is why she wants to increase their number.  Additionally, she earns extra income working as a cook at a tourist restaurant.  In the future, she’d like to have a larger number of pigs in her stable.

This will be loan #9 with MFP.  She recognizes that being part of a communal bank has been very helpful for her to improve her business.  She admires the solidarity of each of its members so she renews her commitment to continue in the communal bank being very punctual with her payments.  

She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of manure because on this occasion she will plant alfalfa that will serve as animal feed.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en: Nelia, 54 years of age, is married and mother of 3 children. She is engaged in the livestock business, hog-raising. She has been in this business for almost 15 years. Her net income is 13,000 PHP, and she's asking for a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase additional livestock feed to supplement her hogs. She hopes to continue to avail loans and to achieve her dreams for her children, through patience and hard work.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This is a 35-year-old businesswoman.  She is married, and has 4 children aged 16, 13, 10 and 7 years. In 2006, she established her plastic slippers business. She began her business because she wants to be independent and be able to provide a livelihood for her family. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 700,000 SLL (~$163) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL. She requires this loan in order to buy more assorted plastic slippers for her business. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 200,000 SLL (~$47). 

In the future, she plans to own a bigger shop, build a house and educate her children. The persistent increase in the prices of goods is her major business challenge.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic slippers for her business.

loans.name: Susy

texts.es: Susy tiene 21 años; vive con su esposo Moisés y su hijo Jean Piere en casa de su madre, ubicada en el caserío de San Juan de la libertad. Como mujer de campo se dedica a la agricultura, su madre le enseñó todo lo necesario para poder emprender sus propios cultivos, pero necesitaba el apoyo financiero. Hace poco recibió una invitación para ser parte de un banco comunal, es por ello que comenzó a trabajar desde hace un año con MFP. A pesar de tener 3 años de experiencia en la siembra de papa de todas las variedades, le va muy bien en la comercialización, su principal ventaja. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder pasar la mayor parte de su tiempo con su familia; ya que recibe el consejo de su padre con quien siembra en sociedad. En esta campaña agrícola está segura que cosechará gran cantidad de papa. Y con la venta que negociará en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, está segura que podrá ahorrar un poco más para obtener su propio terreno agrícola y así mejorar los ingresos económicos de su casa, para poder ahorrar y en el futuro construir su propia casa. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “capital semillera”, y este es el segundo crédito con MFP, donde espera lograr sus objetivos con la ayuda de su banco comunal, además de comprometerse a cumplir puntualmente con sus cuotas. Susy de obtener su apoyo, invertirá el dinero solicitado en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico para distribuirlos en su próxima siembra de papa de la variedad “Yungay”.
texts.en:
21-year old Susy lives with her husband Moisés and their son Jean Piere in her mother’s house which is located in the village of San Juan de la Libertad. As a woman living in the country, she earns her living through farming. Her mother taught her all that was necessary to tend her own fields but she needed a loan.

A short while ago Susy received an invitation to be part of a community bank, and she began working with Kiva partner MFP a year ago. Her main advantage is three years’ experience growing all kinds of potatoes, so her business is going well. What she most enjoys about her work is the chance to spend a lot of her time with her family; she works alongside her father who gives her advice. 

She is sure that this season she will have a good potato harvest. In addition, because of the sales she has negotiated with the wholesale market in the town of Tarma, she is certain that she will be able to save a little more so that she can buy her own piece of land to farm. She would then earn more money and be able to save enough to build her own home.

Susy belongs to the Capital Semillera Community Bank, and this is her second loan with MFP. She expects to reach her goals with the help of her community bank, and as well she promises to make the repayments punctually. Once she has obtained the loan, she will use the money to buy several bags of organic fertilizer to spread on her next crop of Yungay potatoes.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.fr: Alphonse est salarie, il  est marie, il a  de 57 ans, il a 11 enfants de son charge entre 9 ans et 30 ans et il est né au Rwanda. Son niveau d’éducation est la licence en Théologie. C’est son troisième cycle de prêt avec ACB.  Il va acheter des ciments, peintures pour  renouveler  sa maison, et payer la main d’œuvre. Sa stratégie pour la croissance de l’affaire est  la construction d’une belle maison remplit des conditions exige par le plan directeur de sa  ville. Dans l’avenir il voudrait construire d’autre maison destine à louer et payer le frais de scolarité pour ses enfants.
texts.en: Alphonse is salaried, married, and 57 years old. He has eleven children to support, ranging in age from 9 to 30. He was born in Rwanda and has a degree in theology. This loan cycle is his third one with ACB. He is going to buy cement and some paint to renovate his house and to pay for labor. His strategy for growth is to build a nice house outfitted to the demands of the planning official in his city. For the future, Alphonse would like to build another house for renting out and to cover the cost of education for his children.

loans.use: to buy cement and paint for renovating his house and paying for labor

loans.name: Felisa Magaly

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal Camino Al Progreso se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Felisa, tiene 32 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro  hijos de 15, 13, 10 y 7 años de edad, dos mayores estudian en colegio y los menores en escuela. Su esposo es albañil.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa por catalogo, productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas) y tarjetas telefónicas. Trabaja los fines de semana, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada domingo. Sus productos los recibe en su casa. Lleva diez años que se dedica a esta actividad y le va muy bien, lo que más vende son los perfumes tanto de hombre como de damas ya que son muy buenos.
	
Este crédito es para comprar perfumes, cremas, cosméticos, ropa y tarjetas telefónicas. Este es el sexto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer.
 
Sus sueños son ver que sus hijos terminen sus estudios.
texts.en:
The Camino Al Progreso [Road to Progress] community bank meets every two weeks in the Montecristi canton. It is known for its rich pre-colonial tradition and for its artisanal crafts at the national and international level. It is where the famous paja toquilla hats come from.

This is where Felisa lives. She is 32 years old. She is married and has four children, aged 15, 13, 10 and 7. The two oldest go to high school and the youngest are in elementary school. Her husband is a bricklayer.  

She is a housewife who to make her own income sells clothes via catalogue, Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories ) as well as telephone cards. She works weekends, selling her products on credit and collecting every Sunday. She receives the products in her home. She has been doing this activity for ten years and it is going very well for her. What she sells the most are mens and women's perfume, which are very good. 
	
This loan is to buy perfume, creams, cosmetics, clothes and telephone cards. This is her sixth cycle in the community bank and she likes it because the payments are easy to make. 
 
Her dream is to see her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy perfume, cream, cosmetics, clothes and telephone cards.

loans.name: Shamigul

texts.ru: Шамигул жительница Яванского района. Ей 39 лет. Она замужем. У нее четверо детей. Ее муж занимается ремонтом телевизоров, магнитофонов и dvd. Сама она уже 13 лет занимается торговлей на рынке. Шамигул арендует торговую точку, где продает детскую одежду и обувь. Она берет кредит для покупки сезонного товара.
texts.en: Shamigul lives in the Yavan region. She is 39 years old and married, with four children. Her husband repairs televisions, tape records and DVD players. For 13 years, she has been a seller in the market. Shamigul rents a shop where she sells children's clothing and shoes. She is requesting a loan to purchase seasonal goods.

loans.use: Purchase seasonal goods

loans.name: Olga

texts.es:
Olga Está aplicando a su segundo credikiva porque va a realizar adecuaciones locativas que generen un ambiente confortable a sus clientes. Con su primer credikiva quedó contenta porque comprá en volumen materias primas e insumos, compró utensilios e hizo reparaciones locativas tambien. Poco a poco su negocio va tomando imagen agradable y muy seguramente su clientela aumentará, porque les gusta la comida de Olga. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente:
"Gracias por la oportunidad que me brindaron para  poder fortalecer mi negocio ya que tenia créditos informales muy costosos, además compraba en las tiendas del barrio en pocas cantidades y salia mas caro." Si usted quiere leer la historia de Olga ingrese al siguiente enlace:

http://kiva.org/lend/219330
texts.en:
Olga is applying for her second loan with Kiva because she wants to make improvements to her business premises in order to provide her customerswith a more comfortable environment. She was happy with her first loan with Kiva because she was able to buy raw materials and ingredients wholesale, as well as utensils, and she made some repairs to the premises. Her business is slowly looking much better and her customer base is likely to grow, because they enjoy Olga's food. 

Her message to Kiva's lenders is: "Thanks for the opportunity that you gave me to strengthen my business. I had to resort to very costly private loans before and had to buy small quantities in local shops, which was more expensive". If you'd like to read Olga's full story please visit http://kiva.org/lend/219330.

loans.use: to improve her business premises to provide her customers with a comfortable atmosphere.

loans.name: Nikoloz

texts.en:
Nikoloz is from the village Martkopi, Gardabani District. He is 55 years old and lives with his family: his wife – Eter, two adult daughters (24 and 20 years old) and his 83-year-old mother. Nikoloz’s elder daughter is a math teacher and the younger one is an English language teacher. 

Nikoloz works as operator in a local petrol station. Along with his main job, he is actively involved in the family agro business. The family owns one cow. They sell milk locally. Also they have hens and sell eggs. 

Nikoloz requested credit to start up a new agro business. He plans to purchase 5-6 calves, raise them and sell the grown calves by spring at a higher price. The income received from the calves’ sales will be reinvested in dairy farm expansion – Nikoloz will purchase an additional milk cow and increase the family income, as he will sell double the amount of milk.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
45-year-old Marilyn is from the town of Sto. Niño, South Cotabato. She is married and has 3 children aged 20, 19 and 11. Marilyn’s husband is a farmer.

Marilyn is a “balut” (a boiled fertilized egg famous in the Philippines) maker. She has had this business for 7 years now. Marilyn also helps her husband grow rice on their land and raises pigs in their backyard. Marilyn has requested this loan to buy more duck eggs, pig feeds, and fertilizers. Marilyn hopes that their businesses will grow. She also hopes to be able to fund her 2 children’s college education.

loans.use: to buy more duck eggs, pig feeds, and fertilizers

loans.name: Dominga

texts.en:
Dominga makes a living by raising hogs: a mother pig and piglets in her backyard.  

Her income from selling some of her hogs helped her start up a variety store which gives her a net income of P300 daily. 

Dominga is requests a loan of P13,000 to maintain her hog raising activities.

Dominga is 32 years old businesswoman who aims to improve her business.  She is married and has three school-aged children.  Their family lives happily in the village of La Salette province of Isabela.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pig.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 60 years old and lives in Binuangan, Oroquietq City. She is married with three children. 

Teresita has business buying and selling Ready-To-Wear clothing and earns approximately PHP 5,000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase more clothes for her clothing business. 

Teresita has been a member of PMPC for five years.

loans.use: to purchase more clothes for her clothing business.

loans.name: Erasmo Antonio

texts.es:
En el municipio de Amaga, situado en el departamento de Antioquia vive Erasmo Antonio, un microempresario de 67 años de edad, que desde hace 30 años creo su propia microempresa para sacar adelante a su familia, y ahora es el negocio de todos juntos y su principal fuente de empleo, fabrican y venden velas y velones en varios municipios del Suroeste antioqueño.

Actualmente solicitó un crédito para invertir en capital de trabajo, como comprar materia prima pabilos, papel celofán y parafina ya que debe ir preparando su inventario para la época y el día de las velitas en Navidad.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Amaga located in Antioquia Department lives Erasmo Antonio, a 67-year-old micro businessman who started his own micro business thirty years ago to support his family.  Now, it’s a family business for all of them and a source of employment.  They manufacture and sell candles and large votive candles in various towns in southeast Antioquia.

He is asking for a loan at present to invest in working capital.  He will buy raw materials like candle wicks, cellophane paper and paraffin because he has to start getting his stock inventory ready for the Christmas season's Day of the Little Candles [one of the most observed traditional holidays of Colombia. It is celebrated on December 7] .

loans.use: to buy candle making raw materials.

loans.name: Raina

texts.fr:
Raina est une femme âgée de 31 ans. Elle est mariée å un chauffeur. Elle a 2 enfants, dont 1 à l’école. Le premier a 10 ans et le dernier a 2 ans.  
Raina travaille comme revendeuse depuis 2007. Elle revend des pagnes, des chaussures et du charbon pour tout client de façon  ambulante. Elle achète les produits à Lomé. Elle travaille seule. Au moment, elle n’a aucune difficulté. 
Raina a requis son 1er  crédit de WAGES afin d’acheter des pagnes, des chaussures et du charbon. Elle veut réinvestir dans l’activité. 
Dans les prochaines années, Raina voudrait élargir son activité. Elle dit qu’avec les profits, elle prévoit  s’occuper de sa famille.
texts.en:
Raina is a 31-year-old woman. She is married to a driver. She has two children, one of whom is in school. The elder is 10, the younger 2 years old. 

Raina has been working as a retailer since 2007. She walks around selling pagnes [traditional wraps], shoes and charcoal to all her customers. She buys her products in Lomé. She works alone. For now, she doesn't have any problems.

Raina requested this first loan with WAGES in order to buy pagnes, shoes and charcoal. She wants to reinvest in the business. 

In the coming years, Raina would like to grow her business. She says that with the profits, she intends to look after her family.

loans.use: to buy pagnes, shoes and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Khaka Shg Group

texts.en:
Anthony is the facilitator of the Khaka SHG group. Anthony and his group joined One Acre Fund in the year 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program.

Anthony takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund to access One Acre Fund’s best prices, ensure food security for his family and later educate them. In the recent 2011 season, Anthony had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on ½ acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Anthony was only able to harvest 2½ bags of maize on ½ acre of land.

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Anthony and his group during Kenya’s next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs is part of One Acre Fund’s integrated agriculture package, which includes training, reliable input supply (such as fertilizer and seeds), credit and insurance.

With income from his maize sales, Anthony will educate his children and invest in livestock rearing.

In 2012, the members of Khaka SHG group will each plant maize plots between ½ and 1 acre of land.

loans.use: To source farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Umoja Shg Group

texts.en:
Denis is the facilitator of the Umoja SHG group. Denis and his group joined One Acre Fund in 2011 and will re-enroll in the 2012 program. 

Denis takes care of eight children at home. He joined One Acre Fund due to One Acre Fund's low prices and in order to ensure food security for his family. In the recent 2011 season, Denis had an excellent maize yield harvesting 10 bags on half an acre of land. Before joining One Acre Fund, Denis was only able to harvest three bags of maize on that land. 

With this loan, One Acre Fund will purchase fertilizer, seeds, and other important inputs to distribute to Denis and his group during Kenya's next planting season in February 2012. The distribution of farming inputs such as fertilizer and seed is part of One Acre Fund's integrated agriculture package, which also includes training, credit, and insurance. 

With the income from maize sales, Denis will educate his children and build a house. 

In 2012, the members of Umoja SHG group will each plant maize plots between one half and one acre of land. 

In the photograph above, Denis is pictured with his group members.

loans.use: To buy farming inputs, such as seeds and fertilizer, at low prices for the 2012 planting season.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 32 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 4 children. 

Jane has a food shop, or carenderia, that sells viands like afritada and caldereta. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for 5,000 PHP to buy raw ingredients for making viands. Jane has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. 

In the future, Jane hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for making viands

loans.name: Gene Lou

texts.en:
Gene Lou is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. 

Gene Lou has had a food shop or "sari-sari" store for 5 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell. Gene Lou is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a 28-year-old married woman. She has three children between one and nine years old. She describes herself as an honest woman. 

Judy operates a retail store where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a densely populated area and she has both repeat and new customers. She says her biggest business challenge is insufficient funds for improving the retail store. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to be a wholesaler within five years.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Abubakar

texts.en:
Abubakar, a 37-year-old married man with the responsibility of looking after his children, used his previous loan to buy fuel and building materials such as sand, bricks and stones to sell. The resulting profits enabled him to diversify his business and provide the basics for his family.

Still facing the challenge of limited funds to meet increasing customer demand, Abubakar is requesting this loan to buy more fuel, sand, bricks, and stones for resale.

loans.use: to buy fuel, sand, bricks, and stones for resale.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser una persona muy trabajadora, y siempre busca ofrecerle un mejor bienestar a su familia. Carlos se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a la venta de mercancía, y actualmente tiene una choza a las afueras de un negocio de calzado donde ofrece mercancía como bolsos, sombrillas, medias y cacharro. Carlos, gracias a esto, genera los ingresos necesarios para su hogar. Carlos siempre ha querido ofrecer mayor variedad de productos a sus clientes, por lo que trabaja fuertemente con el ánimo de conseguirlo. Es por esto que Carlos busca que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de mercancía que le permita surtir su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

Carlos espera que de esta manera sus ingresos aumenten considerablemente, pues podrá atender diferentes necesidades de sus clientes. Además, espera que con esto se pueda ubicar en un local donde pueda protegerse de la lluvia y hacer su negocio más atractivo para los clientes.

loans.use: Compra de mercancía que le permita surtir su negocio y ofrecer mayor variedad a sus clientes.

loans.name: Innocent

texts.en:
Innocent aged 37 years. He is married with 4 children aged between 1 and 11 years.2 of them go to school. She is a farmer and he has been growing maize for the past 15 years. While her husband is a business man. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to pay workers who harvested maize. The profits from the business will be used to buy a apiece of land. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain under served by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To pay workers who harvested maize.

loans.name: Marcia

texts.es:
Marcia es de la ciudad de Pilar, ella está estudiando la carrera de nutrición, actualmente se encuentra en el cuarto año de la carrera.
Comenta que su meta es poder terminar su carrera y ser una profesional útil a la sociedad. Es una persona que pone todo de sí para poder ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de las cuotas de su carrera, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios.

loans.use: Pagar cuotas de la carrera.

loans.name: James

texts.en: Mr. James D. is a serious and business-minded young man seeking a loan of $800.00 from Kiva to help him expand his operations. The demand for the goods he sells (soaps, biscuits, tins of milk, fish etc.) in his locality is very high and he wants to take advantage of this opportunity and make the most out of it. He is very hardworking and can pay back the loan. Thanks to KSF, he can now manage loans effectively and knows how to keep simple records.

loans.use: working capital to expand his sales

loans.name: Tomasa

texts.en:
Tomasa sells imitation jewelry and cosmetics in her neighborhood and in rural villages. She got into the business by helping a friend with her sales. At first she only sold jewelry like rings, chains, and bracelets, but now she sells these products as well as cosmetics and purses.

Tomasa hopes to sell electric appliances such as rice cookers, irons, and mixers since her customers are asking for these products.

Tomasa is 37 years old, has 3 children and is separated. It has been hard for her to get ahead in life because she can only depend on her business to support her family. She hopes that this loan will stabilize her business and give her more security in life.

Tomasa se dedica a la venta de bisuteria y cosmeticos en su sector y en pueblos rurales. Ella empezo el negocio ayudando en las ventas de Bisuteria a una amiga. Al principio solo vendia Bisuteria como anillos, cadenas y pulseras, pero ahora continua vendiendo estos productos junto con cosmeticos y carteras. Tomasa aspira vender productos eléctricos como ollas arroceras, planchas y batidoras ya que sus clientes le estan demandando estos productos. Tomasa tien 37 años, es separada y tiene 3 hijos. Le ha sido muy duro salir adelante con su familia porque ella depende totalmente de su negocio para mentener a sus hijos. Ella tiene la esperanza que con este prestamo podra establecerse su negocio y tener un poco mas de estabilidad y seguridad en su vida.

loans.use: Purchase home electric appliances

loans.name: Zeyneb

texts.en: Zeyneb E. sells shoes and sandals at the local bazaar in the town of Khachmaz which is located on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Zeyneb is looking for funding so that she can increase the stock of her inventory.

loans.use: To increase her shoe store's inventory.

loans.name: Heng

texts.en: Mr. Heng V. is 35 years old and works as a mechanic in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.  He earns $3.80/day, and his wife earns $2.70/day working at a nearby garment factory.  This loan will be used to build a home for the couple and their only child.

loans.use: To build a house

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maria del Carmen became a widow 9 years ago. She has a son and she lives in the town of Reinosa, Tamaupilas. Three years ago, she needed to finance her family's economic growth with a small amount of cash. She decided to invest in her own taco outlet. Slowly, her product became popular, thanks to its great quality, and her business began to grow. She has added new products to her menu that have pleased her customers.

In order for her business to continue to grow she needs to stack up more ingredients and pay for location improvements. She is requesting a loan in the amount of US$650.00. She commits to pay it back in 6 months. Today, you can help someone that really needs assistance. Maria truly appreciates it.

Translated from Spanish by Bertolt Cantalice, Kiva Volunteer

Maria del Carmen enviudó hace 9 años, tiene un hijo y viven en la localidad de Reynosa en Tamaulipas, para sacar adelante a su familia con el poco dinero que tenía Maria decidió emprender su propio negocio con la venta de tacos desde hace tres años, poco a poco fue dándose a conocer y la buena calidad de sus productos le ha permitido crecer con su negocio, ahora ha incorporado la venta de novedades, obteniendo muy buena respuesta de sus clientes.

Para continuar creciendo con su negocio, comprar insumos y mejorar las condiciones en las que se encuentra su local Maria está solicitando un préstamo de $ 650 dólares que se compromete a regresar en 6 meses. Hoy puedes ayudar a quien más lo necesita, Maria te lo agradece sinceramente.

loans.use: Compra de insumos y remodelación

loans.name: Sharif

texts.en:
K. Sharif is an active client of Microinvest. He is 46 years old and has 3 children. His business is to repair travelling gears of cars. Before the collapse of the USSR he worked as an engineer in a factory. Today he rents a premises for his business. He has many clients and the turnover of his business is good.

However, he faces the problem of his repair equipment eroding and is therefore requesting a KIVA loan to purchase more equipment.

loans.use: Purchasing car repair equipment

loans.name: Faaleo

texts.en: Faaleo is a 64 year old mother from the village of Puipaa. She has a second-hand refrigerator, which prompted her to begin an ice cake business with the help of SPBD loans. Her husband does not work and there is no other source of income for her to support her family and children. Faaleo plans to use this loan to buy materials to make the ice cakes. She is looking forward to selling her goods at school and also to the village people. She will work six days of the week and she is looking to earn $100 WST ($40 USD) or more a week.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her bakery

loans.name: Nayyer's Group

texts.en:
I am Nayyer I.. I was born and brought up in Pakpattan, a small town in Pakistan. I am not educated but my husband has finished tenth grade. Therefore, all of my kids (three daughters) are completing their studies. My husband is a farmer and I embroider and stitch. This would be my second loan. This time we require capital to buy pesticides for our fields. Shabana B. requests this loan for their snooker club. Koser P. will invest the loan in her son’s agricultural products business. Haleema S. wants to buy an embroidery machine. Gulshan I. would use this loan in their shoes store. Riffat B. also requests loan for her business. I hope these loans will do well for our businesses.
Nayyer I.

loans.use: To buy pesticides for our field

loans.name: Tatu's Tushirikiane Group

texts.en:
Tatu is 30 years old and is single. Tatu owns a food vendor store which she started in 2006. She works every day from 6 am to 5 pm at her business.

In the past, Tatu has taken out one successful loan from BRAC Tanzania to expand her business. She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items for her business. She will share this loan with her subgroup members, who have businesses dealing in genge (small food vendors) and drinks selling.

loans.use: To buy more food items
